loans.name: Mujeres De Chinimabe Group

texts.es: Doña Gloria Esperanza M. P., es una señora casada, tiene 1 hijo D. edad D. 1 y 6 meses, ella apoya económicamente a su familia y prepararle un mejor futuro a su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta D. artículos D. consumo diario actividad que ha venido realizando desD. hace más D. 10 años, doña Gloria se dio cuenta que necesitaba surtir mas su negocio, para poder mejorar las ventas y así obtener un poco mas D. ganancias, por lo cual ella reunió a algunas vecinas, desD. hace mas D. 15 años se apoyan entre sí y deciden conformar un grupo, ya que ella trata D. apoyar no solo a su familia si no que también a las personas D. su aldea, sabiendo que solo así se pueden vivir en una mejor sociedad.
texts.en:
Gloria Esperanza M. P. is married and has a one and a half year old son. She contributes to her family’s financial support and strives to prepare a better future for her son. She sells daily use items, a job she’s had for over 10 years. Gloria realized that she needed to improve her stock so that sales would increase thereby producing higher profits. So she got together with a few neighbors and for the last 15 years they have supported each other and formed into a group. She tries to help out not just her family but the other people in her village because she realizes that this is the only way they can live in a better society.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cacao and orange plants to increase crops.

loans.name: Mujeres De Triunfo 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Damasa is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres D. Triunfo 1 & 2 (Women of Triumph). She makes her home in a simple structure with her longterm partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to see her children become professionals, because university in the Dominican Republic is too expensive.

Damasa is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying household products and cosmetics. She will use the profits to plan in the future to build her house and install running water. At present, she doesn't have this service in her house.

As a child, Damasa saw in her poor community how children work in the landfill and don't attend school. Her dream is to build a daycare or orphanage for them. “Having a good business and with Esperanza, I know I will see this dream come true.”, she says. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying living in harmony with her neighbors.

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in Santiago, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic, and an area famous for its tobacco and beef production. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and household products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cacao and orange plants.

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es: Celinda tiene 63 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y una de sus hijas, ya que sus dos hijos son mayores e independientes. Ella se dedica en la venta de comida en uno de los mercados mas concurridos de la localidad donde vive. Su forma de trabajo consiste en captar clientes que trabajan en un conocido mercado, en donde ofrece ciertos platillos y a pedido los prepara para luego distribuirlos. Es por ello que obtiene ingresos diarios, resultándole muy rentable este negocio, pero el tener que trasladar las viandas de comida hasta el puesto de cada comerciante le es muy pesado y difícil. Celinda se siente contenta con su trabajo, y día a día se esfuerza para lograr hacerlo bien. Es su treceavo crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que recibirá, comprará mayor cantidad de productos para facilitarle la preparación de comida.
texts.en:
Celinda, 63, lives in her own home with her husband and one of her three children - the other two children are grown and live alone. Celinda sells food at one of the more popular markets in the area. Her customers are market workers to whom she delivers custom made dishes. Her business does quite well, but the food containers can be heavy and hard to transport, making delivery difficult. Celinda loves her job, and works hard every day to do it well. This is her 13th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to make timely payments. With the loan, she wants to buy more food preparation materials.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying food prep materials

loans.name: Jorge Heriberto

texts.es:
Jorge Heriberto A. B. tiene 33 años.  Es soltero vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. Tiene 2 hijos, Darwin (12) y Jessica (10). 

Jorge  es un socio de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao y naranja. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en Matilde Esther.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao y naranja para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño incrementar la producción para tener dinero para comprar una casa. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta hacer deporte y celebrar las fiestas de la localidad.
texts.en:
Jorge Heriberto A. B., 33, is single and lives in Chillanes canton located in Recinto San José, Estero Salado parish. He has two children: Darwin, 12, and Jessica, 10. Jorge is a member of the Fronteras Unidas (United Frontiers) communal bank located fifteen minutes from Estero Salado parish, two hours from the Chillanes agency. It has 19 members who are farmers. Jorge farms cacao and oranges. He makes his purchases monthly in Matilde Esther and his sales are there too. He is asking for funds to buy cacao and orange plants to expand his crops. He feels that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to increase production in order to have enough money to buy a house. The challenge he faces is during harvest because rains damaged the access roads. He likes to play sports and celebrate the local festivals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cacao and orange plants to increase his business.

loans.name: Daira Susana

texts.es:
Daira C. Machacón tiene 38 años y vive en el Municipio de Santa Rosa en el departamento de Bolívar. Ella es una gran gestora de beneficios comunitarios y forma parte  de un grupo de mujeres organizadas en la Fundación Mujeres emprendedoras de su municipio. 

Daira tiene un negocio que consiste en vender mercancía que embellece, ropa y calzado; tiene una hija de 19 años  que  actualmente estudia administración de empresas en la universidad, y es justamente una de sus motivaciones por la cual inició su negocio hace 4 años, pues quiere darle todo lo necesario para que viva en buenas condiciones, porque es  Daira la que responde por todo en su hogar.

Cuando inició su negocio lo hizo mediante el sistema de recibo de  mercancía a consignación;  pero gradualmente organizó su propio capital de trabajo y decidió hacer Compras directamente, para con el dinero disponible obtener buenos descuentos; así fue como empezó a   vender sabanas, collares, perfumes y desodorantes. 

Daira ha  recibido 3 créditos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con ellos ha incrementado su clientela y por consiguiente sus ganancias han crecido  día a día.  En la actualidad solicita un crédito por valor de $2.100.000 COP.para comprar mercancia como brasier, sabanas, collares y una vitrina para guardar los productos de manera mas segura y protegida. Su sueño es ver crecer su negocio, estudiar y tener su casa propia, pero más que sus aspiraciones personales,  Daira espera ver a su hija en un futuro como una mujer muy exitosa.
texts.en:
Daira C. Machacón, 38, lives in Santa Rosa township, Bolívar department. She is a great provider of community benefits and is part of a group of women who are organized in their locality’s Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women) Foundation. She has a business that consists in selling merchandise that beautifies: clothing and footwear. She has a 19-year-old daughter who is studying Business Administration in the university. She is precisely one of the motivating factors that impelled her to start her business four years ago because she wants to provide her with everything necessary to live under good conditions because Daira is responsible for everything in her home. When she started her business she worked receiving merchandise on consignment. Gradually she organized her own working capital and decided to buy directly so that she could use her funds to get good discounts. This is how she started to sell sheets, necklaces, perfumes and deodorants. Daira has gotten 3 loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that have helped her increase her customer base. This has led to daily increasing profits. She is asking now for a 2.100.000 COP loan to buy more merchandise like: brassieres, sheets, necklaces as well as a display case in which to keep her merchandise safe and secure. Her dream is to see her business grow, to study and have her own home. But, more than her personal aspirations, Daira hopes to see her daughter become a very successful woman in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like: brassieres, sheets and necklaces as well as a display case in which to keep the products secure and protected.

loans.name: Apolonia Alejandrina

texts.es:
Apolonia tiene 48 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el sector Tocororo, perteneciente al distrito de Pueblo Nuevo, provincia de Chepén, en la región La Libertad, una zona ubicada a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores relacionadas a la agricultura desde hace ocho años, ella cuenta con un terreno agrícola de 0.5 hectáreas en el cual suele sembrar todo tipo de granos, en esta oportunidad ella ha sembrado maíz, y esta trabajando arduamente para que su cultivo pueda brindar una buena producción. Es siguiendo este objetivo que ella desea amplicar a su cultivo abonos y foliares, por ello ha solcicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Apolonia es una mujer empeñosa y que da lo mejor de si para sacar a su familia adelante, su mayor anhelo es obtener una buena coseha que le permita seguir trabajando para lograr el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Apolonia, 48, lives with her family in Tocororo which is part of Pueblo Nuevo, Chepén province, La Libertad region. It is an area located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. For eight years she has been involved in farming related activities. She has a 0.5 hectare plot of farm land where she grows all kinds of grains. On this occasion, she has planted corn and is working hard to insure a productive harvest. It is in order to reach this goal that she needs to apply manures and fertilizers so she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol, loan. Apolonia is a dedicated woman who gives the best of herself to help her family get ahead in life. Her greatest wish is to obtain a good harvest that will allow her to continue working towards attaining her family’s wellbeing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and leaf fertilizers for her corn crops.

loans.name: Miguel Eduardo

texts.es:
Miguel Eduardo A. T. tiene 33 años.  Es soltero vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. Tiene 1 hijo, Jeferson (1). 

Miguel  es un socio de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Miguel se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao y maracuya. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en Matilde Esther.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao y maracuya para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño incrementar la producción del negocio. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta criar chanchos.
texts.en:
Miguel Eduardo A. T. is 33 years old, single, and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the village of San Jose Estero Salado. Has a son named Jefferson. Michael is a member of the rural bank "Fronteras Unidas" which is located fifteen minutes from the village Estero Salado and two hours from Chillanes. This communal bank has 19 members and most are farmers. Miguel is a farmer who cultivates cacao and passion fruit. He makes his purchases and sales in Esther Matilda every month. He is taking out a loan to buy cacao and passion fruit to plant and to grow his business. Miguel thinks that the loan is an opportunity for him to get ahead and he dreams of increasing production. At harvest time he faces challenges because the access roads get damaged by rain. He likes raising pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cacao and passion fruit to plant and grow his business.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Descripción:	El Comité de Mujeres Kuña Katupyry, se conformó en julio de 2008, con mujeres muy trabajadoras en una zona poco favorecida con el desarrollo económico.
 A lo largo de los tres años que vienen obteniendo el crédito, han pasado han procurado siempre estar al día con sus cuotas.
 Este comité se encuentra en un zona que no tiene mucho movimiento comercial, por lo que las señoras deben trasladarse a otras ciudades para vendes sus productos. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Floriana quien se dedica  a las manualidades para obtener un ingreso. 
Ella realiza bordados sobre telas, vestidos, también realiza manualidades fabricando sobrecamas, manteles, y otros.
Sus clientes aprecian mucho los trabajos que ella realiza, ya que tiene una buena terminación y son muy delicados.
La familia de la señora Floriana es muy humilde y su casa necesita de algunas comodidades, por que solicita el préstamo para la comprar camas para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Description: The communal bank "Kuña Katupyry", was formed in July 2008 by hard-working women in an area not favored with economic development. During the past three years of taking out loans, they have always tried to keep up with their payments. This communal bank is in an area that does not get much business, so the women have to go to other cities to sell their products. One of the members is Mrs Floriana who makes crafts for a living. She embroiderers fabrics and clothing and also makes crafts like bedspreads, tablecloths, and other things. Her customers greatly appreciate her work because it has a good finish and is very delicate. Mrs. Floriana's family is very humble and her house is lacking in some comforts which is why she is taking out a loan -- to buy beds for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beds.

loans.name: Nyaibanda Savings & Credit Group

texts.en:
Peter is a 44-year-old farmer who wants a loan to buy Irish potatoes seedlings to plant next season. He is the father of eight children and the family lives in a semi-permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda.

Peter is a farmer who has been in business for twenty years, but he faces the problem of unstable prices for agricultural products. He dreams of educating his children and building a better house for them.

Peter is a member of Nyaibanda Savings & Credit group; in his group each member guarantees the others since most of them do not have collateral security to pledge for individual loans. Each member guarantees the others based on their characters.

loans.use: To buy Irish potato seedlings to plant

loans.name: Fausto Euclides

texts.es:
Fausto Euclides F. M. tiene 36 años.  Es soltero vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. Tiene 1 hijo, Tamara (4). 

Fausto  es un socio de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Fausto se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en Matilde Esther.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño incrementar la producción para el bienestar de la familia. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta celebrar las fiestas.
texts.en:
Fausto Euclides F. M. is 36 years old. He is single and lives in Chillanes Canton, Recinto San Jose, Estero Salado Parish. He has 1 daughter, Tamara, who is 4 years old. Fausto is a member of the rural communal bank "Fronteras Unidas" (United Borders), which is located fifteen minutes from Estero Salado Parish and two hours from the agency in Chillanes. The communal bank is made up of 19 members. The community members make their livings in agriculture. Fausto also makes his living in agriculture; he farms cacao. He makes his purchases each month in Matilde Esther, and he makes his sales in Matilde Esther as well. He is requesting the loan to purchase cocoa beans to plant and thereby grow his business. He believes that the loan will give him an opportunity to get ahead. He hopes to increase his farming production for the well-being of his family. The challenge he faces is during harvest time, which is when the roads are damaged by the rain. He likes to celebrate the local festivals.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cocoa beans to plant and thereby grow his business.

loans.name: Aida Marisela

texts.es:
Aida Marisela G. M. tiene 44 años.  Es soltero vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. Tiene 1 hijo, Edwin (15). 

Aida  es una socia de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Aida se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao y criar aves. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en Matilde Esther.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao ycomprar aves de corral  para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño incrementar la producción para el bienestar de la familia. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta criar animales, la agricultura y celebrar las fiestas de la localidad.
texts.en:
Aida Marisela G. M. is 44 years old. She is single and lives in Chillanes Canton, Recinto San Jose, Estero Salado Parish. She has 1 son, Edwin, who is 15. Aida is a member of the rural communal bank "Fronteras Unidas" (United Borders), which is located 25 minutes from Estero Salado Parish and two hours from the agency in Chillanes. This bank is made up of 19 members. The community members make their livings in agriculture. Aida also makes her living in agriculture; she farms cacao and raises fowl. She makes her purchases each month in Matilde Esther and makes her sales in Matilde Esther as well. She is requesting the loan to be able to purchase cacoa beans to plant and fowl to grow her business. She believes the loan will be an opportunity for her to get ahead. She hopes to increase her production for the well-being of her family. The challenge she faces is during harvest time, which is when the roads are damaged by the rain. She likes to raise animals, farm and celebrate the local festivals.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cocoa beans to plant and fowl to grow her business.

loans.name: Galuth Ernestina

texts.es:
Galuth Ernestina R. F. tiene 32 años.  Es soltera vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. Tiene 1 hijo, Wilson (15). 

Galuth  es una socia de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Galuth se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en Matilde Esther.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño incrementa la producción la tener mayores ingresos. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta la agricultura y celebrar las fiestas de la localidad.
texts.en:
Galuth Ernestina R. F. is 32 years old. She is single and lives in the parish of Estero Salado in the Ecuadorean canton of Chillanes. She has one son, Wilson, 15. Galuth is a member of the Fronteras Unidas rural outreach program in Estero Salado, some two hours from the agency office in the town of Chillanes. The group has 19 members. Many of the people in the area make a living from farming. Galuth is among those whose livelihood depends on farming. She grows cacao. She buys and sells in Matilde Esther. Galuth is applying for a loan to buy cacao seeds so that she can grow her business. She knows the loan is a chance for her to improve her standard of living and she expects to increase her production and, in turn, her income. Galuth enjoys farming and local festivals.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Pedro Ibar

texts.es:
Pedro de 54 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar habitado por comerciantes informales), el tiene un taller de cerrajería en su casa, desde hace 20 años atrás. 

Para poder mantener a su familia comenzó a trabajar como cerrajero desde hace años, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora el trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 16h00pm, reparando y haciendo puertas de todo tipo. Sus tres hijos lo ayudan en el negocio para hacer mas rapido el trabajo. 

Para poder tener mas clientela el necesita comprar metales para puertas con el préstamo, y en el futuro quiere construir mejor su vivienda y tener su local propio.
texts.en:
Pedro is 54 years old. He lives in the Guasmo neighborhood of Guayaquil (a place where many businessmen work in the informal economy). He has operated a locksmith business from his house for 20 years. Pedro started the business all those years ago to support his family. He has worked ever since, from 7:00 in the morning to 4:00 in the afternoon, repairing and installing hardware on doors. His three children help him with the business so that he can complete jobs faster. Pedro needs the loan to buy supplies for the business so that he can pick up new customers. In the future, he wants to make improvements to his house and set up a separate shop for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for locksmith business.

loans.name: Luis Vicente

texts.es:
Luis Vicente V. S. tiene 52 años.  Es soltero vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. Tiene 1 hijo, Jose (9). 

Luis  es un socio de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao y naranja. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en Matilde Esther.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao y naranja para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño incrementar la producción de cacao. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta celebrar las fiestas de la localidad.
texts.en:
Luis Vincente V. S. is 52 years old. He is single and lives in the parish of Estero Salado in the Ecuadorean canton of Chillanes. He has one son, Jose, 9. Luis is a member of the Fronteras Unidas rural outreach program in Estero Salado, some two hours from the agency office in the town of Chillanes. The group has 19 members. Many of the people in the area make a living from farming. Luis is among those who farm for a living. He grows cacao and oranges. He buys and sells in Matilde Esther. Luis is applying for a loan to plant more cacao and oranges and, in turn, increase his income. He knows the loan is a chance to improve his standard of living. His greatest wish is to increase his production of cacao. The most difficult challenge he faces is at the harvest when the roads are damaged by heavy rains. Luis enjoys the local festivals.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana de 61 años de edad, vive solo con sus hijos  Richard de 41, Aníbal de 23, Carlos de 39, y Revelino de 31 años de edad, pues es viuda. Hace más de 23 años se dedica en la venta de comida, en un puesto que se encuentra ubicado dentro de uno de los mercados mas concurridos de su localidad. Gracias a sus grandes dotes culinarias este trabajo le ha resultado muy rentable, pues no dejan de venir sus clientes, quienes se deleitan de su gran sazón, es por ello que se siente contenta con el trabajo que realiza. En lo sucesivo desea mejorar el aspecto de su negocio, comprando mesas, ampliando el espacio que tiene para ofrecer más comodidad a su clientela. Ella sabe que con mucho esfuerzo logrará cumplir todas sus metas. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que asegura será muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará ingredientes para poder preparar sus platillos sin dificultad y así ganar mejor clientela.
texts.en:
Maximiliana, 61, is a widow and lives with her children, Richard (41), Aníbal (23), Carlos (39), and Revelino (31). For more than 23 years, she has sold food at a little stall located in a very popular market in her neighborhood. Thanks to her great cooking abilities, Maximiliana's business has flourished - her clients, who love her food, never stop coming to her stall. Maximiliana loves what she does. In the future, she would like to improve her stall by buying some tables and chairs and expanding the exterior space so that her customers are comfortable. She knows that with effort, she will accomplish all her goals. This is her second loan with Kiva partner, MFP, and she promises to make all her payments on time. With this loan, she will buy ingredients to continue preparing food for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José tiene 42 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Jucuapa, departamento de usulutan, es casado, tiene dos hijas de 14 y 6 años, tiene un taller de carpintería.
tiene veinte años de experiencia en el trabajo, fabrica muebles para el hogar, es una persona que le gusta el trabajo que realiza, actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para compra una cierra y el resto para compra de madera de cedro,clavos, pegamentos de madera. Este crédito le permitirá adquirir una herramienta que le permitirá realizar mejor el trabajo, contar con madera para fabricar muebles, y luego venderlos.
Los objetivos de José son fortalecer el taller, ofrecer a los clientes muebles, para generar ingresos y mejora el sistema de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Jose, 42, lives in Jucuapa in the Salvadoran "departamento" of Usulutan. He is married and has two daughters who are 14 and 6 years old, respectively. He makes furniture in a carpentry shop that he has operated for twenty years. Jose is a man who enjoys what he does. He is applying for a loan, partly to buy a saw and partly to buy cedarwood, nails and wooden pegs. The loan will allow him to buy a tool that he needs to improve his work and the raw materials he needs to build the furniture that he sells. Jose's goals are to strengthen the business and provide his customers with products that will increase his income and, in turn, his family's standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools and raw materials for furniture manufacturing business.

loans.name: Ángela Consuelo

texts.es:
Ángela Consuelo C. S. tiene 36 años.  Es casada vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. Tiene 10 hijos, Juana (21), Geovany (19), Angela (16), Maria (16), Mirian (15), Jesús (12), Adrian (10), Jhonatan (8), Jenny (6) Evelin (5) y Brenda (3).

Ángela  es una socia de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Ángela  se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en Matilde Esther y Naranjito.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño incrementar la producción para que los ingresos aumenten y comprar un terreno. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta celebrar las fiestas de la localidad en el mes de noviembre.
texts.en:
Angela Consuelo Chiimbo S. is 36 years old. She is married and lives in the parish of Estero Salado in the Ecuadorean canton of Chillanes. She has ten children: Juana, 21; Geovany, 19; Angela, 16; Maria, 16; Mirian, 15; Jesus, 12; Adrian, 10; Jhonatan, 8; Jenny, 6; Evelin, 5; and Brenda, 3. Angela is a member of the Fronteras Unidas rural outreach program in Estero Salado, some two hours from the agency office in the town of Chillanes. The group has 19 members. Many of the people in the area make a living from farming. Angela is among those who farm for a living. She grows cacao. She buys in Matilde Esther and sells in Matilde Esther and Naranjito. Angela is applying for a loan so she can plant more cacao and, in turn, increase her income. She knows the loan is a chance to improve her standard of living. Her greatest wish is to increase her cacao crop and, in turn, her income so that can buy more land. The biggest challenge she faces is at the harvest when the roads are damaged by heavy rains. Angela enjoys the local festivals that are held in November.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Fausto Leonardo

texts.es:
Fausto Leonardo A. V. tiene 43 años.  Es casado vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. Tiene 11 hijos, Juana (21), Geovany (19), Angela (16), Maria (16), Mirian (15), Jesús (12), Adrian (10), Jhonatan (8), Jenny (6) Evelin (5) y Brenda (3).

Fausto  es un socio de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Fausto  se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en Matilde Esther y Naranjito.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño incrementar la producción para que los ingresos aumenten y comprar un terreno. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta celebrar las fiestas de la localidad en el mes de noviembre.
texts.en:
Fausto Leonardo A. V. is 43 years old, and he is married. He lives in Chillanes canton in Recinto San José, Estero Salado parish. He has 11 children; Juana (21), Geovany (19), Angela (16), Maria (16), Mirian (15), Jesús (12), Adrian (10), Jhonatan (8), Jenny (6) Evelin (5), and Brenda (3). Fausto is a member of the Fronteras Unidas (Borders United) Communal Bank. It is located 15 minutes from the Estero Salado parish and two hours from the agency in Chillanes. This communal bank is comprised of 19 members. The community devotes itself to farming. Fausto is a farmer, and he grows cacao. He makes his purchases every month in Matilde Esther. He makes his sales in Matilde Esther and Naranjito. He is requesting a loan to buy cacao to plant and to increase his business. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to increase his productions so that his income will increase. He also dreams of buying land. The challenge that we face is that during the time of the harvest the access roads are impaired by the rain. He likes to celebrate the parties in his area in November.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cacao to plant and increase his business

loans.name: Mujeres Divinas  ( Cuenca ) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Divinas esta conformado por 10 mujeres que luchan día a día  mejorar la economía de sus  hogares, y esto lo reflejan en su trabajo, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, la misma que es conocida por ser la tercera ciudad mas importante del Ecuador, sus paisajes, sus 4 ríos, su gastronomía y su gente hace de esta ciudad una de las mejores del país.

La Señora. Esther M. vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo con los créditos en la fundación Espoir, los cuales le han beneficiado en  su negocio, ella elabora pinchos, trabaja todos los días de domingo a domingo, empezó con su negocio hace 3 años, fue incentivada por su madre  a trabajar en esta actividad.
 
Nuestra socia es de 25 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 niños quienes se encuentran de 6, 4 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están en la escuela y por el momento se encuentra embarazada de 8 meses, su esposo labora en la área de la construcción, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. Su nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar para la compra de otra carreta y así ir poco a poco creciendo en su negocio, su meta es darles a sus hijos la mejor educación  para que de grandes lleguen muy lejos.

La Señora Adriana Sánchez vive en la comunidad Santa María de Sayausi, es su primer crédito y ha sido incentivada por una gran amiga a que forme parte de este grupo de mujeres muy unido y solidario, tiene 18 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 5 meses, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres y comparten los gastos, sus padres no tienen casa propia por lo que arriendan.

Nuestra socia tiene un gabinete de belleza, el cual esta empezando ya que recién lleva 2 meses trabajando en el, todo lo aprendió en una academia de belleza.  Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de instrumentos para el gabinete, su meta es crecer en su negocio ya que le falta mucho aun.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Divinas” (Divine Women) Communal Bank is comprised of ten women who struggle day to day to improve their home finances. This is reflected in their work. They live in the city of Cuenca. It is known for being the third most important city in Ecuador. Its four rivers, its food, and its people make this city one of the best in the country. Esther M. lives in the city of Cuenca. She is in her fourth loan cycle with the Espoir Fundación. The loans have benefited her business. She makes snacks. She works everyday from Sunday to Sunday. She started her business three years ago. Her mother, who works in the same business, motivated her. Our member is 25, married, and has three children. They are six, four, and two years old. The first two children are in school. She is eight months pregnant. Her husband works in the area of construction. They do not have their own house, so they rent where they live. She will use the new loan to buy another cart. That way she will, little by little, be growing in her business. Her goal is to give her children the best education so that they will go far when they are grown. Adriana Sánchez lives in the Santa María de Sayausi community. This is her first loan. She was motivated by a great friend to become part of this group of united and supportive women. She is 18 years old. She is a single mother, and her daughter is five months old. She does not have her own house, so she lives in her parents’ house. They share expenses. Her parents do not have their own house, so they rent. Our member has a beauty salon work station. She is just starting with it; she has been working there for two months. She learned everything in a beauty academy. She will use the loan to buy implements for her station. Her goal is to grow in her business because she still needs a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cart and implements for hairdressing

loans.name: Jairo Lenin

texts.es:
Jairo Lenin T. M. tiene 21 años.  Estado civil Unión Libre vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. Tiene 2 hijos, Jhonny (5) y Lady (7 meses).

Jairo  es un socio de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Jairo  se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en Matilde Esther y Naranjito.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño incrementar la producción. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta celebrar las fiestas de la localidad en el mes de noviembre de cada año.
texts.en:
Jairo Lenin T. M. is 21 years old, in a common law marriage, and lives in the San Jose precinct of Estero Salado Parish, canton of Chillanes. He has two children, Jhonny (age 5) and Lady (age 7 months). Jairo is a member of the Communal Bank “Fronteras Unidas” (United Borders), which is located 15 minutes away from Estero Salado Parish and two hours away from the Chillanes branch of Cooperativa San José. The group consists of 19 members. Their community is devoted to agriculture. Jairo is a farmer who grows cacao. Every month he buys supplies in Matilde Esther and then sells his products in Matilde Esther and in Naranjito. He is requesting a loan to buy cacao seedlings to plant and grow his business. Jairo views this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to increase production. The greatest challenge he faces occurs during the harvest season when access to roads is limited due to the rain. Jairo enjoys celebrating the local festivals that take place every November.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cacao seedlings to plant

loans.name: Carmen Luzmila

texts.es:
Carmen Luzmila V. M. tiene 29 años.  Vive en union libre en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. Tiene 2 hijos, Jhonny (5) y Lady (7 meses).

Carmen  es una socia de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Carmen  se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en Matilde Esther y Naranjito.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño incrementar la producción para comprar un terreno. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta celebrar las fiestas de la localidad en el mes de noviembre de cada año y le gusta los juegos deportivos.
texts.en:
Carmen Luzmilla V. M. is 29 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and lives in the San Jose precinct of Estero Salado Parish, canton of Chillanes. She has two children, Jhonny (age 5) and Lady (age 7 months). Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank “Fronteras Unidas” (United Borders), which is located 15 minutes away from Estero Salado Parish and two hours away from the Chillanes branch of Cooperativa San José. The group consists of 19 members. Their community is devoted to agriculture. Carmen is a farmer who grows cacao. Every month she buys supplies in Matilde Esther and then sells her products in Matilde Esther and in Naranjito. She is requesting a loan to buy cacao seedlings to plant and grow her business. Carmen views this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. Her dream is to increase production so that she can buy more land. The greatest challenge she faces occurs during the harvest season when access to roads is limited due to the rain. Carmen enjoys celebrating the local festivals that take place every November and playing sports.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cacao seedlings to plant

loans.name: Hernandez Cabrera

texts.es: El Sr. Hernandez Cabrera J. P. tiene 56 años de edad. Vive en casa propia. Es padre soltero y vive con sus hijas siendo estas personas independientes. Trabaja como obrero de campo en la Empresa North Bay Produce desde hace 10 años. Quiere terminar con la construcción de su vivienda. Es una  persona muy responsable y trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo pretende tener una mejor calidad de vida para el y su familia. Su sueño es poder concluir con la construcción de su casa y darle una buena calidad de vida a sus hijas y nietos. El Sr. Hernandez Cabrera J. P., agradece la ayuda que le brindemos para lograr hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Sr. Hernandez Cabrera J. P. is 56 years old and lives in his own home. He is a single father and lives with his daughters who are independent. For the past ten years, he has worked as a field laborer for the North Bay Produce Company. Sr. Hernandez Cabrera wants to finish the construction of his home. He is a very responsible and hardworking person who strives to make life better for himself and his family. He hopes to finish his house and provide a good quality of life for his daughters and grandchildren. Sr. Hernandez Cabrera is grateful for the assistance provided so that he can turn his dreams into reality.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the construction of his house

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El solicitante es el Sr.  Ignacio C. el mismo es casado posee casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias de un hogar.  
 Es microempresario se dedica al venta de Cds, Accesorios para celular, en el Nuevo Circuito comercial de Encarnación cuenta con 5 anos de  antigüedad en el rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela e ingresos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de CDs, y accesorios para celulares.
texts.en:
Sr. Ignacio C. is married and has his own place that has all the necessary comforts of home. He is a micro-entrepreneur who sells CDs and mobile phone accessories at the Nuevo Circuito shopping center in Encarnación. Ignacio has five years of business experience, a good customer base, and decent earnings.

The loan he requested will be used to buy CDs and mobile phone accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase CDs and mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth tiene su actividad económica que es la venta y elaboración de comida por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de generar ingresos para su negocio, este no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos por lo que se encuentra muy contenta por lo que han sido gratificantes. Por lo que su inicio los realiza desde 14 años, por lo que no tenía un trabajo estable que le proporcionara ingresos. Ella se levanta temprano para realizar los quehaceres del hogar y realizar sus deliciosos platillos. El financiamiento es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, verduras, jugos, gaseosas y frutas. El sueño de Ruth es tener un lugar propio para ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Ruth prepares and sells food and is always looking for ways to generate more income through her business. This is not the first time she has received a loan. Ruth is happy that the financing has helped make her work rewarding. When she started her business 14 years ago, she did not have a stable job for generating income. She now wakes up early to complete her household chores before making her delicious dishes.

This loan will be used to buy rice, beans, vegetables, juices, sodas, and fruits. Her dream is to have a place of her own where she can offer her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, vegetables, juices, sodas, and fruits

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 50 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene dos hijas ya independizadas, vive en el caserío Tranca Sasape del distrito D. Mórrope, un distrito caracterizado por estar conformado por un pueblo central, lugar donD. se concentra el comercio, y un grupo D. caseríos conformados por pobladores D. condición humilD. que en su mayoría son agricultores, estos caseríos distan mucho entre sí. La zona pertenece a la provincia D. Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a mas D. hora y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Antonia se gana la vida vendiendo productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, este negocio es D. utilidad no sólo para ella sino que también lo es para sus vecinos, ya que la zona donD. vive se encuentra alejada del pueblo central, y sus vecinos no cuentan con el dinero suficiente para movilizarse hacia allá todos los dias y adquirir sus productos.

Adicionalmente ella cría animales menores en su vivienda y se vale D. ellos para percibir ingresos: cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona.

Antonia desea ampliar su bodega comprando ms artículos para ofrecerlos en venta a sus clientes, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez  a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y que dia a dia da lo mejor D. si para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Antonia is 50 years old, widowed, and has two daughters who are independent. She lives in the village of Tranca Sasape, a rural area in the district of Mórrope. This community is part of a central town where many businesses are located. The nearby villages are quite distant from one another and most of the residents are farmers who live under modest conditions. This area is part of Lambayeque province and located more than an hour and a half away from the city of Chiclayo.

Antonia earns a living by selling basic necessities and groceries from a store established in her home. This business is not only useful to her, but also to her neighbors since she lives in an area outsiD. of the central part of town. Her neighbors do not have enough money to travel that far every day to buy their products.

She also raises small animals at home and sells them in order to earn income. When the animals are fully developed, she offers them for sale to merchants who visit the area.

Antonia wants to expand her store by acquiring more products to sell to her customers. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to help accomplish this goal. She is a woman who works hard day after day in order to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Pollo Estrella Group

texts.es:
El grupo Pollo Estrella está conformado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas son Santa Isabel Gutiérrez O.  comerciante de pollo estrella y verduras en los cuales invertirá el crédito. Ella tiene dos niños de 10 y 7 años quienes asisten a clase.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Yadira S. propietaria de una pequeña venta, Martha Lorena Millo Tardencia vende ropa y Gabriela R. es propietaria de de un salón de belleza y comercializa ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The group “Pollo Estrella” consists of four hardworking women. One of them is Santa Isabel Gutiérrez O., who sells vegetables and the Pollo Estrella brand of chickens. She will invest her loan in more of these products. Isabel has two children, ages 10 and 7, who attend school.

The other members of the group are Yadira S. who owns a small store, Martha Lorena Millo Tardencia who sells clothing, and Gabriela R. the owner of a beauty salon who also sells clothing and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Aida Luz

texts.es:
Aida Luz A. es una señora trabajadora, esforzada  y emprendedora quien durante diez años ha luchado para salir adelante con su pequeño negocio de comida, frutas, chiverías, frescos etc. localizado en la entrada de Ciudad Sandino, municipio de Managua. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en materia prima como granos básicos, carne, frutas etc.
texts.en:
Aida Luz A. is a hardworking, determined, and enterprising woman. For the past ten years, she has struggled to succeed in her small business that sits at the entrance to Ciudad Sandino in the city of Managua. She sells food, fruits, yogurts, soft drinks, and other products.

She will invest her loan in products such as basic grains, meat, fruits, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, meat, fruits, and other items

loans.name: Mujeres De Chitocche Group

texts.es: Doña Antonia H. R. persona D. 34 años D. edad, casada tiene 3 hijos en total, 1 hombre y 2 mujeres, doña Antonia es una persona que desD. hace 10 años se dedicaba a la venta D. ropa para niños y que quiere apoyar a su familia, actualmente ha habido un incremento en la canasta básica en cuanto a sus precios, por lo cual ella se ve en la necesidad D. apoyar con los gastos familiares, ya que sus hijos estudian y realizan gastos con sus hijos. Entonces deciD. formar un grupo con sus vecinas que desD. hace unos 15 años se conocen con el opnjeto deaumentar el capital D. sus negocios, y así incrementar sus ganancias para poder darle un mejor futuro a la familia D. cada uno D. las integrantes del grupo.
texts.en:
Doña Antonia H. R. is 34 years old, married, and has three children, a son and two daughters. She has been selling children’s clothing for ten years and she wants to continue supporting her family. However, the prices of basic household items have increased. For this reason Antonia is requesting assistance with the family expenses, her children’s education, and their other personal expenses.

She decided to form a group with her neighbors so that they could increase their business capital. They have known one another for 15 years. By increasing their earnings, they will be able to proviD. a better future for each of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for household & educational expenses

loans.name: María Betty

texts.es:
María Betty es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a sus dos hijos en el caserío Tranca Sasape, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, lugar caracterizado por encontrarse conformado por un pueblo central en donde se concentra todo el comercio y por varios caseríos aledaños en donde vive gente humilde y muy trabajadora, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a más de hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Al igual que la mayoría de mujeres de la zona, se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales para ayudarse a percibir ingresos, ella cría aves de corral en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estas ya ha acanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan el lugar en donde vive.

María desea mejorar la alimentación de los animales que cría para percibir mayores ingresos y también desea realizar algunas mejoras en su hogar, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

María es una mujer bastante conocida en la zona, sus vecinos le consideran una mujer honrada y confiable.
texts.en:
María Betty is a 35 year old mother who lives with her two children in the village of Tranca Sasape, a rural area in the district of Mórrope. This community is part of a central town where many businesses are located. The people living in the neighboring villages are modest and hardworking. This area is part of Lambayeque province and located more than an hour and a half away from the city of Chiclayo.

Like most of the women in the area, María raises and sells animals to help generate income. She raises poultry in an area behind her house. When the animals are fully developed, she offers them for sale to merchants who visit the area.

María wants to improve the diet of the animals she raises so that she can earn more income and make a few improvements to her home. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN to help accomplish this goal.

María is well-known in her area. Her neighbors consider her to be an honorable and trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase poultry feed

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es: Lucinda tiene 50 años de edad, ella vive en su casa propia con dos de sus hijos pues es viuda y sus otros hijos son mayores y están ya independizados. Hace más de 5 años se dedica en la venta de comida, ofreciéndolo en el exterior de su casa. Gracias a su gran esfuerzo y trabajo pudo instalar cabinas para ofrecer el oficio de Internet, negocio el cual su hija se hace cargo. El platillo que prepara Lucinda, son anticuchos, panchos, entre otros, alimentos que son cocinados a la parrilla y que son del gusto de la mayoría de la gente. Desde entonces trabaja durante las tardes hasta las altas horas de la noche, horario el cual los clientes más consumen éstos alimentos, además tiene la elección de utilizar el servicio de Internet. De esta manera ha logrado aumentar sus ganancias. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete en ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de ingredientes para la preparación de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Lucinda is 50 years old, and lives in her own home with two of her children (she's a widow). Her older children are grown. For the last five years, Lucinda sells food right outside of her home. With great effort and hard work, she was able to build Internet cabins, a business her daughter manages. At her food stall, Lucinda makes snacks, and cooks hotdogs and other food items on the grill. She starts work in the afternoon, and does not stop until late at night because this is the best time for selling food. Because her clients also enjoy the convenience of having Internet access close by, Lucinda's business is booming. This is Lucinda's first loan with Kiva partner MFP and she promises to make all her payments on time. With the loan, she will buy ingredients with which to prepare food.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo por los que siempre ha luchado. Maria tiene 9 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de pan, los cuales distribuye luego a los negocios cercanos. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues han sido de gran ayuda. Pues sus esfuerzos han dado resultados por la difícil tarea que realiza a diario para mantener a su familia. Siempre está soñando con mejorar cada día su actividad y ofrecer la mejor calidad de pan. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de harina, huevo, mantequilla, queso y leche ya que mantiene almacenada estos productos para que cuando suban los precios no le afecten en la elaboración de sus postres.
texts.en:
Maria is responsible for two young children, for whom she has always worked hard. For 9 years she has baked bread, which she then distributes to nearby businesses. This is not the first time that she has taken out a loan, since they have been a great help. Her efforts have given results through the difficult work that she completes every day to support her family. She is always dreaming of improving her business every day and offering the best quality bread. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of flour, eggs, butter, cheese, and milk, since she stocks up on these products so that when the prices rise they will not affect the production of her desserts.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: María Violeta

texts.es:
María Violeta tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el sector Tranca Sasape del distrito de Mórrope, lugar caracterizado por encontrarse conformado por un pueblo central en donde se concentra todo el comercio y por varios caseríos aledaños en donde vive gente humilde y muy trabajadora, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a más de hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, gracias a esta actividad ayuda asu esposo a solventar los gastos familiares. Actualmente ella cría aves de corral en un ambiente instalado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.

María desea adquirir aves pequeñas para ampliar su negocio y alimento balanceado para terminar de criarlas de modo que pueda captar mas ingresos, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

María es una mujer empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir apoyando a su esposo para que sus hijos puedan seguir adelante. En la zona donde viven ella es conocida por ser una mujer responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Maria Violeta is 28 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives with her family in the Tranca Sasape area of the district of Mórrope, a place with a characteristic form, with a center city where all the business is concentrated and various neighboring clusters of houses where the common, hard-working people live. The region is part of the province of Lambayeque and is located more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. Maria raises and sells small animals. Thanks to this activity she helps her husband pay their family expenses. Now she is raising barn-yard fowl in a space at the back part of her house. When they have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to the business people who always visit the area where she lives. Maria wants to acquire small birds to increase her business and balanced feed to complete raising them in such a way that she can get more income. For this reason, she has applied for the first time to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1000 PEN, which will help her reach her goal. Maria is an ambitious and hard-working woman. Her greatest desire is to continue helping her husband so that their children can advance. In the area where she lives, she is known to be a responsible and trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy small birds and balanced feed to increase her business of raising and selling poultry

loans.name: Joel Alejandro

texts.es: El señor Joel Alejandro tiene 29 años, es casado y tiene una hija menor de edad. Su esposa es ama de casa, pese a que también le ayuda al señor en la venta de su producto. Joel se dedica a la venta de leña, la cual distribuye de manera ambulante, pese que en su casa su esposa también le ayuda. Además de esto, el señor también realiza sus cultivos pequeños y vende frijoles cocidos. El ya tiene 2 años de tener este negocio, pues surgió ante la necesidad de mantener a su familia, ya que para ese tiempo acababa de nacer su hija y él trabajaba en una zona franca, sin embargo observaba que sus ingresos no eran suficientes. Es por ello que decidió hacerse de un negocio para tener más ingresos y brindar más tiempo a su familia. El señor desea invertir este crédito en la compra de leña, ya que actualmente tiene bastantes pedidos. Su sueño siempre ha sido brindar más comodidades a su familia, establecer un negocio más grande y poder realizar mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señor Joel Alejandro is 29 years old. He is married and has a young daughter. His wife is a housewife, in spite of the fact that she helps her husband in the sales of his products. Joel sells firewood, which he distributes on foot, although his wife also helps him at their home. In addition to this, he cultivates his small fields and sells bean stew. He has been working at this business for 2 years. It began due to the necessity of supporting his family, since at the time his daughter had just been born and he was working in a free zone. He noticed nevertheless that his income wasn't sufficient. For that reason he decided to set up a business to have a greater income and offer more time to his family. He wants to invest this loan in the purchase of firewood, since he now has enough orders. His dream has always been to offer more comforts to his family, establish a bigger business, and be able to complete improvements to his house.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge Alberto tiene 46 años. Por lo que trabaja día y noche para ganarse el pan de cada día siempre está pensando en mejorar las condiciones de su familia. Este no es el primer financiamiento que ha solicitado. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es ofrecer los servicios de salón de belleza. Por lo que el inicia desde muy joven ya que no tenía un medio de ingresos para su familia,  hace mas de 17 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues siempre está pensando en mejorar su condición económica y la de su familia. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de cepillos, peines, rasuradoras, shampoo y tratamientos.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto is 46 years old. He works day and night to earn his daily bread, and he is always thinking about how to improve the living conditions of his family. This is not the first loan that he has requested. He has a beauty salon that he started when he was very young and did not have a means to support his family. He has had this business for 17 years, and he is always thinking about how to improve his economic situation and that of his family. The reason for this loan is to buy hairbrushes, combs, razors, shampoo and hair treatments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy supplies for his beauty salon

loans.name: Ixoqui´b Ajchac Group

texts.es: Doña Marcelina I. C. de 27 años de edad, casada tiene 1 hija de 2 años de edad, doña Marcelina se dedica a la crianza de animales, actividad que venia realizando desde hace 5 años, doña Marcelina quiere darle un mejor futuro a su hija juntamente con su esposo, ya que tienen 5 años de casados y ella necesita ampliar su negocio para obtener mas ganancias y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida, doña Marcelina es una persona responsable y solidaria por lo cual convocó a sus vecinas a formar un grupo para que todas mejoren sus condiciones de vida y apoyen a su familia,  conformaron un grupo de 10 personas algunos se dedican a la crianza de animales, confección de ropa y venta de ropa, todas quieren  ampliar su negocio por lo cual solicitan el apoyo de la institución ASDIR.
texts.en:
Doña Marcelina I. C. is 27 years old and is married. She has a daughter who is 2 years old. Marcelina raises animals, an activity that she has been doing for 5 years. Marcelina and her husband want to provide a better future for their daughter. They have been married for 5 years, and she needs to expand her business to obtain greater earnings and in this way improve their living conditions. Marcelina is a person who is very responsible and cooperative; she got her neighbors together to form a group so that they could all improve their living conditions and support their families. They formed a group with 10 people; some of the members raise animals, and others make and sell clothing. All of the members want to expand their businesses, and to do this they are requesting support from the institución ASDIR.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of spare parts to improve his appliance and motorcycle repair business

loans.name: Francisca Hernández Tzitá Group

texts.es:
Doña Francisca H. T. de 43 años de edad, casada, tiene 5 hijos tres mujeres y dos hombres, doña francisca se dedica a la crianza de animales actividad que ella viene realizando desde hace mas de 15 años, ella necesita ampliar su capital ya que ella quiere apoyar en los gastos familiares para poder darle un mejor futuro a su familia, doña Francisca decide en tonces forma un grupo para solicitar un prestamo, y que puedan pagar entre todas; prestamo que utilizaran para capitalizar el trabajo que realiza cada una de ellas.

El grupo se conformo por 10 mujeres que se dedican a diferentes actividades como crianza de animales, venta de artículos de consumo, ellas necesitan ampliar su negocio para poder aumentar las ganancias y así darle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca H. T. is 43 years old, married with five children (3 women and 2 men). She breeds animals which she has been doing since she was 15 years old. She needs to increase her business capital in order to support her living expenses and provide a better future for her family. For that reason she decided to form a group in order to request a loan that would be used to capitalize on the work performed by each of them. The group consists of ten women with various businesses like breeding animals and selling consumer products. They need to expand their businesses in order to increase their profits and provide a better future for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Sabahi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rocio Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora. Roció L. es socia del banco comunal Estrellitas, vive en  la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es considerada como la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador, es reconocida por sus paisajes, su cultura, sus iglesias de su centro histórico, su gente y quienes la visitan se enamoran de esta ciudad.

Nuestra socia tiene 23 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos quienes se encuentran de 6 y 3 años de edad, su primera hija se encuentra en la escuela, su esposo es comerciante entrega desayunos, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. Roció es oriunda de Santo Domingo, pero vive en  la ciudad de Cuenca hace 7 años. Ella se dedica a preparar leche de soya, coladas, tortillas de verde, realiza esta actividad todos los días y su esposo se dedica a la venta de estos productos.

Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo,  su crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de un quintal de soya, azúcar, café y más víveres que utiliza.

Su sueño es poder  estudiar  corte y confección.
texts.en:
Sra. Roció L. is a member of the communal bank “Estrellitas”. She lives in the city of Cuenca which is considered the third most important city in Ecuador and known for its views, culture, the churches in the historical center, and the people. Those that visit are known to fall in love with the city. Our member is 23 years old, married with two children who are six and three years old. The oldest is in school. Her husband is a merchant delivering breakfast. They do not have their own home but they are leasing one. Sra. Roció is a native of Santo Domingo, but has lived in the city of Cuenca for seven years. She makes soy milk, “coladas” (thickened juice drink), and “empanadas verdes” (empanadas made of plantains) everyday so her husband can sell these products. This is her third loan cycle which she will use to purchase a bushel of soy beans, sugar, coffee, and more food needed. Her dream is to study dressmaking.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Sabahi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bushel of soy beans, coffee, sugar, fruit and milk

loans.name: Marcelino Alexander

texts.es: Marcelino Alexander tiene 38 años. Sus 2 hijos a cargo, son lo más importante para él para brindar apoyo. Su actividad es brindar el servicio de taller de carpintería, pues hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio, este negocio lo inicio ingresos del trabajo que poseía anteriormente, ya que él se instruyó en una carpintería de sus tías, por lo que Marcelino con su propio esfuerzo decide establecer su propia carpintería, a pesar que enfrento dificultades como lo fue la compra de todas las herramientas necesarias para su taller, pero esto no desanimo. Actualmente solicita este crédito para comprar  madera, clavos, pega, maque, entre otras cosas. el desea establecer otro negocio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marcelino Alexander is 38 years old. For him, supporting his two sons is the most important thing. He has a carpentry workshop, and has been in business for over 16 years now. He started the business using earnings from the job he previously held in his aunts' carpentry workshop, where he learned his trade. When he decided to set up on his own, Marcelino overcame hurdles such as having to buy every piece of equipment a workshop needs, but he was not disheartened. Now he is seeking a loan to buy wood, nails, glue and varnish, among other things, so that he can set up a second business for his sons.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sonia Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora Sonia Águila es socia del banco comunal Estrellitas vive por la parroquia de Ricaurte, esta parroquia es reconocida por su iglesia, siendo su mayora atractivo su gastronomía en donde se presenta una gran variedad de platos típicos como son el chancho horneado, cuy asado y muchos mas platos.

Nuestra socia es costurera, estudio en una academia y ahora tiene su taller 6 años, labora desde su casa y bajo pedido, cose prendas para mujeres y niños, como trabaja en su casa no tiene un horario fijo.

La Señora. Sonia tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo se encuentra en el colegio, su esposo es carpintero, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo y fue gracias a su cuñada que ingreso a este hermoso grupo de mujeres luchadoras,  su nuevo crédito va a invertir en telas para su negocio, su meta es aprender mucho más de este arte.
texts.en:
Señora Sonia Águila is a member of a communal bank called Estrellitas ("Little Stars"). She lives in the parish of Ricaurte. The parish is known for its church but even better known for its culinary expertise, with a great number of local specialties such as oven-roasted pork and barbecued guinea-pig. Sonia is a seamstress. She studied her trade in a vocational college and has had her own workshop for the past 6 years now. She works from home, sewing women's and children's clothes. Working from home means she doesn't have fixed hours. Sonia is 33 years old, and married with 2 children aged 13 and 3. Her elder son is in high school and her husband is a carpenter. They don't have their own house, but are renting. This is her second loan and it was thanks to her sister-in-law that Sonia became part of this lovely group of determined women. The new loan will be invested in fabric for her business. Her goal is to learn and become more skilled at her trade.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy four milk cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To clear 7 manzanas (12 acres) of pasture land

loans.name: Mayra Janneth

texts.es:
La Señorita. Mayra M. es socia del banco comunal Estrellitas, vive por la parroquia de Quinta Chica, esta parroquia es reconocida por su iglesia, siendo su mayora atractivo.

Nuestra socia tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres compartiendo  los gastos del  hogar, sus padres tienen casa propia.

La Señorita. Mayra es comerciante, esta actividad la realiza desde muy joven, ya tiene 10 años en este negocio, vende todo tipo de lencería y tiene un puesto propio en el mercado de la feria libre donde vende solo los días miércoles y el resto de días se dedica a vender cosméticos.

Se encuentra en la banca comunal y este es su segundo ciclo, está  muy contenta de pertenecer a este hermoso grupo de mujeres emprendedoras, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  lencería para tener más variedad.

Su sueño es estudiar y obtener un titulo universitario.
texts.en:
Mayra M. is a member of a communal bank called Estrellitas ("Little Stars"). She lives in the parish of Quinta Chica, which is known for its pretty church. Mayra is 23 years old; she is single and lives at her parents' home and shares the household expenses. Mayra has been running her own business since she was very young. She has now had the business for 10 years, selling linen of all types from her own stall in the market on Wednesdays; the other days she sells cosmetics. She became part of the communal bank and this is her second loan cycle. She is pleased to belong to this lovely group of enterprising women. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of linen, so that she has greater variety. Mayra's dream is to study, and earn a university degree.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase linen

loans.name: Marisol Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marisol es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad, tiene un hijo menor de edad y vive junto a su familia en el C.P.M. Callanca del distrito de Monsefu, un distrito conocido por sus festividades turístico – religiosas y por sus trabajos artesanales hechos en madera, cerámica y junco. Se encuentra ubicado a mas de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de verduras al por mayor y menor en un puesto de venta dentro del Mercado Los Pathos, un mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo, ella adquiere su mercadería muy temprano a los distribuidores que llegan a su centro de abastos para luego ofrecer su mercadería a sus clientes, en su mayoría vendedores de mercados minoristas. Ella se ha hecho conocida en el rubro gracias a la buena atención que brinda a sus clientes.

Marisol desea ampliar sus ventas con la compra de más verduras, de modo que pueda responder de mejor manera a la demanda que existe en la zona, de esa manera ella piensa percibir mas ganancias ymejorar gradualmente su nivel de vida. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1800 nuevos soles.

Marisol es una mujer alegre y bastante entregada a su trabajo, sumayor anhelo es ofrecerle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida, anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Marisol is a 32 year old wife and mother. She has one minor child and she lives with her family in the C.P.M. (Minor Population Center) Callanca of the Monsefu district. The district is known for its tourist festivals- religious and connected to its artisanal crafts made of wood, ceramics and reeds. It is located about twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She sells vegetables wholesale and retail at a stand in the Los Pathos Market, a wholesale market in Chiclayo. She acquires her merchandise very early from the distributors who go to the supply center to offer merchandise to customers, most of whom are sellers in retail markets. She has become well known in the area thanks to the good service she offers her customers. Marisol wants to increase her sales with the purchase of more vegetables in order to better respond to the demand that exists in the area. In this way she plans on obtaining more profit and gradually improve her quality of life. To obtain her goal, it has become necessary for her to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1800 nuevos soles. Marisol is a cheerful woman who is very dedicated to her job. Her greatest wish is to offer her son a better quality of life. She has worked with our institution before and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility when making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit and vegetables to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase three calved cows.

loans.name: Julia Mariana

texts.es:
Julia de 52 años, , vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar habitado por comerciantes informales), ella tiene un restaurante a lado de su casa, comenzó a trabajar con alimentos desde los 18 años. 

Ella tiene un restaurante con varias mesas y sillas, pero le costo mucho tiempo tenerlo asi, desde los 18 años empezo a vender "chuzos" (palillos de carne), con esfuerzo y dedicacion pudo obtener dinero para poner un pequeño puesto de comida, ahora ella trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 11h00am y los fines de semana desde la mañana hasta las 22h00pm. Sus dos hijos le ayudan a cocinar y repartir la comida. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar arroz, granos para su restaurante ya que necesita mas viveres para poder hacer mas comidas, en el futuro quiere expandir su negocio y poder repartir a empresas sus comidas.
texts.en:
Julia is 52 years old and lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil (where informal vendors live). She has a restaurant alongside her house where she began to serve meals 18 years ago. Julia's restaurant has some tables and chairs but it took her a long time to make it so. Eighteen years ago, she began serving “chuzos” (strips of meat on a stick). With effort and dedication, she earned enough money to put together a small post to serve meals. Now she works from 7:00am until 11:00am, then on weekends, from morning until 10:00pm. Her 2 children help her cook and serve the meals. With this loan she wants to buy rice and grain for her restaurant, since she needs more basic ingredients to be able to prepare more meals.
