Despite his young age, he has been able, during those three years, to build a good business reputation. Today, he is requesting $800 to buy a new tattoo machine in order to expand his business operation into other areas. In the future, he is hoping to open another branch location. He feels positive about his business potential for the coming year.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans through Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: buy a new tattoo machine

loans.name: Joseph Oitirori Ole

texts.en:
Joseph Oitirori Ole N. is a married gentleman who is 48 years old. His wife is called Nalakiti N., and together he and his wife support six people in his family. Joseph is a farmer and he has been practicing farming for last seven years.

He learned about KADET through a friend who had already registered as a member in KADET. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to spend 20,000 on harrowing, 20,000 on seeds and 10,000 on planting his 10 acres of wheat. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Joseph’s dream is to do large scale farming, attain financial independence and improve the living standard of his family. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: Harrowing, buying wheat seeds and planting

loans.name: Baptist Secondary School Ii Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you the teachers of the Baptist Secondary School II, in Waterloo small town, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch.

Baptist Secondary School II was opened in September 2000 by the Executive of the Baptist Convention Sierra Leone to help alleviate the plight of displaced children living in Freetown during the country’s ten year civil war.

These hardworking and dedicated teachers have come to SMT for the first time to seek a loan of SLL 10,000,000. With the help of this loan, they will be able to embark on some meaningful projects that they cannot do with their mere salaries alone. Some of them will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to buy housebuilding materials, buy a piece of land, pay school fees for their children, or invest the loan in their business.

Alfred S. K. is the leader of this group. He is age forty and was born in Kamakwe, a town in northern Sierra Leone. He has been a teacher for twenty years now. Alfred is married to a teacher and they have three children.

Alfred will use his share of the loan to buy a generator which he will use to power the refrigerator he uses to sell cold drinks.

loans.use: To buy a generator to power the refrigerator he uses to sell cold drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more new movies

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is divorced with seven children, and three of her children go to school.  She also takes care of her grandchildren and mother. She owns a retail shop on Lubaga road selling all types of merchandise, such as sugar, cooking oil, soap and loaves of bread.

She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and cooking oil. She buys her merchandise in Kikuubo in Kampala city and incurs transport costs to and from shopping. 

Edith has been in this shop business for eight years.  Besides this retail shop, she also roasts maize and sweet potatoes near her shop to get additional income. She sells to all kinds of people and works seven days a week.     

She decided to work with MCDT because of the low interest charged. She aspires to see her business grow big and to own a wholesale shop.   Edith resides in and owns a three-room hous; the family has access to electricity but no piped water.   Her monthly expenses includes food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Richard Lawrence

texts.en:
43-year-old O. Richard Lawrence is a teacher and he has been teaching in Kayunga for the last fifteen years. Because of his vast teaching experience, he has enjoyed a reputable status in the numerous schools he teaches in.

What has made Richard successful in his profession is the fact that he researches a lot and he emphasizes a practical approach in whatever he teaches. He mainly teaches sciences. To all appearances, he is a jolly and friendly gentleman and this is an attribute that most of his students have come to cherish.

The teaching profession has often been cited as one of the lowest paying professions in the country, with teachers earning in the paltry range of 150,000 to 200,000 shillings. This is a fact Richard has been so aware of for a long time. The low remuneration has affected him in many ways. Particularly, he has not been able to readily pay all his children’s fees on time.

Richard says he has faced many challenges as a result of being financially hard-up over the years. He reckons this loan will empower him to sustainably cater for all his six children’s education.

loans.use: To pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Marasua Ole

texts.en:
Marasua Ole K. is 50 years old and is married to Kasaine K.. He supports five people in his family. Marasua is a farmer and he does the farming on his own ten acres of land which he has been doing for the last six years.

Marasua learned about KADET through marketing awareness done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan of which he is planning to spend 20,000 KES on harrowing, 20,000 KES on seeds, and 10,000 KES on planting ten acres of wheat. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial. 

Marasua’s dream is do large-scale farming and to attain financial independence. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To buy seed and to pay for harrowing and planting

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 53-year-old married man living with his wife and eight children in Rshaf, a small country area in Southern Lebanon near Bint Jbeil.

Ahmad has owned private school buses since 2007, with nine years of experience in this business. Since his work is the only income source for him and his family, he is requesting a Loan from Al Majmoua in order to do the necessary maintenance for his buses at this time, since most schools are closed for the summer.

Ahmad’s clients are his neighbors and people from neighboring areas. At the beginning, he had financial problems starting his own business. His dream is to buy new buses and expand his business area.

loans.use: To do the necessary maintenance for his school buses

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en: Felecia P. is a married woman who lives in Prk 3, Brgy. Bonbonon, Siaton, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and an entertainment business. Her husband, Francisco P. Jr., who is 49 years old, works as a barangay (neighborhood) councilor to earn his living. Their children range from 15 to 23 years old years old. Felecia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Felecia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000; thus, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use as an additional capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for the future and for her children's education. Felecia P. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Vy´a Renda Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del Comité Vy´a Renda son señoras muy activas y trabajadoras quienes procuran mucho para salir adelante realizando diversos trabajo para mejorar los ingresos de la familia.
Así una de las integrantes es la señora Carmen quien  trabaja como empleada domestica en una casa de familia por la mañana y por la tarde se dedica a la elaboración de de dulce caseros.
Ella elabora dulce de distintos tipos de dulces que posteriormente ella vende a varios negocios de la zona.
Solicita el prestamos para la compra de ingrediente para elaborar dulces como: azúcar, frutas, miel, y otros.
texts.en:
The members of the "Vy´a Renda" Group are women who are very active and hard-working. Through a variety of work, they strive to get ahead in order to improve their family's earnings. For instance, one of the members is Ms. Carmen, who is a domestic worker at a family's house in the mornings, and works making homemade sweets in the afternoons. She makes several different types of sweets, which she then sells to various businesses in the area. She is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients for making her sweets, such as: sugar, fruits, honey, and other ingredients.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits, sugar, honey, and other ingredients for making sweets

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 41-year-old married man and father of two school-age children. He has owned a furniture painting shop for the past 27 years. He has a lot of experience in this occupation. He paints all types of furniture. He is the main provider and he works hard to satisfy the demands of his family and its heavy expenses. He cooperates with some galleries and makes paintings for their furniture and he gains his own profit from it, in addition to painting used furniture upon the request of clients. He is thankful for his business income over the years. And in order to continue expanding his business, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy a new painting compressor. And with the help of the loan, he will be able to take more project orders. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in microfinance. At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro- and small-business entrepreneurs and to the working poor to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: Buy a new painting compressor

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 26-year-old taxi driver who lives in Karuguuza, Uganda. The purpose of this loan is to enable him to purchase spare parts for his taxi.

Andrew is married with three children who are 5, 3 and 1 years old. In addition to his children, he has five dependents he must care for. He lives in a commercial house with four rooms, and his goal is to begin a sustainable business.

Andrew has been a taxi driver for seven years. He started as a driver for someone else; he later bought a motorcycle and he has finally been able to purchase his own car. One problem he has in his business is the poor roads which contribute to high wear and tear on his car. In the future he hopes to buy a new saloon car for his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina G. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Legaspi, Alegria, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: food vending and livestock raising. Her husband, Dario G. Sr., who is 44 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living. They have four children who range in age from 5 to 19. For her food-vending business, Gina makes and sells bibingka, rice cakes made out of rice flour, sugar and coconut milk. This local delicacy is cooked on a special top-fired oven like the one shown in the photo with Gina. Gina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon two years ago because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000; thus, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to as additional working capital for her food-vending business so that she can continue to save up for their future and to improve their living conditions. Gina G. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Larina

texts.en: Larina T. is a 50-year-old widow who supports her family by engaging in a food-vending business. She lives in Purok Sto. Rosario, Barangay Nanunga, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental, with her four children who are between 17 and 26 years old. Larina has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food-vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 7,000. Larina is now borrowing Php 11,000 so that she can use it as an additional working capital for her food-vending business. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 7,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Larina aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 24-year-old single man living with his family and four siblings. He has run a successful bakery for over five years and his freshly prepared goods are enjoyed by members of his village and neighboring towns. He prepares delicious Lebanese breads and other products. Like the majority of the Lebanese community, he cooperates with his father and brothers to assure the needs of the family. With his loan of USD 1,200 requested from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will purchase flour so as to be prepared for the coming holidays in Lebanon and for the summer season. During this time, there are a lot of ceremonies like weddings and special events and the customers will be asking for his products. He is certain that, with the help of the loan, his sales will increase and so will his income. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (e.g. blanking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese micro-finance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in micro-finance. At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement to its micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US$115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase flour for his bakery

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet wants a loan to buy cosmetics and hair braids to sell. She is a married woman aged 30 years and the mother of two. She lives in a rented house but dreams of building her own house and educating her children.

Violet operates a salon in Kyenjojo district, Uganda. A lack of capital has been limiting her salon business that she started three years ago and which has grown steadily.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and hair braids to sell

loans.name: San Miguel Arcangel Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes que conforman el  comité  San Miguel Arcángel, trabajan en forma conjunta y la mayoría se dedican a la venta de comidas típicas. 
Ellas solicitaron el crédito lo cual invirtieron en la producción de comidas típicas, que venden en ferias y torneos del barrio.
Gracias a los trabajos también han podido mejorar su calidad de vida mediante la compra de muebles o mejoras en las viviendas en algunos casos, además pueden ayudar a mantener a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Isidora quien se dedica  a la venta de comidas como empanadas, marineras, milanesas, hamburguesas y otros.
La venta de sus comestibles lo realiza en feria o en otros lugares con aglomeraciones de gentes dependiendo de la ocasión.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes para la compra de carne, verduras, hamburguesas, y otros.
texts.en:
The members that make up the committee of San Miguel Arcángel work together and the majority of them sell typical foods. They are asking for the loan to invest in making these foods that they sell at markets and trips around the neighborhood. Thanks to their work they have been able to improve the quality of their lives while buying furniture, or in some cases making home improvements . They have also been able to help support their families. One of the members is Isidora who sells foods such as empanadas (stuffed pastries) seafood salads, cutlets, hamburgers and more. She sells the foods that she makes at markets or other places with many people, depending on the occasion. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to purchase meat, vegetables, hamburger, and more.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, flour, hamburger, cheeses, ham, different kinds of salts, vegetables, and more

loans.name: Olga Judith

texts.fr: K. Olga Judith est née le 06 Octobre 1968 à Dogbo, dans le département du Mono au Bénin. Mariée à PANOU Hervé, Olga Judith a un enfant à sa charge et qui n'est pas scolarisé. Olga Judith vit avec son mari et l'enfant à charge à Agbalilamè, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est depuis trois ans que Olga Judith s'est installée dans ce quartier. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Olga Judith a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire et a appris ensuite la couture, activité qu'elle exerce depuis sept ans et qui lui permet de faire face aux besoins de sa famille. C'est la première fois que Olga Judith sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue d'acquérir des matériels de couture nécessaire au bon fonctionnement de son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Olga Judith K. was born on October 6 1968 in Dogbo, in the department of Mono, Benin. Married to Hervé Panou, Olga Judith has one child in her care, who has not received schooling. Olga Judith lives with her husband and the child in her care in Agbalilamè, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, having moved there three years ago. Together, the couple take care of the various family expenses. Olga Judith left school at the secondary level and then learned sewing, an activity that she has carried out for seven years and which allows her to meet her family's needs. This is the first time that Olga Judith has asked for a loan from ALIDé, in order to obtain the sewing supplies that she needs to properly run her business and meet her customers' requests.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rolls of poplin, thread, etc.

loans.name: Adolf

texts.en:
Adolf, aged 55 years, owns a dry produce business that he has operated for eighteen years. He lives in Kyenjojo Uganda. His dry produce business is affected by price instabilities and seasonal changes.

The father of ten children aged between 28 years and 10 years, Adolf dreams of expanding his farming activities. He intends to use the loan to buy groundnuts (peanuts), maize and millet to sell.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts, maize and millet to sell

loans.name: Comlan Gratien

texts.fr: K. Comlan Gratien est né le 18 Décembre 1965 à Comé, dans le département du Mono au Bénin. Gratien est marié à ALIHOTE Jeanne et est père de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple a deux autres enfants à leur charge. Il y a environs seize ans que Gratien  habite Djèrègbé, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec sa famille. Le couple se partage les diverses charges familiales. Depuis sept ans, Gratien exerce l'activité de soudure, et de façon secondaire, fait de l'élevage à Djèrègbé. Ces activités aident Gratien à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Afin d'acquérir des outils de travail et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Gratien sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Plus tard, Gratien désire mieux équiper son atelier.
texts.en:
Comlan Gratien K. was born December 18, 1965, in Benin's Mono department. Gratien is married to Jeanne Alihote. He has two children, both of whom have been to school. The couple cares for two other children. Gratien has lived about 16 years with his family in Djèrègbé in the commune of Sèmè-Podji. For seven years Gratien has been a welder, and has also worked in construction. These occupations enable him to provide for his family. He wants to own the tools of his trade and be able to meet customer demand better, and so he is seeking a first loan from ALIDé. In the future, he wants to have a better-equipped workshop.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gas cylinders for welding

loans.name: Andaluz Group

texts.es:
La A.C. Andaluz está compuesta por ocho personas, 7 mujeres y 1 varón, este es su primer ciclo, tiene como presidenta a la señora Miriam Lucinda A. M..

La mencionada asociación comunal pertenece al Centro Focal de Santiago II.  La señora Miriam tiene como negocio la venta de productos de belleza, en particular perfumes, desde hace seis años, ingresó al grupo por invitación de sus amigas. 

Sus clientes son en general mujeres de diferentes oficinas y tiendas.Su crédito es de Bs. 1500.- y le servirá para comprar mercadería.

Ella comenta que le gusta el Crédito en Pro Mujer por que es fácil, debido a que la garantía es solidaria, se ahorra quincenalmente y tiene servicio de consultorio de apoyo en el área de salud.
 
Las  integrantes de la asociación comunal tienen diversos negocios,  elaboración de comida, venta de perfumes, venta de ropa, imprenta, venta de productos de belleza y tienda de barrio
texts.en:
A.C.Andaluz is consists of 8 people, 7 women and 1 man. This is their first loan cycle and the president is Mrs. Miriam Lucinda A. M.. This communal association belongs to the Santiago II Centro Focal. Miriam has been selling beauty products, specifically perfume, for six years. She joined the group at the invitation of her friends. Her customers are generally women from different offices and stores. Her loan is for Bs. 1500 and she will use it to buy merchandise. She mentions that she likes the loan through Pro Mujer because is it easy, guaranteed, she saves money every 15 days and enjoys the provided health services. The members of the communal association have varied businesses; selling food, perfume, clothing, printing, beauty products and neighborhood store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume that her customers select via catalog

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI I  est constitué  de femmes mariées du village de Tiebele Zanguerekan  à San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, élargies, ont en moyenne 36 ans et au moins 6 enfants. Elles cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
SATA D. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants, exclusivement  au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana, et  dans les  marchés  environnants en détail (souvent en gros) au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 20 000 à 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 1 group consists of married women from the village of Tiebele Zanguerekan in San, Segou region (Mali's Fourth Administrative District). They live in traditional extended families. On average, each is 36 and has at least six children. They are peanut farmers. Hoping to make more profit from farming, the group decided to sign up with Soro Yiriwaso three years ago, and are receiving their third seasonal loan. Sata D. plans to use her loan to buy seed peanuts, small tools, and fertilizer in the big market in Kimparana. After the rains end, the harvest is stored long enough to increase in value and be sold in the big market of Kimparana and in nearby markets at retail (often, wholesale) to customers who mostly come from large towns. Each member of the group is counting on making a profit of between 20,000 and 30,000 CFA after their produce is sold. They will use the money to pay loan interest and day-to-day family expenses.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, seed and small tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe BENKADI II  sont  des femmes mariées du village de Tiebele Zanguerekan dans la préfecture de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles,  ont en moyenne 30 ans, 6 enfants et  cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les deux prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
TENE D. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants, au grand marché de Kimparana ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana ainsi que dans les  marchés  environnants en détail (souvent en gros) au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
TENE D. compte réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de sa production agricole, un bénéfice de 95.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the group BENKADI II are married women from the village of Tiebele Zanguerekan, in San prefecture, Segou region, (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families and average 30 years of age and six children each. They grow peanuts. Concerned with making their crops profitable, the group members decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. After having correctly repaid the two previous loans, they are now on their third farm loan. Ms. Tene D. intends to use her loan for buying a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, sundry equipment, and some supplies at the big market of Kimparana city. After the winter, the harvest is stored for a while, so that it gains in value. It is then sold at the big market of Kimparana, as well as at surrounding markets. The produce is sold retail for cash to customers generally from big cities. After selling her produce, Ms. Tene D. plans on making a profit of 95,000 francs CFA that will be used for repaying the loan interest and covering normal family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies, seeds, and equipment

loans.name: Sunny Yerisa

texts.es:
Sunny de 31 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil, (zona urbana, la mayoría de los habitantes son comerciantes informales), ella tiene una Farmacia desde hace años atrás. 

Sunny para poder mantener a su familia tuvo que invertir sus ahorros en una vitrina y medicinas para vender a sus vecinos y conocidos ya que no había farmacias cerca de su sector, con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo comprar mas medicinas. Por comenzar vendiendo medicinas ahora ella tiene una farmacia trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22:30 todos los días.

Para poder aumentar su negocio con medicinas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo pañales, cremas, medinas. En el futuro ella quiere cambiar su negocio de medicinas a una pañalera y artículos para bebe.
texts.en:
Sunny is 31 year old and lives in the Guasmo area of Guayaquil, (an urban area where the majority of the residents are informal traders.) She has had a pharmacy for a number of years. In order to support her family, Sunny had to invest her savings in a glass display case and medicines to sell to her neighbors and acquaintances who, up to that point, had not had a pharmacy in their neighborhood. With a lot of dedication and effort she was able to buy more medicines. She started out selling drugs, and now she has a pharmacy where she works every day from 7am until 10:30pm. In order to expand her business with more medicines, she wants to use the loan to buy diapers, creams and other drugs. In the future, she wants to change her drug store business into a business specializing in baby products.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy diapers, medicines and creams

loans.name: Unidos Para Triunfar Group

texts.es:
A sus 28 años, Fernando se desempeña como presidente del grupo, el tiene una bodega donD. venD. diferentes productos, que le permiten aportar con los gastos en casa, Su objetivo es  alquilar un local más granD. donD. poder exhibir más productos.
Alicia es L. tesorera del grupo, y al igual que Fernando atienD. una bodega, además venD. cosméticos por catalogo, ElL. está embarazada y tiene que cuidar otro hijo, pero eso no es impedimento para que trabaje, Es por eso que se levanta temprano a atender su bodega y a su familia.
Nuestra secretaria Asucena es conviviente y tiene un hijo D. 4 años. Se dedica a L. venta ambulatoria D. diferentes rubros como comida y ropa en distintos lugares, Las ganancias obtenidas le permiten pagar sus gastos en casa. ElL. tiene como objetivo aperturar un tienda en casa, y obtener mayores ganancias. Los socios son responsables y puntuales con sus pagos y eso lo demuestran en su historial crediticio.
texts.en:
At 28 years old, Fernando has the role of president of this group in the communal bank. Fernando has a small market where he sells various products. The income from his business allows him to cover his household expenses. His goal is to rent a larger space where he'll be able to sell more products. Alicia is the treasurer of the group, and like Fernando she runs a small shop. She also sells cosmetics through catalog sales. Alicia is currently pregnant and also cares for her other child, but this is no impediment to her work. Every day she gets up early to tend to her business and her family. The group's secretary is Asucena. She lives with her husband and their 4 year old son. Asucena sells food and clothing in various locations around the city. The money she earns from her business helps her cover her household costs. Asucena would like to be able to open a shop in her home and grow her business and income. The members of the group are responsible and punctual with payments, which they've demonstrated with their good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in their respective businesses to help increase their sales and income

loans.name: La Pomarrosa ( Flat) Group

texts.es:
La señora ROBETH PÉREZ E. vive en coapilla estado de Chiapas México. Tiene 58 años de edad, se caso con el señor: ALFREDO SÁNCHEZ PÉREZ y tienen tres hijos que ya están casados.

  Ella se dedica a su negocio de abarrotes desde hace diez años, y nos comenta que le va muy bien con esta actividad. Con esto ha podido salir adelante obteniendo de ahí mismo sus ingresos de su hogar, aún así  cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja todos los días en el campo y cuando tiene la oportunidad le ayuda a atender la tienda.

 Se inspiro en este trabajo por su experiencia ya que también colaboró  en una tienda de autoservicio como ocho años, el cual comenta  comenzó su inquietud de tener un negocio propio. "hoy gracias a “DIOS” he logrado pasar los días con este trabajo donde me da buenos resultados"
Con las ganancias ella quiere ahorrar para agrandar más su negocio y comprar más mercancía para dar mejor servicio a sus clientes.

 Ella formó un grupo por una invitación que le hizo una de las trabajadoras de FRAC y le intereso mucho, platico con sus compañeras y dieron por nombre La Pomarrosa la razón del nombre es por una fruta llamada así.  
   
 Las otras integrantes del grupo son la siguiente:

La señora Julia C. Pérez se dedica a la venta de pollos aliñados en su propia casa, Blanca Míreli utiliza el crédito en la compra de ingredientes para  elaboración de panes, Olga Lidia se dedica a la costura de vestidos, faldas, blusas y pantalón.
texts.en:
Robeth P. E. lives in Coapilla in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is 58 years old, and is married to Alfredo S. P., and they have 3 children who are now married. Robeth has had a grocery store for 10 years, and she tells us that the business is going very well. With the business, she has been able to get ahead by earning income for her home. Even so, she counts on the support of her husband who works every day in the fields, and when he has time he helps her to attend to the store. She was motivated to go into this line of work by her prior work experience, since she worked in a convenience store for about 8 years. She comments that at first she was anxious about having her own business, but "today, thanks to God, I've managed to spend the days doing this work which gives me good results." With the profits she wants to save to expand her business and buy more merchandise to better serve her customers. Robeth formed a group as a result of an invitation that was made to her by one of the FRAC workers, and it interested her very much. She discussed it with her associates, and they gave the group the name "Pomarrosa" because it is named after a fruit of the same name. The other members of the group are: Julia C. Pérez, who sells chicken that she seasons in her own house, Blanca Míreli, who will use the loan to buy ingredients to make bread, and Olga Lidia, who makes dresses, skirts, blouses and pants.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store, such as: sugar, beans, pasta and other items

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI I  est constitué de femmes mariées du village de Ziekan de la préfecture  de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, ont en moyenne 34 ans, au moins 5 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
ASSITAN S. compte utiliser pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants, exclusivement  au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, sa récolte est stockée pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elle ait de la valeur avant d’être vendue  au grand marché de Kimparana, M’peresso et  dans les  marchés  environnants en détail, en gros, au comptant à une clientèle compose de revendeurs  venant généralement des grandes villes.
SITAN S. compte réaliser, après l’écoulement de son produit agricole, un bénéfice de 75.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi I is made up of married women from the village of Ziekan in the San prefecture of the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live with their traditional extended families, have an average age of 34 years old, at least five children and cultivate peanuts. In the effort to make their agricltural businesses profitable, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. After having fully paid back their previous loans, they are on their third farming loan. Assitan S. expects to use the loan to buy a sufficient amount of peanut seed, small tools and input materials, exclusively on the big market at Kimparana. After the rainy season, her harvest is stockpiled for a time so that she can know the value before selling it at big markets in Kimparana and M’peresso and in the surrounding markets at retail and wholesale to a customer base made up of resellers usually coming from large cities. After the distribution of her farm products, Sitan S. expects to make a profit of 75,000 FCFA which will used to pay back the interest on the loan and the everyday expenses of her family.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of input materials, seeds and small tools.

loans.name: Vignon Justin

texts.fr: Né en 1970 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, L. Vignon Justin est marié à GBEMENOUChristine, une ménagère. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge, dont quatre sont sont leurs propres enfants. Seulement certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Depuis cinq ans, Justin s'est installé au quartier Tchonvi, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, où il habite avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Justin n'a pas été à l'école, mais a appris la coiffure, une activité qu'il exerce depuis une dizaine d'année. Justin s'approvisionne en matériels de coiffure à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et d'acquérir des matériels plus adaptés et nécessaires au bon fonctionnement de son atelier de coiffure, Justin sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, Justin Vignon L. is married to Christine Gbemenou, a housewife. The couple cares for five children, of which four are their own. Only some of the children attend school. Five years ago, Justin moved to the Tchonvi neighborhood, in the Sèmè-Podji commune, where he lives with his wife and children. Together, the couple supports the many needs of their family. Justin did not go to school, but learned hairstyling, his occupation for a dozen years. Justin obtains his hairstyling supplies in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. With the goal of strengthening his business and acquiring materials that are better adapted to and necessary for the successful operation of his hair salon, Justin is requesting his first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clippers and hairstyling products.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Hace 35 años nuestra socia Susana  trabaja con su esposo en una carpintería, ella trae madera del norte del país para poder hacer los trabajos que le solicitan. Con sus ganancias pueD. cubrir algunos gastos en casa. Susana es una socia optimista ya que además se desenvuelve vendiendo ropa y zapatos a pedidos. Su objetivo es terminar la educación Secundaria y estudiar Educacion que fue lo que siempre quiso. Susana está muy agradecida a Edaprospo y Kiva por los créditos otorgados.
texts.en:
For 35 years, our member Susana has worked together with her husband in their carpentry shop. Susana brings wood from the north of the country so they are able to meet their customers requests. With their income they are able to cover their household expenses. Susana has also developed a business selling clothing and shoes by request. Her goal is to finish her secondary education, something she has always wanted to do. Susana feels very grateful to Edaprospo and Kiva for the credits they have provided to her.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business selling clothing and shoes

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI II  sont de femmes mariées du village de  Ziekan dans la préfecture de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du MA.) qui vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, ont en moyenne 34 ans, au moins 5 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Ziekan ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les deux prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
DJENEBA H. compte utiliser pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants, au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana, M’peresso et  dans les  marchés  environnants en détail (souvent en gros) au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Tandis que les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 25 000 à 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille, DJENEBA H., elle espère sur 95.000 FCFA.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi II is made up of married women from the village of Ziekan in the San prefecture of the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of MA.). They live with their traditional extended families, have an average age of 34 years old, at least five children and cultivate peanuts. In the effort to make their agricltural businesses profitable, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. After having fully paid back their previous loans, they are on their third farming loan. Djeneba H. expects to use the loan to buy a sufficient amount of peanut seed, small tools and input materials, exclusively on the big market at Kimparana. After the rainy season, her harvest is stockpiled for a time so that she can know the value before selling it at big markets in Kimparana and M’peresso and in the surrounding markets at retail and wholesale to a customer base made up of resellers usually coming from large cities. While the group members each expect to make between 25,000 and 35,000 FCFA after the distribution of their agricultural products, which will used to pay back the interest on the loan and the everyday expenses of the family, Djeneba H. hopes to make 95,000 FCFA.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of input materials, seeds and small tools.

loans.name: Bronco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. Bronco está compuesta por ocho personas, siete mujeres y 1 varón. Este es su primer ciclo, tiene como presidenta a la señora María F..

La mencionada asociación comunal pertenece al Centro Focal de Santiago II.  La señora Maria tiene como negocio la venta de zapatos deportivos, desde hace cuatro años. 

Sus clientes son en general personas que viven en los departamentos de Potosí, Santa Cruz y Tarija.
Para este primer crédito la asociación le aprobó de Bs. 2000.- , monto de dinero que le servirá para incrementar su capital.

Ella comenta que le gusta el Crédito en Pro Mujer por que el ahorro es quincenal.
 
Las  integrantes de la asociación comunal tienen diferentes tipos de negocios: venta de pollos a la broster, venta de comida, venta de perfumes, venta de abarrotes y Servicio Eléctrico.
texts.en:
The "Bronco" Communal Bank is made up of eight people, seven women and one man. This is their first loan cycle, and they have María F. as their president. The above-mentioned communal bank belongs to the Santiago II Regional Office. Maria's business is selling athletic shoes, which she has done for four years. Her customers are generally people who live in the departments of Potosí, Santa Cruz and Tarija. For this first loan the association approved her for 2000 bolivianos, an amount of money that will help her increase her capital. She says that she likes the loans from Pro Mujer because the saving is biweekly. The members of the communal bank have different types of businesses: fried chicken sales ("pollos a la broster"), food sales, perfume sales, grocery sales and electrical services.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of athletic shoes

loans.name: Kuña Juky Group

loans.use: To buy Paraguay cheese, pork fat, yuca starch, etc.

loans.name: Lucinda Marlena

texts.es: Lucinda tiene un puesto en el mercado donde vende diferentes artículos como son abarrotes, verduras y frutas. Empezo vendiendo condimentos, al pasar los años su negocio ha crecido y eso gracias a los prestamos de Edaprospo. Ella vende en un pequeño mercado por donde vive, pero su objetivo es aperturar un negocio en casa, Las ganancias que obtiene la deriva para los gastos en casa. Su objetivo es terminar sus estudios secundarios. Y apoyar a toda su familia. Lucinda agradece a Edaprospo y Kiva por los prestamos otorgados.
texts.en:
Lucinda has a place in the market where she sells different items such as groceries, vegetables and fruits. She started out selling condiments, and over the years her business has grown, thanks to loans from Edaprospo. She sells in a little market near where she lives, but her goal is to open a store in her house. The profits she is making are going towards the expenses for her house. Her objective is to complete her secondary schooling, and to help her entire family. Lucinda is very grateful to Edaprospo for the loans she receives.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products and raw materials

loans.name: Angelitos Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Angelitos, esta ubicado en la ciudad de Santiago Pinotepa Nal, Oaxaca la historia es acerca de la señora Maria de Jesús R. T., puesto que es una de las integrante de este grupo ella tiene 34 años, esta casada, tiene 2 hijos, Linda María de 9 y José de 8 años de edad los dos están estudiando la primaria, ella se dedica ala venta de antojitos como enchiladas y sopes, también vende tortillas hechas a manos, ella lleva mas de 14 años con su negocio.
 
María eligió la venta de antojitos, puesto que es lo que mejor sabe hacer, ya que su hermana mayor fue la que la enseño a cocinar, también por que dice que es una muy buena fuente de ingresos, y le ayuda para apoyar a la economía de su familia, ella invirtirá su préstamo en la compra de los ingredientes que utiliza para la preparación de la comida como son: leña, maíz, papas, chile poblano, chile verde, jitomates, tomates, cebolla, ajo y otras especias. 
 
Su negocio le esta ayudando mucho  ya que ahora que sus hijos van a regresar a clases, ella tiene que comprarles zapatos, mochilas, uniformes y útiles escolares además de las cooperaciones que tiene que dar al inicio del ciclo escolar, también quiere mejorar su negocio, ampliando el lugar en donde vende sus antojitos.
 
Su negocio beneficia mucho a las personas de su población por que asi no tienen que ir tan lejos a comprar su comida y tortillas, ya que algunas de las personas que ahí viven prefieren comprar la comida preparada para no tener que estar haciendo en su casa.
 
La señora María quiere que sus hijos tengan una profesión ya que ella no tuvo esa oportunidad de estudiar, esta pensando que aparte de la venta de comida puede vender frutas y verduras, ya que dice que también es un buen negocio que además deja excelentes ganancias.
 
Nos comenta que en su grupo se trabaja muy bien, puesto que todos los integrantes se conocen y son muy responsables con sus pagos.
 
Y estos son los nombres y las actividades que realizan cada una de las integrantes del grupo.
Daniel Abraham M. R.- taxista
Angelita González P.- estilista
Juana catalina López C.-tienda artesanal
Juan Carlos P. López-frutas y verduras
Maria de Jesús R. T.-antojitos
Aurora Imelda P. López-frutas y legumbres
Maria de Jesús López C.-frutas y verduras
Maria del carmen López Nicolás-venta de catalogo
Elvira Ofelia R. Pérez-tienda artesanal
Julia gregoria R. T.-zapatería
Faustina Guadalupe R. T.-abarrotes
texts.en:
This group is called Angelitos (Little Angels); it’s in the city of Santiago Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca. This story is about Mrs. María de Jesús R. T. because she is one of the group members. She’s 34 years old, married and has two children: Linda María, 9, and José, 8. Both are in elementary school. She sells fast-food snacks like enchiladas and sopes (fried masa rounds topped with beans, meat, cheese, shredded lettuce, salsa, sour cream). She also sells hand-made tortillas. She has been in business for over 14 years. María chose to sell fast-food snacks because it’s what she knows how to do best because her older sister taught her to cook. She says it’s also a very good source of income and it helps her support the family. She will use the funds to buy ingredients that she uses to prepare her food like: firewood, corn, potatoes, Poblano (Ancho) chilies, green chilies, green and red tomatoes, onions, garlic and other spices. Her business has been of much utility for her because now that her children are about to return to school she has to buy them shoes, backpacks, school uniforms and supplies in addition to the monetary contributions she must give at the beginning of the school year. She also wants to improve her business enlarging the place where she sells her snacks. Her business is also of use to the people living in her community because they don’t have to travel so far to get food and tortillas since some of the area residents prefer to buy prepared food so as not to have to cook at home. María wants her children to have professions since she did not have the opportunity to go to school. She is thinking that besides selling food she can also sell fruits and vegetables since she says it is also a good business that produces excellent profits. She mentions to us that her group works together very well because all the members know each other and are very responsible with their payments. These are the names of the other members with the activities each is involved with: Daniel Abraham M. R.- taxi driver Angelita González P.- stylist Juana catalina López C.-crafts shop Juan Carlos P. López-fruits and vegetables Maria de Jesús R. T.-snacks Aurora Imelda P. López- fruits and vegetables Maria de Jesús López C.- fruits and vegetables Maria del Carmen López Nicolás-catalogue sales Elvira Ofelia R. Pérez-crafts shop Julia gregoria R. T.-shoe store Faustina Guadalupe R. T.-groceries

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For firewood, potatoes, corn, chile poblano (a relatively mild chili pepper originating in the State of Puebla, Mexico. Dried it is called an ancho chile), green chilies, tomatoes, green tomatoes, onion, garlic and other spices.

loans.name: Ana Justina

texts.es:
Ana de 45 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil, (zona urbana, la mayoría de los habitantes son comerciantes informales),  ella tiene una tienda surtida, vende panes, víveres y algunos artículos de papelerías. 

Cuando comenzó solo vendía panes a sus vecinos y conocidos pero como le pedían mas productos empezó a comprar víveres, hasta que su pequeña panadería se convirtió en una tienda, durante esos años ha venido trabajando desde las 05:30 hasta las 23:00pm todos los días, con la ayuda de su esposo se levantan todos los días para atender la tienda. 

Para poder surtir mas la tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo un congelador, lácteos. en el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio para incrementar las ventas.
texts.en:
Ana, 45, lives in Guasmo, Guayaquil (an urban zone whose residents are informal merchants for the most part). She has a general store where she stocks baked goods, groceries and some stationery items. When she started out she only sold bread to her neighbors and acquaintances. However, due to their requesting other items, she started to buy groceries until her small bakery turned into a store. During these years she has worked from 5:30am until 11pm every day. She and her husband, who helps out in the store, get up every day to tend to it. In order to stock it better, she wants to use the loan to buy a freezer and dairy products. In the future, she’d like to enlarge her store so that sales will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For a freezer and dairy products.

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI III  est composé de 10 femmes mariées du village de  Ziekan dans la préfecture de San, qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, ayant  en moyenne 35 ans, au moins 7 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Ziekan ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les deux prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
SANY D. compte utiliser pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants, exclusivement  au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, sa récolte est stockée pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elle ai de la valeur avant d’être vendue  au grand marché de Kimparana, M’peresso et  dans les  marchés  environnants en détail , souvent en gros, au comptant à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs et consommateurs..
SANY D. compte réaliser, après l’écoulement de sa production agricole, un bénéfice de 100.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi III group consists of 10 married women from the village of Ziekan in San prefecture, Segou region (Mali's Fourth Administrative District). They live in traditional extended families. On average, each is 35 and has at least seven children. They are peanut farmers. Hoping to make more profit from farming, the group decided to sign up with Soro Yiriwaso three years ago, and are receiving their third seasonal loan after repaying their previous loans properly. Sany D. plans to use her loan to buy seed peanuts, small tools, and fertilizer in the big market in Kimparana. After the rains end, the harvest is stored long enough to increase in value and be sold in the big market of Kimparana and M'peresso and nearby markets at retail (often, wholesale) to to both resellers and consumers. Sany D. is counting on making a profit of 100,000 CFA after her produce is sold. She will use the money to pay loan interest and day-to-day family expenses.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, seed and small tools

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
N. Teopista, aged 50 years, is a good-humored, widowed lady operating a pub in Kayunga Town. She has banked on profits from this pub business for the last 20 years. With profits from this business, she has supported her family of seven to the fullest. This is a testimony to her sense of responsibility, will power and ability to work hard. 

Her pub is a melting pot every evening, with patrons flocking to partake of her assortment of drinks. In a week, she makes profits that total up to 115,000 shillings. She is upbeat her circumstances will improve with the acquisition of this loan. She wants to buy more crates of both hard and soft drinks for her pub.

loans.use: The purchase of more crates of hard and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Cristobal Colon (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Ellos son Cristóbal Colon (Flat), este grupo se llama así por que una de las integrantes dio la idea y a los demás les agrado el nombre por que es el nombre de alguien muy representativo. Este grupo esta conformado por dos mujeres y dos hombres quienes están decididos a luchar para salir adelante, y cuando algún integrante del grupo necesita ayuda los demás siempre lo brindan sin dudarlo.. Ellos se ubican en la comunidad de Valle de Chalco en el Estado de México.

La representante del grupo se llama Teresa Córdoba S. de 45 años (es la de blusa azul), es viuda y tiene dos hijos los cuales están estudiando preescolar y secundaria. Ella se dedica a la docencia  (maestra de preescolar) desde hace 18 años, ya que le gusta poder enseñar a los niños, y siente satisfacción de poder ayudar a los demás. En ocasiones es difícil para ella ya que tiene que solventar los gastos de su casa y de la escuela de sus hijos, aun así no se da por vencida y lucha cada día para que a su familia no le falte lo indispensable. Ella desea aprovechar estas vacaciones para poder ampliar un poco mas el kinder y comprar mobiliario, ya que desea que los niños tengan un espacio mejor para su desarrollo. Sus planes futuros de ella es poder abrir otra institución para que más niños puedan estudiar

Los demás integrantes del grupo son: Dora Luz P. Gutiérrez (Compra de material didáctico), Miguel Ángel Córdoba S. (Compra de Ropa en general) y Salvador García Pérez (Compra de Telas e Hilos) y agradecen el apoyo que reciben de Kiva a través de Fundación Realidad ya que así  podrán cumplir sus planes y seguir saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
This Group is Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus) because one of the members suggested the name and the rest liked it because it’s the name of someone famous. The group is made up of two women and two men who are determined to struggle to get ahead and when one member of the group needs help they will be able to count on the others always. They live in the community of Chalco in the State of México. The group representative is Teresa Córdoba S., 45 (in the blue blouse). She’s a widow and has two children who are in preschool and middle school. She has been a preschool teacher for the last 18 years. She enjoys teaching children and gets much satisfaction in being able to help others. Sometimes it’s difficult for her to meet her household expenses as well as pay for the education of her children. Even so, she does not give up and struggles every day so that her family will have the basics. She’d like to take advantage of the current school vacation period to expand the kindergarten a bit and buy furniture because she hopes that the children will have a space that is better suited for their development. Her future plans are to open another institution so that more children can study. The other group members are: Dora Luz P. Gutiérrez (To parchase teaching aids), Miguel Ángel Córdoba S. (To buy assorted clothing) and Salvador García Pérez (To buy fabric and thread). They are grateful for the support they get from Kiva through Fundación Realidad because they can meet their goals and continue to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy teaching aids, furniture, assorted clothing, fabric and thread.

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María tiene 54 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Francisco Gotera, Departamento Morazán, es soltera,  vive sola posee una tienda de venta productos de primera necesidad.
Niña Concepción, es una persona que siempre se ha dedicado al negocio, ella tiene una tienda y un mini cafetín, trabaja todos los días en un horario de 6:00 am – 8:00pm es un negocio que le proporciona los ingresos para cubrir los gastos personales y hace ocho años lo  maneja con éxito. Es una persona que ha manejado muy bien otros créditos y actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertir en compra de productos nuevos para tienda como son: leche en polvo, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, maíz, arroz, que son productos que le demandan los clientes, esto contribuirá a ofrecer productos nuevos, aumentar los clientes e ingresos.
Los objetivos son cumplir puntualmente con los compromisos financieros, y continuar trabajando para mejora el negocio.
texts.en:
María, 54, lives in San Francisco Gotera, Morazán department. She lives alone and has a general store where she sells basic needs items. Niña Concepción has always been in business. She has a store and a small snack bar. She is open for business every day from 6am until 8pm. It’s a business that provides income to cover her personal expenses. She has managed it successfully for 8 years. She is a person who has managed her loans very well and is now asking for funds to invest in new stock items for her store like: powdered milk, sugar, beans, cooking oil, corn and rice which are the items most in demand by her customers. This would make it possible to offer new items thereby increasing her customer base and consequently increasing income as well. The goals are to repay financial obligations punctually and to continue working to improve the business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy powdered milk, sugar, beans, cooking oil, corn, rice.

loans.name: Las Hojaldras Group

texts.es:
La señora María de Lourdes Domínguez P., vive en  coapilla, estado de Chiapas, México. Tiene 39 años está casada con el señor José adín Sánchez P., tiene dos hijos la mayor de 22 años  y el más pequeño Vicente de seis años que esta por entrar a primero de primaria.

 Ella se dedica a la venta de pollos hace unos meses  y  en la  elaboración de panes tiene tres años, en donde cometa que le va muy bien con estas actividades que practica.

La que lo motivo a realizar esta actividad fue su familia para que tengan un mejor futuro de vida ya que  solo son dos hijos y quiere darle cuando menos lo necesario, aun así su  esposo la apoya con  los ingresos de la casa trabajando en el campo  para que juntos puedan salir adelante.

Con las ganancias que obtiene de sus dos negocios ella piensa a horrar para construir un local y vender su producto. Como también apoyar a su pequeño hijo con sus estudios y sea alguien en la vida.

Se integro  a este grupo por su vecina quien le comento del programa y como se trabajan  los prestamos. El grupo se llama "Las hojaldras" la razón del nombre es porque dos de ellas elaboran panes. 

  Las personas que conforman este grupo son: 

 Evangelina G. P.: se dedica a vender antojitos
 María de Lourdes Domínguez P.: vende pollos y panes.
 Consuelo Rodríguez C.: tiene una tienda de abarrotes
 María yde P. P.: invierte el préstamo en su camioneta de  transporte (ella es la representante del grupo)
texts.en:
Ms. María de Lourdes Domínguez P. lives in Coapilla, Chiapas state, Mexico. She is 39 years old and she is married to Mr. José Adín Sánchez P.. They have two children, an older daughter who is 22 and a younger son, Vicente, who is 6 years old and about to start his primary education. Since a few months ago she sells chickens, and she has bakes bread for three years. She tells us these activities are going well for her. Her motivation to undertake these activities is her family. She wants them to have a better future life, since they are only two children, and she wants to cover at least their basic needs. Besides, her husband helps her with the home expenses by working the fields, so that they can progress together. With the earnings she obtains from both her businesses she plans to save and build a store and sell her products, as well as support her younger son in his studies so he can become someone in life. She joined this group thanks to her neighbour, who told her about the program and how loans work. The reason behind the group's name "Las hojaldras" (The Puff Pastries) is that two of the members bake bread. The people that make up this group are: Evangelina G. P.: sells appetizers María de Lourdes Domínguez P.: sells breads and chickens. Consuelo Rodríguez C.: owns a general store. María Yde P. P.: invests the loan in her transport van. She is the group's representative.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens and ingredients to bake bread

loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI IV  est composé 10  de femmes mariées du village de  Ziekan de la préfecture de San, région de Ségou quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, 7 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Ziekan ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les deux  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
ALIMA D. compte utiliser pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants, au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana, M’peresso et  dans les  marchés  environnants en détail (souvent en gros) au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 25 000 à 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
BENKADI IV is a group of ten married women from the Ziekan village located in the San prefecture, in Ségou, fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They live in traditional families. They average 35 years of age and seven children, and they grow peanuts. Eager to make their farming businesses profitable, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso MFI three years ago. Having repaid their two previous loans without incident, they are seeking a third campaign loan. D. ALIMA plans to use the loan to purchase a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small farming equipment and input materials at the main market in Kimparana. After the rainy season, the crops will be stored for a while so that their value may increase before being sold in Kimparana, M'peresso and neighboring markets at retail (often wholesale), for cash, usually to customers from the big cities. Once their products are sold, the group members expect to each make a profit of 25,000 to 45,000F CFA, which will be used to cover the loan interest and the families’ daily expenses.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase small farming equipment, inputs, and seeds

loans.name: G. Monique

texts.fr: H. G. Monique est née le 01 Mai 1971 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à HONFO Yves, un plombier, Monique est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple a deux autres enfants à leur charge. Monique et son mari se sont installés avec leurs enfants à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, il y a seulement un an. Monique vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les charges familiales. Ayant arrêté l'école au cours secondaire, Monique a appris la coiffure, activité qu'elle exerce depuis cinq ans. Parallèlement, Monique vend des mèches, des produits pour cheveux et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques dans son salon de coiffure. Monique s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans le but d'augmenter son stock de produits et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Monique sollicite un premier crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Monique G. H. was born on May 1, 1971 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Monique is married to Yves Honfo, who is a plumber, and has three children, who all go to school. She and her husband take care of two other children. They moved with their children in Ekpè, in the Sèmè-Podji commune, only a year ago. Monique supports her husband and shares the family's expenses with him. Monique dropped out of highschool and learned to be a hairdresser, which she has been doing for five years. Monique also sells hair strands, hair care products and phone cards in her hairdressing shop. She buys her supplies in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. Monique is asking for a first loan from Alidé with the goal of increasing her stock of products and better satisfy her customer's needs.

Translated from French by Loïc Haméon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hair strands and hair care products.

loans.name: Llamkasum Finca Group

texts.es:
El bancomunal Llamkasun Finca esta ubicado en L. comunidad D. Lircay del departamento D. Huancavelica, el bancomunal inicia su tercer ciclo con 13 socias, las cuales tienen negocios diversos, entre ellas esta Yodgarda que es casada y tiene 10 hijos. ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. prendas D. vestir y D. calzado en una pequeña tienda que es alquilada, así como en las ferias cada vez que tiene L. oportunidad D. viajar. 
Yodgarda, a podido abastecerse D. mercadería gracias a los préstamos que recibe y su negocio esta prosperando con notoriedad. Yodgarda, solicita un préstamo con el cual comprará mercaderia para poder surtir su negocio. Yodgarda tiene como meta el llegar a tener 02 tiendas exclusivas a L. venta D. prendas y D. calzado.
texts.en:
Communal Bank Llamkasun is located in Lircay community, Huancavelica department. The Bank starts its third loan cycle with 13 female members. They own diverse businesses. Among them we find Yodgarda, who is married and has 10 children. She sells clothes and shoes in a small store which she rents. She also sells her wares in itinerant markets whenever she gets the chance to travel. Yodgarda has been able to stock up merchandise thanks to the loans she has received and her business is prospering notably. Yodgarda asks for a loan with which she will purchase merchandise to stock up her business. Yodgarda's goal is to own two exclusive stores for selling clothes and shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal clothes

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es:
Ofelia es L. presidenta del grupo Sarita Colonia y trabaja con ellos varios meses. ElL. tiene un negocio D. abarrotes en su casa hace 4 años además venD. zapatos y ropa cuando lo solicitan. Los préstamos L. ayudan a invertir en mercadería y así obtener mayores ganancias. Ofelia está contenta con los préstamos D. Edaprospo, uno D. sus objetivos es apoyar a sus hijos para que pueda estudiar gastronomía.
Malvina es soltera y tiene un negocio D. confitería hace 4 años, Comenzó su negocio ambulatoriamente en las calles y desD. el inicio ha trabajado soL.. Ahora está feliz ya que ha podido establecerse y cuenta con mobiliarios en su negocio Los préstamos D. Edaprospo le han ayudado a aumentar su capital D. trabajo. A elL. le gustaría crecer aun más y apoyar a otras personas.
Mery tiene 19 años, y vive con sus padres, estudia computación e informática en un instituto. Aun así tiene que trabajar, Es por eso que invierte en ropa para poder venderL. ambulatoriamente. ElL. espera terminar sus estudios y obtener un local donD. establecerse. L. Alcancía Comunal agradece a todos las personas que hacen posible los créditos.
texts.en:
Ofelia is the president of the Sarita Colonia group and has been working with them for several months. She has had a grocery store in her house for 4 years now, and she also sells shoes and clothing on request. The loans help her to invest in merchandise and earn better profits. Ofelia is happy with the Edaprospo loans. One of her goals is to support her children so they can study culinary arts. Malvina is single and has had a confectioner's shop for 4 years. She started her business on a mobile cart in the streets and since the beginning has worked alone. Right now, she's happy that she has been able to establish herself and furnish her store. The Edaprospo loans have helped her to increase her working capital. She would like to grow it even more and support more people. Mery is 19 years old, and lives with her parents. She is studying computing and information technology at an institute. Even so, she has to work. That's why she invests in clothing to sell as a walking vendor. She hopes to finish her studies and get a location in which to establish herself. The Communal Alliance thanks all the people who make the loans possible.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Las Turquesas Group

texts.es:
La señora Manuela de Jesús S. R., vive en Tecpatan Estado de Chiapas, México. Tiene 30 años de edad, se casó con el señor Abdein Guzmán Gomes y con quien procreó tres hijos: Jacqueline Guzmán S. de 12 años, David de diez años y el más  pequeño Staín Guzmán  de cinco años de edad.

 Se dedica a su tienda de abarrotes el cual comenzó hace tres  años y comenta que la ha ido muy bien,  ya que con esto puede obtener sus ingresos de su hogar y es muy importante para ella, pues con eso mismo apoya a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y la alimentación de sus hijos.

 Lo que la motivo a tener esta actividad es su familia y la necesidad pues comenta que si no tuviera ningún trabajo no iba a salir adelante con ellos,  hoy gracia a Dios lo ha logrado a un que también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en el capo y también al ayuda a en el negocio cuando le queda tiempo libre.
Con las ganancias ella quiere ahorrar para comprar más mercancía, como también comprar un lote de terreno para cada uno de sus hijos quien  cada uno tiene diferente meta de seguir adelante.

 Doña Manuela paso a formar parte del grupo por  sus compañeras, quienes le comentaron  del programa y la invitaron a unirse con dicho grupo llamado las Turquesas, la razón del nombre es por unas flores que  tienen en casa de una vecina.

 Las personas que integran  el grupo son la siguiente:

 Claudia Roceli castellano P.: se dedica a la venta de pollos (representante del grupo).
 María del Rosario Sánchez Sánchez: vende antojitos
 Vila V. V.: se dedica al negocio de venta de ropas.
 Eunice P. Vázquez: tiene un taller de costura.
 Ma luisa M. V.: trastes de plástico
Manuela De Jesús S. R.: tiene una tienda de abarrotes y es la que se le tomo la entrevista
texts.en:
Ms. Manuela de Jesús S. R. lives in Tecpatán, Chiapas State, Mexico.
