She is 30 years old, she married Mr. Abdein Guzmán Gomes and with him she had three children: Jacqueline Gizmán S., 12 years old, David, 10 years old, and the youngest, Staín Guzmán, who is 5 years old. She works in her general store, which she opened up 3 years ago. She tells us she has been qutie successful, since thanks to it she can obtain income to sustain her home, which is very important for her, for this way she can help her husband with the household expenses and the food for their children. Her motivation to undertake this activity is her family and their needs, for she tells us that without a job they would not be able to get ahead. Today, thank God, she manages to get by, although she also coutns with her husband's support, who works in the fields and also helps in the store in his spare time. With her earnings she wants to save up and buy more mechandise, as well as a plot of land for each of her children; each of them have their own different goals to strive for. Ms. Manuela joined the group thanks to her group mates, who told her about the program and invited her to join the group. The group's name (The Turquoises) is based upon some flowers that grow in a neighbour's home. The people that compose the group are: Claudia Roceli Castellano P.: Sells chickens (group representative) María del Rosario Sánchez Sánchez: Sells appetizers Vila V. V.: Sells clothes. Eunice P. Vázquez: Owns a sewing shop. Ma Luisa M. V.: Sells plastic utensils. Manuela De Jesús S. R.: Owns a general store and is the one who was interviewed.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to stock up her business such as sugar, beans, oil, etc.

loans.name: Los Pinos De Carahue Group

texts.es:
The communal bank “Los Pinos de Carahue” is composed of 16 members from the community of Carahue, near the city of Temuco (in the Ninth Region, in southern Chile).  They dedicate themselves to sewing businesses, clothing sales, the sale of cheese, toasted wheat, dried wheat, breads, vegetables, dessert-making, and artisan wood products.
Ruth is the group´s secretary and in the picture she is in the first row second in from the left.  She sells sweets and used clothing from a roofless dismountable stand in the center of the village, and she has been in this business for approximately three years.
With this loan, Ruth will purchase sweets and clothing to sell.  Her dream is to have her own home, she is currently saving, and she is close to reching her goal.  She also wants to grow her business, to have an enclosed post to sell from, which is enclosed from rain, cold, and sun.
Ruth has two children, a son who is 14 and a daughter who is 18 and recently had a baby, making ruth a grandmother.
Ruth has enjoyed working with Fondo Esperanza because her business has given her the support to cover the expenses of her children and herself.
Carahue is located 56 kilometers south of Temuco.  Its name comes from a Mapudungun (the language of the indigenous Mapuche population) word meaning “place of the village”.  There are 25,696 inhabitants in Carahue, over 60% of them living in rural areas.  There is a large Mapuche population in Carahue, and their culture greatly defines the identity of the community.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Los Pinos de Carahue” is composed of 16 members from the community of Carahue, near the city of Temuco (in the Ninth Region, in southern Chile). They dedicate themselves to sewing businesses, clothing sales, the sale of cheese, toasted wheat, dried wheat, breads, vegetables, dessert-making, and artisan wood products. Ruth is the group´s secretary and in the picture she is in the first row second in from the left. She sells sweets and used clothing from a roofless dismountable stand in the center of the village, and she has been in this business for approximately three years. With this loan, Ruth will purchase sweets and clothing to sell. Her dream is to have her own home, she is currently saving, and she is close to reching her goal. She also wants to grow her business, to have an enclosed post to sell from, which is enclosed from rain, cold, and sun. Ruth has two children, a son who is 14 and a daughter who is 18 and recently had a baby, making ruth a grandmother. Ruth has enjoyed working with Fondo Esperanza because her business has given her the support to cover the expenses of her children and herself. Carahue is located 56 kilometers south of Temuco. Its name comes from a Mapudungun (the language of the indigenous Mapuche population) word meaning “place of the village”. There are 25,696 inhabitants in Carahue, over 60% of them living in rural areas. There is a large Mapuche population in Carahue, and their culture greatly defines the identity of the community.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Used clothing and sweets

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es un padre de familia de 55 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Pueblo Nuevo, una zona agrícola dedicada principalmente al cultivo de arroz, pertenece a la provincia de Chepén, en la región La Libertad y se encuentra ubicada a una hora y veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la venta de refrescos y papas rellenas (plato típico del Perú, consta de una masa frita de papa sancochada que previamente se ha 'rellenado' de carne, cebolla, huevos y aceitunas), el vende estos alimentos dentro de un kiosko instalado en el colegio de mujeres de la localidad, sus principales alumas son las alumnas y los docentes de esta institución.

Daniel prepara con mucho cuidado los alimentos que vende a las menores de edad, con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad el sostiene a sus familiares. Su negocio ha contado siempre con mucha acogida y el lo ha venido ampliando poco a poco, actualmente ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la adquisición de insumos para aumentar su producción y por ende, sus ventas.

Daniel es un hombre emprendedor y bastante trabajador. Anteriormente ya ha obtenido préstamos de Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Daniel is a 55-year-old father who lives with his family in the Pueblo Nuevo district. It is an agricultural zone dedicated principally to the cultivation of rice. Pueblo Nuevo is in Chepén province, in the La Libertad region, and about an hour and twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For six years, Daniel has worked selling soft drinks and “papas rellenas” [stuffed potatoes]. This is a traditional Peruvian dish consisting of a fried dough of parboiled potatoes which have been “stuffed” with meat, onion, eggs, and olives. He sells these items in a kiosk inside the local girls’ school and his principal customers are the students and teachers of this institution. Daniel takes much care in the preparation of foods that are sold to children. With his earnings, he supports his family. His business has been well received and has grown little by little. Daniel will use this loan for 1000 soles to buy ingredients to increase his production and hence his sales. Daniel is an enterprising and hard-working man. He has had previous loans with Edpyme Alternativa and has always been responsible and punctual in his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Jeffrey Hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients and supplies for food business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of input materials, seeds and small tools.

loans.name: Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
Alcancía Comunal RIOS D. AGUA VIVA, está conformado por 8 integrantes todos muy entusiasmadas en el programa prosperidad D. Edaprospo y en trabajar en unión y formar sus propios ahorros con un el objetivo la mejorar su economía y el bienestar familiar. 
Violeta es la secretaria del grupo empezó su negocio D. comida llevando en forma delivery a algunas fabricas D. obreros que habían por su casa, el negocio le fue bien y decidió alquilar un local donD. hasta ahora tiene su negocio D. venta D. comida, uno D. sus objetivos es tener una cadena D. restaurantes además desea apoyar a sus hijas a terminar con sus estudios universitarios.
Sabina es la tesorera del grupo nos comenta que su hija comenzó con el negocio D. venta D. comida rápida como: salchipapas y mazamorras en su casa, luego traspaso su negocio a Sabina, quien ahora venD. a una cuadra D. su casa el negocio tiene sus temporadas pero en general le va bien, a ella le gustaría apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios además terminar D. construir su vivienda. Ella cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que es albañil.
La Presidenta es Martha una persona entusiasta y jovial, ella venD. productos naturales que han mejorado su salud así como D. algunas D. las socias. Pero eso no es suficiente para ella, así que también venD. libros D. consulta y como es enfermera trabaja cuidando pacientes por día.
Martha colaboro con la organización  del grupo así que los socios están contentos D. haber encontrado el apoyo económico D. Kiva mediante Edaprospo.
texts.en:
The Rios D. Agua Viva Communal Alliance is maD. up of 8 members, all very enthusiatic about the Edaprospo prosperity program and about working together to build their own savings, with the goal of improving their economic states and the well being of their families. Violeta is the secretary of the group. She started her takeout food business by delivering to the workers at certain manufacturing plants near her home. The business was going well and she decided to rent a location where she has her food selling business to this day. One of her goals is to have a chain of restaurants. She'd also like to support her daughters to finish their university studies. Sabina is the treasurer. She told us that her daughter started a fast food business selling such items as sausages with fries and porridge in her home. Later, she transferred the business to Sabina, who now sells a block away from her house. The business is seasonal, but is going well overall. She would like to support her children in their studies, and finish building her home. She counts on the support of her husband who is a mason. Martha is the president, a very jovial and enthusiastic person. She sells natural products that have improved her health and that of some of her friends. But that's not enough for her; she also sells reference books and, since she's a nurse, works in patient care during the day. Martha worked to organize the group, and the members are now all happy to have found the financial support of Kiva through Edaprospo.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products and raw materials

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del comité Mujeres Unidas son señoras que en su mayoría se dedican al comercio, gracias el esfuerzo de cada una y con la ayudad de  los  crédito al terminar cada ciclo  han podido surtir, ampliar  y mejorar sus trabajos.
Las mujeres son todas vecinas de un mismo barrio y son muy unidas y todas están 
 muy contentas de seguir manteniéndose en el comité ya que han logrado muchos beneficios.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Obdulia quien se dedica a la brindar servicios domésticos, y los realiza varios días de la semana dependiendo de los pedidos que ella recibe para brindar sus trabajos en mano de obra.
Ella desea mucho abrir un negocio para trabajar desde su casa y también para aumentar sus ingresos.
En esta ocasión ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de abrigos para la familia ya como suéter,  buzos, camperas y otros.
texts.en:
The members of the committee Mujeres Unidas, or ‘United Women’ are mainly women that work in trade. At the end of each loan cycle they have been able to stock, grow, and improve their work thanks to the daily efforts of each and the help of the loans. The women are all neighbors in the same neighborhood and are very close knit. They all are very happy to stay in the group since they have improved their income. One of the members is Obdulia, who offers housekeeping services, which she does on various days of the week depending on the requests that she receives for her manual work. She greatly wants to open a business in order to work out of her home and to increase her income. On this occasion, she requests the loan to purchase coats for the family such as sweaters, sweatshirts, jackets, and more.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of clothes for winter, such as sweatshirts, sweaters, and jackets

loans.name: Benkadi Vii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres groupe BENKADI VII  sont des femmes mariées du village de Ziekan  de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali), qui   vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ayant en moyenne 37 ans et au moins 7 enfants. Elles cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  Ziekan ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les deux  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
NIONI K. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants, exclusivement  au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana. Les ventes se font également à  M’peresso et  dans les  marchés  environnants en détail (souvent en gros) au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 25 000 à 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi VII group are married women from the village of Ziekan of San, a region in Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mal) who live in traditional families, are 37 years old on average and have at least 7 children. They raise peanuts. In order to make their agricultural business profitable, the members of the Ziekan group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. Having fully paid back their previous two loans, they are on their third farm loan. Nioni K. expects to use her loan to buy a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small tools and input materials, exclusively from the large market in Kimparana. After the rainy season, the crops are stored for a time to be valued before being sold at the large market in Kimparana. The sales are made both in M’peresso and in the surrounding market at retail (often at wholesale) for cash to a customer base that generally comes from large cities. After the sale of their agricultural products, the members of the group each expect to make a profit of between 25,000 and 45,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the interest on the loan and for the everyday expenses of the family.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of input materials, seeds and small tools.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Twenty-seven-year-old M. Mariam has subsisted on profits from her cold-drinks selling business for the last seven years. She started this business after she dropped out of school. Her cleanliness has won her laurels amongst her clients. It is for this reason that she has strengthened her niche as her customer base increases. She is thinking about opening up a restaurant. 

She is a divorced mother to one child and, in a week, she makes profits that add up to 100,000 shillings. With this loan, she wants to buy more cold drinks for her business.

loans.use: Purchase more soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Violetas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "Violetas 1", decidieron ponerle este nombre por que así se llama la nieta de la señora en donde hacen las reuniones, esta historia es acerca de la señora Virginia Inés R. M. ella es la representante del grupo, tiene 52 años es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 ya están casados, y el menor tiene 17 años y estudia el bachillerato. La señora Virginia Inés se dedica a la venta de dulces y vende en la escuela primaria que esta cerca de su casa y también en su propio domicilio.
 
Ella eligió esta actividad ya que como es madre soltera tenia que buscar la forma de sacar a sus hijos adelante y fue por eso que decidió empezar con este pequeño negocio y con el préstamo que recibió va a invertir en otro pequeño negocio, en la venta de antojitos y tiene que comprar los ingredientes necesarios para su preparación como son: tomate, variedad de chiles, cebolla, ajos, sal, papas, zanahorias, etc.
 
Su negocio le esta sirviendo de mucho, ya que de las ganancias obtenidas, esta saliendo para comprar los útiles escolares, uniforme y zapatos de su hijo, también algunos artículos de uso personal .su tienda beneficia mucho a los niños de la escuela por que asi no tienen que salir de la institución, para comprar lo que buscan y no corren ningún peligro, ya que también ella vende sus golosinas a un buen precio
 
La señora Virginia nos comenta que su propósito es que en un futuro su negocio crezca empresarialmente, para con ello poder solventar los gastos de la educación superior de su hijo, ya que quiere que siga estudiando para que tenga una carrera y una muy buena profesión.
 
Ella conoce muy bien a sus compañeras y nos comenta que son personas responsables, gente trabajadora, confiable y que quiere salir adelante y superarse
Da las gracias a los prestatarios de kiva, por darle la oportunidad y confianza, pero sobre todo por creer en ella puesto que gracias a su ayuda pudo invertir en su negocio y asi tener un mejor futuro.
 
Las otras integrantes de este grupo y actividades que realizan son:
Ana María Ariza M.-repostería
Cristina virginia G.-cafetería
Alma Rosa Téllez R.-librería
Inés Lourdes A. R.-dulcería
Mayran Nallely E. C.-librería
Lissie Lucely E. C.-perfumería
Marina C. Méndez-antojitos
Sofía O. L.-electrónica
Zulma R. Rodríguez-deposito de refrescos
texts.en:
This group is called “Violetas 1” (Violets I). They decided to name it thus because that’s the name of the granddaughter of the lady whose house they have their meetings in. This story is about Virginia Inés R. M. who is the group representative. She is 52 years old, a single mother of three children two of whom are already married. The youngest is 17 and in high school. Virginia Inés is a candy vendor at an elementary school near her house and she also sells candy at her house. She chose this activity because being a single mother she had to find a way to support her children so she began with this small business. The loan she got allowed her to invest in another small business: fast food sales. Now, she has to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare them like: tomatoes, assorted chilies, onion, garlic, salt, potatoes, carrots, etc. Her business is being very useful because she’s using the profits earned to buy school supplies, school uniforms and shoes for her son as well as some personal use items. Her store is of great benefit to the children in the school because they don’t have to go outside the school yard to buy what they need so they are protected from any danger besides she sells them her sweets at a very good price. Virginia tells us that her goal for the future is that her business grow so that she can earn enough to pay for her son’s higher education because she wants him to continue going to school so that he will have a career and a very good profession. She knows her fellow group members very well and tells us that they are all responsible, hard working, trustworthy people who want to improve themselves and get ahead in life. She is thankful for the help from Kiva, for the trust they have placed in her and for the opportunity she has been given but most of all for believing in her because thanks to the help she got she was able to invest in her business and thus have a better future. The other group members and their activities are: Ana María Ariza M.-pastries Cristina virginia G.-cafeteria Alma Rosa Téllez R.-bookstore Inés Lourdes A. R.-candy shop Mayran Nallely E. C.-bookstore Lissie Lucely E. C.-perfume shop Marina C. Méndez-snacks Sofía O. L.-electronics Zulma R. Rodríguez-soft drink warehouse

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, assorted chilies, onion, garlic, salt, potatoes, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Alan

texts.es:
El Sr. Alan  está casado con la Sra. Elsa hace varios años, tienen cuatro hijos menores que aún están cursando la escuela primaria.
Alan es taxista; tiene un vehículo propio que había comprado con  mucho esfuerzo. 
Además de su trabajo, Elsa trabaja como vendedora ambulante de ropas para ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar. Ellos viven en casa propia.
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando educan a sus hijos, y compran todas las necesidades de su hogar.
Él ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
El ya tuvo otros créditos con nosotros, y cumplió en forma excelente con sus obligaciones y en esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para la pago por reparación de chapería y pintura de vehículo.
texts.en:
Alan and his wife Elsa have been married for several years. They have four young children that are currently enrolled in primary school. Alan is a taxi driver. He has his own car and worked very hard to be able to buy it himself. In addition, Elsa works as a traveling clothing seller to help her husband with household expenses. They live in their own home. They are working hard to raise their children and to provide for all their household needs. Alan has proven to be a very responsible person and is honest in all his commitments. He has already had loans with Fundación Paraguaya (Kiva Field Partner) in the past, and he fulfilled his obligations. He is asking for another loan so he can repair and paint his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair and paint his taxi

loans.name: Ibolya

texts.en:
Ibolya is a single mother who raises her daughter herself. She works hard to ensure a decent livelihood for her small family. Ibolya started her small business 10 years ago, when the used-clothing sales business was only getting started in Ukraine. Even today, there is still little competition at the market where she sells her inventory. This business is her family's only income.

Ibolya has used business loans before and finds them very helpful. She was able to increase her number of business locations from one to three. This time, Ibolya is requesting a loan of 15,000 Ukraine Hryvnia (UAH) to increase the variety of items she offers. She would like to purchase more children's clothing to sell before the coming school season.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of items she offers

loans.name: Kamal Deen

texts.fr: B. Kamal Deen est né le 08 Septembre 1986 à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Deen vit seul et habite Ekpè depuis une dizaine d'année. Deen n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire, et a appris ensuite la coiffure. Deen exerce cette activité depuis trois ans, ce qui lui procure des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins. Deen achète ses produits de coiffure à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. En vue de renover son atelier de coiffure par l'achat de matériels de coiffure performents et adaptés pour le bon fonctionnement de son activité, Deen sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Kamal Deen B. was born September 8, 1986, at Ekpè, in the commune of Sèmè-Podji. He is single, and has lived at Ekpè for about ten years. He did not go past grade school. He has been a barber for three years, earning enough to meet his needs. He buys his barbering supplies at Dantokpa, Benin's international trade center. He is asking for his first loan from ALIDé so as to bring his shop up-to-date by buying barbering products suitable for running his business well.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clippers and hairdressing supplies

loans.name: Straton

texts.fr: M. Straton est un jeune célibataire de 28 ans, née en district Bugesera  de la province de l’Est du Rwanda, son niveau d’étude est 4  années de secondaire.  Il est commençant de détail en boutique. Il contracte un prêt pour une balance pour pouvoir peser le poids de grande quantité pour ses clients. Il a besoin à acheter des facturiers et un cachet en vue de gagner les clients de grande consommation, car c’est une obligation du gouvernement Rwandais à tous vendeurs de donner aux acheteurs une facture cacheté. Il a ouvert un compte dans Amasezerano Community Banking   depuis septembre 2008, avec ce prêt il veut augmenter les épargnes afin de construire la maison d’habitation, l’augmentation de son chiffre d’affaires  lui permettra de se marier et devenir grossiste dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Straton M. is a 28 year old single young man born in the Bugesera district of Rwanda’s Eastern Province. He completed 4 years of secondary school. He is a retailer in a small shop. He has taken out a loan to buy a scale in order to be able to weigh large quantities for his customers. He needs to purchase invoice books and a stamp in order to win large customers, as the government of Rwanda requires sellers to deliver a stamped invoice to buyers. He opened an account at Amasezerano Community Banking in September 2008. With this loan, he intends to increase his savings in order to build a house. The increase in sales will enable him to get married and become a wholesaler in the future.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a scale, invoice books and a stamp

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. Nuevo Amanecer por ocho personas, siete mujeres y 1 varón. Este es su primer ciclo, tiene como presidenta a la señora 
Marina Durán.

La mencionada asociación comunal pertenece al Centro Focal de Collpani.  La señora Marina tiene como negocio la venta de comida, desde hace varios años.  La venta es ambulatoria.

Para este primer crédito la asociación le aprobó de Bs. 2000.- , monto de dinero que le servirá para la compra de ciertos productos por mayor, como fideo, arroz. 

Las  integrantes de la asociación comunal tienen diferentes tipos de negocios: venta de verduras, venta de comida, venta de perfumes, venta de joyas, venta de repuestos de autos, materiales de construcción por menor y repuestos de auto.
texts.en:
The group AC Nuevo Amenecer is made up of 8 individuals, 7 women and 1 man. This is their first loan, and they have as group president Marina D.. The group is located in Centro Focal de Collpani. Marina runs a catering business and she has been doing so for many years. She sells from door to door. This first loan is for Bs. 2000, funds that will help purchase certain products on a wholesale basis, such as pasta, and rice. The members of the group have different types of businesses: fresh produce sales, catering, perfume sales, jewelry sales, auto parts sales, and building materials sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase items on a wholesale basis.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a widow. She lives with her daughter, who is disabled. Tatyana sells women's clothing at the central market in Kherson city. She has been in this business for more than 10 years. 

Tatyana is a very disciplined and responsible person. She knows her market sector and buys items that sell well. Tatyana would like to borrow 15,000 Ukraine Hryvnia (UAH) to purchase more inventory for her business and increase the sales.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Las Reinas 1 Group

texts.en:
Josefina is the coordinator of her group, Las Reinas 1 (Queens). She makes her home in a simple structure with her three children and, being a single mom, she says that her most difficult challenge was to study. She grew up without her mom, so it was really difficult to study, attend to home activities where she lived, and to work. She started working when she was a child.

Josefina is excited to be taking her 3rd loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying beans to cook and sell every morning to her neighbors. She also want to buy household products and silver jewelry to sell from home and by walking to sell in the afternoons.

Josefina will use the profits to invest in her business. Her dream is to give her children a healthy life full of opportunities. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying her work.

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican  clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

The sixth woman is named Ana (the one sitting below the one standing with the blue shirt)and She is not on this loan, Esperanza has more loans with other group of five and Ana is the leader in the second group, which we couldn't post her group profile.

loans.use: To buy beans, silver jewelry and household products

loans.name: Jaime Ignacio

texts.es: El Sr. P. A. Jaime Ignacio tiene 38 años de edad. Vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo. Tiene casa  propia, la cual se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Ocucaje. Trabaja como obrero de campo en las parcelas de la zona. Su esposa tambien es obrera de campo. El Sr. Jaime es una persona muy responsable y emprendedora que gracias a su esfuerzo a logrado construir parte de su vivienda. Es por tal motivo que requiere el préstamo. Su sueño, según nos comenta es terminar de construir dicha vivienda, para poder darle a su hijo y esposa una mejor calidad de vida. El señor Jaime agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mr. P. A. Jaime Ignacio is 38 years old. He lives with his wife and their son. They own their own home, located in the Ocucaje district. He works as a farmer in the local fields. His wife is also a farmer. Jaime is a very responsible person and a very hard working person. With a great deal of hard work he has managed to build part of his house. For this reason he would like to have a loan. His dream is to finish building the house so that he can provide his son and his wife with a better quality of life. Jaime appreciates the support that is being provided through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mejoramiento de vivienda

loans.name: Martha Betulia

texts.es:
Martha Betulia V. A. tiene 45 anos de edad, es soltera y tiene seis hijas.  Reside in Barrio Centro en Juticalpa, Olancho, Honduras.  Tiene una pupuseria donde trabaja con sus hijas desde 8 de la manana a las 8 de la noche cada dia.  Comenzo hace 9 anos vendiendo pupusas su necogio a crecido y ahora vende todo tipo de comida.  Su negocio es buen conocido y tiene muchos clientes.

Con el prestamo de 12,000 Lempiras comprara materia prima para hacer diferentes comidas.  Comprara refrescos, carnes, verduras, lacteos, jugos, huevos, condimentos, frijoles y arroz.  El prestamo le ayudara a crecer su negocio y sus ingresos para que puede ayudar a sus hijas en sus estudios ya que ellas no tienen padre.  

Sus suenos son que su negocio sea mas grande y que sus hijas sean profesionales.  Martha ha sido un buen cliente de FAMA por siete anos y los prestamos han ayudado a crecer su negocio.  Le agredece mucho por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Martha Betulia V. A. is 45 years old, she is single and the mother of six girls. She lives in Barrio Centro in Jaticalpa, Olancho, Honduras. She owns a restaurant where she works with her daughters from 8 in the morning to 8 at night every day. She started 9 years ago selling pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas). Her business has expanded and her menu includes all kinds of food. Her business is well known and she has many clients. With this loan of 12,000 Lempiras she will purchase ingredients to make different foods. She will purchase soft drinks, meats, vegetables, milk products, juices, eggs, condiments, beans and rice. The loan will help her expand her business and her earnings, with the goal of helping her daughters with their tuition. They do not receive any support from their father. Her dream is to have a larger business and so see her daughters in professional jobs. Martha has been a good client of FAMA (Kiva field partner) for seven years and the loans have helped her invest in her business. She is very grateful for the support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make different types of foods.

loans.name: Maritza Maribel

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 24 años de edad, reside en Jucuapa del departamento de Usulután, es casada, vive con el esposo y pequeña hija de 3 años de edad, posee un negocio de venta de tortas y hamburguesas.
Ella inicialmente trabaja como empleada aprendió el negocio y emprendió su propia venta de tortas y hamburguesa, cuanta con dos años de experiencia en el negocio, trabajando en horario de 9:00am-6:00pm, es una persona muy alegre que le gusta hacer bien su trabajo.
Actualmente ella solicita un préstamo para compra de panes, lechuga, carne, mayonesa, salsa de tomate, y otros ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de de tortas y hamburguesas, esto contribuirá a la continuidad del negocio de Maritza, tener productos para vender.
Las aspiraciones de martiza son tener un negocio fuerte, atraer clientes, para contribuir a mejorar el sistema de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Maritza is 24 years old. She lives in Jucuapa in the Usulután department. She is married and lives with her husband and 3 year old daughter. She has a business selling sandwiches and hamburgers. She started as an employee and learned the business. She opened her own business selling sandwiches and hamburgers and has been doing it for two years, working from 9:00 a.m. - 6:00 pm. She is a very cheerful person who likes to do her job well. Presently, she is asking for a loan to buy buns, lettuce, meat, mayonnaise, ketchup and other ingredients necessary for making sandwiches and hamburgers. This will contribute to the continuity of Maritza's business, having products to sell. Maritza's aspirations are to have a strong business, and attract customers in order to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy buns, lettuce, meat, mayonnaise, ketchup and other ingredients

loans.name: Namukozi Suubi Group-Mityana

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Florence N. has operated her grocery-store business in Namukozi-Mityana for the last six years. This married mother of three has used profits from this business to shoulder her family responsibilities. All of her children are at school. 

Most of her clients are local residents. For a long haul of time, she has been operating on weekly profits of between 20,000 shillings and 60,000 shillings. She started her business with savings from her teaching job. 

Her welcoming nature has played in her favor all this time she has been operating. With this loan, she wants to purchase more groceries for her store to resell them.

loans.use: Purchase more stock for resale

loans.name: Las Mariposas De La Posta Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre "Las mariposas de la posta", decidieron ponerle este nombre por que así se llama la colonia en donde viven y también por que son mujeres muy unidas, esta historia es acerca de la señora Marisela López Hernández ella es parte de este grupo, es casada, tiene 2 hijos uno de 3 y  otra de 9 años la niña estudia la primaria, ella se dedica a la venta de torrillas hechas a mano desde hace un año.
 
Doña Marisela decidió iniciar con este negocio por que tenia la necesidad de hacerlo, pues no tenia la solvencia económica, suficiente para la educación de sus 2 hijos ella decidió invertir el crédito en la compra de mas ingredientes para la preparación de las tortillas como son: maíz y leña ya que es lo mas indispensable.
 
Su negocio le esta beneficiando mucho ya que de sus ganancias esta sacando para pagar los estudios de sus hijos, también esta Ahorrando para invertir en un local para poder poner una tortillería y darle trabajo a las personas de su comunidad. 
 
Ella desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para que poder poner su tortillería, también quiere seguir apoyando a su hijos para que puedan seguir estudiando y terminen su carrera, para así hacerse de un mejor futuro.
 
Platica que todas sus compañeras, son personas responsables y pagadoras puesto que todas se conocen y no tienen ningún problema entre ellas.
 
Dice que esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios de kiva y con FRAC, ya que gracias a ellos esta saliendo adelante y ha podido tener su propio negocio, asi poder apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
 
Las personas que integran el grupo de las mariposas de la posta y las actividades en las que invirtieron su crédito son:
Divina G. R.-venta por catalogo
Ana Maria Hernández G.-antojitos (representante del grupo)
Ernestina L. Sánchez-deposito de refresco
Maria Elena López garcía-antojitos
Verónica L. Hernández-abarrotes
Lidia M. Jiménez-materias primas
Marisela López Hernández-materias primas
Juana O. Hernández-abarrotes
Humberto R. Vásquez-quesos
Merced lucina Gutiérrez B.-perfumería
texts.en:
This group is named "Las Mariposas de la Posta". They decided to give it that name because that is the name of the neighborhood they live in and also because they are very united women. This story is about Mrs.Marisela López Hernández, who is a part of this group. She is married and has two children, a 3 year old son and a 9 year old girl. Her daughter goes to elementary school and Marisela has been selling handmade tortillas for a year. Marisela decided to start this business out of neccesity. She wasn't financially stable enough to educate her 2 children. She decided to invest the loan in purchasing more ingredients for the torilla preparation, such as: corn and firewood, which are the most indispensable things. Her business is benefitting her a lot since with her earnings she is able to pay for her children's education. She is also saving up to invest in a locale to be able to open a tortilla shop and provide work for the people in her community. She wants to keep investing in the business to open her tortilla shop and she also wants to keep supporting her children so that they can keep going to school and finish their studies and have a better future. She remarks that all of her fellow members are responsible people who make their payments. They all know each other and have no problems among themselves. She says that she is very grateful to the Kiva lenders and to FRAC, since thanks to them she is getting ahead and has been able to have her own business, and support her children's educations. The people in the Mariposas de la Posta group and the activities they invested their loan in are: Divina G. R.- Catalog Sales Ana Maria Hernández G.-Snacks (group representative) Ernestina L. Sánchez-beverage stand Maria Elena López García-snacks Verónica L. Hernández-groceries Lidia M. Jiménez-raw materials Marisela López Hernández-raw materials Juana O. Hernández-groceries Humberto R. Vásquez-cheeses Merced Lucina Gutiérrez B.-perfume

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients for the preparation of tortillas, such as: corn and firewood

loans.name: Felicitas Valentina

texts.es:
Felicitas tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos dependientes, vive junto a su familia en el sector Fundo Santo Tomás, una zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, perteneciente a la provincia del mismo nombre, unicado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, sus principales clientes son los vecinos de la zona, ella les ofrece diversos artículos de uso diario por los cuales tendrían que que dirigirse hasta el mercado del distrito para adquirirlos, por este motivo su negocio cuenta con buena acogida. Tratando siempre de brindar una buena atención, Felicitas trata de proveerse de productos de buena calidad y de atender a sus clientes con un trato amable.

Felicitas desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos, de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y sus ganancias, para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Felicitas es conocida en su comunidad por ser una mujer trabajadora y que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar cuando se le requiere, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder brindarles a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Felicitas is 42 years old, married, and has 4 dependent children. She lives with her family in the Fundo Santo Tomás neighborhood. It is in a rural area of the Lambayeque district, belonging to the province of the same name, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Felicitas sells groceries and other products that are basic necessities from a store that is set up in her home. Her main customers are the neighbors in the area. She offers a diverse selection of everyday items which she acquires by traveling to the market in the district. For this reason her business is well-received, and she is always trying to provide the best service to her customers. Felicitas tries to get good quality products and provide her customers with friendly service. Felicitas is well known in her community for being a hardworking woman, and she is always ready to help others in need. Her main desire is to continue to grow as a businesswoman, so that she can provide a better quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy goods that are basic necessities to expand her business selling from a store in her house

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica, de 37 años y está casada con Luis de 33 años, ambos tienen tres hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Desde hace 11 años, que junto a su esposo siembra papa, arveja y habas, en terrenos que posee y en otro que son arrendados, asimismo cría animales como cerdo y asno. Por otro lado, los días que descansan se queda cuidando su hogar, mientras su esposo trabaja en otros terrenos, ganando S/20.00 soles el día, y con esas ganancias cubren los gastos domésticos, ya que los ingresos que obtiene de la comercialización de su cosecha lo invierten para mejorar su producción. Lo que más Le gusta es cosechar y comercializar sus productos, por tanto planea comprar más terrenos, para sembrar más arveja y papa, además sus compañeros la motivan a sembrar flor gladiolos, por la demanda que tiene en el mercado. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y está contenta de trabajar en su grupo comunal, con personas honestas y trabajadores como ella. Con los quinientos soles que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono, que esparcirá en sus sembríos de arveja ya desarrollados.
texts.en:
Angelica is 37 years old and is married to the 33 year old Luis. Together they have 3 children, with whom they live in their own home. For 11 years, they have cultivated potatoes, peas, and broad beans on land that they own and on some that is rented. They also raise livestock such as pigs and donkeys. Angelica spends her days off caring for their home while her husband works on other farms, earning S/20.00 soles a day. With those earnings they cover their household expenses, since the profits from the sale of their harvest are invested to improve production. What she likes best is harvesting and selling her products. She plans to buy more land and plant more peas and potatoes. Her friends have also advised her to plant gladiola flowers, since they are in demand in the market. This will be her third loan with MFP, and she is happy working in her communal group with honest hardworking people like herself. With the five hundred soles she is requesting, she will buy several bags of fertilizer to spread in the pea fields.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Vicente Heraldo

texts.es:
Vicente de 54 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil, (zona urbana, la mayoría de los habitantes son comerciantes informales), el tiene un puesto de venta de “bollos” (plato típico contiene plátanos y pescado muy típico en las playas de Ecuador). 

Antes de vender bollos el trabajaba en un barco como cocinero, pero como no tenia ingresos suficientes para mantener a su familia decidió hacer su propia comida y venderla, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo trabajar independientemente vendiendo bollos. 

Ahora para poder agrandar su negocio el quiere con el préstamo comprar una puerta metálica para su local y artículos para cocina. En el futuro quiere tener su propio restaurante de comidas típicas del Ecuador.
texts.en:
54 year-old Vicente lives in Guasmo, Guayaquil (an urban zone where the majority of its inhabitants are informal merchants). He has got a "bollos" stall (a plate of bananas and fish, very typical from the beaches of Ecuador). Before he sold "bollos", he worked on a boat as a cook but he didn't make enough money to maintain his family and so he decided to cook his own food and sell it. Little by little and with a lot of hard work, he was able to work independently selling "bollos." Now, in order to expand his business, he wants a loan so that he can purchase a metal door for his business and kitchen supplies. In the future, he wants to have his own restaurant of typical Ecuadorian cuisine.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Metal door and kitchen supplies.

loans.name: La Solución Group

texts.es:
La A.C. La Solución está integrado por ocho personas, siete mujeres y un varón. Este es su segundo ciclo, la señora Virginia T. C. es la presidenta de este ciclo.

La mencionada asociación comunal pertenece al Centro Focal de Collpani.  La señora Virginia tiene como negocio la venta de comida, desde hace varios años.  Ella comenta que la mujer de su hermano vendía comida y le aconsejó que era un buen negocio y por eso emprendió el suyo. La venta de comida es realizada entre las nueve de la mañana y doce del medio día.

Para el primer crédito la asociación le aprobó de Bs. 500.-, monto de dinero que le sirvió para comprar ropa de bebé, que puso en venta en seguida.  Ahora que ha cambiado de rubro, el préstamo es por Bs.1500.- y será destinado a la compra de mesas y sillas.

Las  integrantes de la asociación comunal tienen diferentes tipos de negocios: venta de fruta, venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de tejidos, venta de cordero y quesos, y un conductor de transporte público.
texts.en:
The A.C. La Solución is made up of eight members, seven women and one man. This is their second cycle and the Señora Virginia T. C. is the president of the current cycle. This communal association pertains to the Centro Focal of Collpani. The Señora Virginia has been selling food for a living for several years now. She says that her brother's wife used to sell food and had recommended it to her because it was a good business and as such she decided to start as well. She sells food between nine in the morning and noon. For their first loan, the association was approved Bs. 500; money which was used to purchase baby clothes that was sold right away. Now changing to a different line of work, the loan is for Bs. 1500, which will be used toward the purchase of tables and chairs. The members of the communal association all work in different types of sectors: the sale of fruit, food, clothing, woven items, lamb and cheese, and public transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new tables and chairs to serve clients.

loans.name: Felipe Mauricio

texts.es:
Felipe de 34 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil, (zona urbana, la mayoría de los habitantes son comerciantes informales), el tiene una carnicería, vende todo tipo de carnes. 

Desde pequeño su familia trabajo en una carnicería y le enseñaron como administrarla, cuando creció y tuvo a sus tres hijos tuvo que invertir dinero para poder mantener a su familia. Ahora tiene un puesto de carne trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm, vende cerdo, carne de vaca, pollos, etc. 

Para tener mas ingresos el quiere invertir comprando con el préstamo carnes, pollo, cerdo, en el futuro quiere convertirse en mayorista de carnes.
texts.en:
34 year-old Felipe lives in Guasmo, Guayaquil (an urban zone, where the majority of the inhabitants are informal merchants). He has got a butcher's shop and sells all types of meat. Since he was little, his family has worked in the butcher's shop and taught him how to run it. When he grew up and had three children, he had to invest money in order to sustain his family. Nowadays, he has got a meat stall where he works from 8am until 6pm. He sells pork, beef, chicken, etc. In order to increase his earnings, he wants to invest his loan in the purchase of beef, chicken, and pork. In the future, he wants to become a wholesale vendor of meat.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beef, chicken.

loans.name: Amigas Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Juana C. quien contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona.
El comité se Denomina “Amigas ”  están  en el Segundo  Ciclo   con 16  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsables,  ellas tienen actividades diferentes dependiendo de la facilidad con que cuentan. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Sergia quien es muy trabajadora y activa. 
Ella realiza trabajos de manicura y pedicuro, tratamiento de pies y manos. 
Su trabajo es muy solicitado y dependiendo de los pedidos que ella recibe hace los trabajos en las casas de sus clientas. 
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su trabajo y quiere seguir mejorando su servicio y para ello necesita comprar vaR. accesoR. y herramientas que mejoraran sus trabajos. 
Solicita el crédito para la compra de dichos accesoR. y herramientas como cremas para manos y pies, separadores de dedos, corta uña y cutículas y otros.
texts.en:
In order to form a regional committee, Juana C. contacted her neighbors and friends. Their committee is called "Friends" and they are in their second cycle with 16 members. The group emphasizes unity, solidarity and responsibility in the neighborhood. The members are engaged in different activities depending on the gifts they possess. One of the members is Sergia, who is very hard-working and active. She offers manicures and pedicures and hand and foot treatments. Her services are sought after and, depending upon the requests she receives, are sometimes rendered in the homes of her clients. She is very satisfied with her job and wants to continue improving her services. In order to do so she needs to buy various accessories and tools that will facilitate her work. She is requesting a loan to to buy these accessories and tools, including hand and foot lotions, toe separators, nail and cuticle trimmers, and more.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hand and foot lotions, nail and cuticle trimmers, toe separators, hand and foot buffers, and other accessories.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Valientes (Brave Women). She makes her home in a simple structure with her longterm partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenge was to have her own roof (house).

Maria is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza, seven months after she started her business with her extra income. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying rice, flour and other foods. Her business is a colmado (convenience store), a place where you can find all the ingredients you may need for your daily food. Normally these colmados are in the same neighborhood, a short walking distances from any home.

Maria will use the profits to buy a computer and, in the future, build her house with a concrete block structure and arrange for water service. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying her two favorite things: God and her family.

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy more rice, beans, sugar, oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING CREAMS, SHAMPOO, GELATINE, AND COLOGNE, AND TO REMODEL HIS BARBER SHOP

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
La señora Alba Luz V. se dedica a la venta de abarrotería, tiene una pequeña pulperia, negocio que opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “Las Gemelitas”.
La señora Alba tiene cinco años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio, donde se puede observar que lo ha administrado muy bien, ya que el crecimiento de este negocio es notable.
Doña Alba esta casada con el sr. José Maria Maldonado quien se dedica a la agricultura y además de eso también es Pastor Evangélico de una iglesia.
Del hogar de los señores Maldonado Vásquez solamente dependen 4 personas que son sus hijos, y con las ganancias que obtiene la señora Alba de su negocio ha ayudado a su esposo a pagar los gastos de estudio y crianza de sus hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio ya que las ventas se ponen mejor cada dia de pasa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alba Luz V. sells groceries for a living from a small grocery store she has in her home called "Las Gemelitas." Mrs. Alba has had this business for five years and she has clearly managed it well, since her business's growth is notable. Dona Alba is married to Mr. José Maria Maldonado who is a farmer and is also an evangelical pastor of a church. Mr. Maldonado Vásquez only has four dependents, his children, and the money Mrs. Alba takes in from her business has helped him with the costs or raising them and paying their tuition. The loan will be used to buy more merchandise to stock her business since the sales are getting better each day.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy donnuts, drinks, juices, beans, rice, sugar, corn meal and flour, pastas, soups, lard, oil, toothpaste, toilet paper, salt, tortillas, soap

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Poderosas 23 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “Poderosas 23 D. Marzo” pertenece al Centro Focal D. Panamericana.  Esta asociación se ha reagrupado para solicitar un crédito D. forma conjunta, este es su primer ciclo, tienen como presidenta a la señorita Milenka Araceli C. M., la mencionada asociación comunal pertenece al Centro Focal D. Panamericana.  La señorita Milenka tiene como negocio la venta D. carne D. res, con el apoyo D. sus padres, quienes le enseñaron el oficio desD. la práctica en cortes como la administración.
Es poco frecuente encontrar a una Presidenta tan joven, pues Milenka cuenta con 21 años D. edad, indudablemente el que esté a punto D. graduarse como Profesora D. fisica-quimica, le ha dado la seguridad a la asociación para darle este cargo.

Las integrantes D. la asociación comunal tienen diversos negocios:  venta D. fruta, venta D. joyas, tienda D. barrio, venta D. productos D. belleza, venta D. carne y conductor D. taxi
texts.en:
The “Poderosas 23 D. Marzo" (Powerful Women of March 23rd) Communal Association is affiliated with a Panamericana Regional Center. The association has reorganized in order to solicit loans in a collective form. This is its 1st loan cycle. The current president is Miss Milenka Araceli, whose business is selling beef. She is assisted in the business by her parents who taught her the skills, from making cuts to administration. It is rare to encounter a president so young. Milenka is 21 years old and is at the point of graduation as a teacher of physics-chemistry. She has given the association good reason to offer her the responsibility. The members of the communal association have diverse businesses: selling fruit, selling jewelry, operating a neighborhood store, selling beauty products, selling meat, and driving a taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MEAT FOR HER BUTCHER SHOP

loans.name: Ana Aracely

texts.es:
Ana tiene 29 años de edad, Reside en San Miguel, vive Junto al esposo (Mardoqueo) y sus dos hijos Francisco y Cándida de 10y 12 respectivos, los cuales estudian, Ana vende y cultiva granos básicos (maíz).
Ella junto con el esposo cultivan Maíz  hace 10 años, luego la cosecha la almacenan para todo el año y lo comercializan con los vecinos y personas cercanas a la zona. Ana solicita un préstamo para compra de insumos agrícolas como son abono y fertilizantes, para el cultivo de maíz, esto le permitirá  fertilizar el cultivo para obtener una buena cosecha.
Los objetivos son cumplir con las obligaciones del préstamo para seguir trabajando, aumentar el área de terreno cultivado, para aumentar la rentabilidad del negocio, así contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 29 years old and lives in San Miguel with her husband and their two children Francisco, 10, and Cándida, 12. The children are in school and Ana works cultivating and selling corn. Ana and her husband have been growing corn for ten years. They store their harvest and sell it over the whole year to their neighbors and those who live nearby. Ana is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies, such as manure and fertilizers, for growing corn. This will enable her to fertilize her crops and obtain a better yield. Ana’s goals are to fulfill her loan obligations and continue working. She would like to increase the area under cultivation to improve the profitability of the business and contribute to bettering the quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jeffrey Hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: agricultural supplies such as manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Mayka Karina

texts.es:
Mayka de 38 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil, (zona urbana, la mayoría de los habitantes son comerciantes informales), ella tiene una papelería en el patio delantero de su casa.  

Como necesitaba dinero para ayudar a su familia, tuvo trabajar muy duro para poder comprar artículos y venderlos a sus vecinos, empezó con cuadernos y plumas poco a poco fue incrementando su capital de trabajo, ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. 

Para poder incrementar su negocio y tener oportunidad de tener su propio local ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos, libros y plumas, ella quiere en el futuro tener su propia empresa de papelería.
texts.en:
Mayka is 38 years old and lives in the Guasmo neighborhood of Guayaquil (an urban area where the majority of the residents work in informal trade.) She sells stationery items on the patio in front of her house. As she needed money to help her family, she had to work very hard so that she could buy items and sell them to her neighbors. She started out selling notebooks and pens, and then gradually increased her working capital. Now she works from 8am until 9pm each day. In order to increase her business and have the opportunity to have her own shop, she wants to use the loan to buy notebooks, books and pens. In the future, she wants to have her own stationery company.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy notebooks, books and pens

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Juana V. tiene 45 años de edad, vive en el Benque Jamastran El Paraiso.
Juana se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia que opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia EMMI. la sra. Juana tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
Doña Juana esta casada con el señor Oscar Martínez quien se dedica al comercio, sale a vender mercaderia en su carro, 
Juana y Oscar tienen 4 hijos de los cuales solamente depende uno de ellos.
Las ganancias obtenidas de su negocio las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y pagar los estudios de su hijo.
Doña Juana no cuenta con el capital necesario para surtir su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia para surtir su negocio.

su meta es darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, que su hijo se gradue de sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mrs Juana V. is 45 years old and lives at Benque Jamastran El Paraiso. Juana makes a living selling general purpose products and owns a small general store called Pulperia EMMI. Juana has several years in this business. Mrs. Juana is married to Mr. Oscar Martínez who is a merchant, he sell products from his car. Juana and Oscar have 4 children, all of whom depend on them. The income from their businesses is used to cover their household expenses and the education of their children. Doña Juana does not have the capital to supply her business. The loan will be used to buy merchandise to stock her business. Her goal is to provide a better quality of life for her family and for her son to complete his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beans, rice, sugar, butter, oil, tortillas, bread, crackers, coffee, soaps, toilet paper, intant soups.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en:
Faafetai I. is 56 and married with 6 children. She owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale and has many years of experience in this business. Faafetai needs a loan of WST$1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Faafetai joined SPBD in 2007. This is her fourth loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Faafetai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD: Greg Casagrande founded SPBD in 2000 and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: la Sra. Celia llego a nuestra oficina con la intencion de solicitar un  prestamo en grupo, pero al final se desanimaron y sacaron con otra persona y se garantizaron ambas este es ya su segundo credito en nuestra institucion, Doña Celia vive en el Barrio Cafetal de la zona el Dorado en donde tiene su casita propia en la que vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, su actividad es venta de desayuno y almuerzo, y como segunda actividad tambien tiene una rockola mientras los clientes disfrutan de su rico almuerzo pueden escuchar una buena musica, el dinero solicitado sera para aumentar su capital en la venta de comidas, ya que tiene mucha demanda, su objetivo es llegar a colocar en su mismo domicilio una pension para lo cual le falta la infraestructura y tambien quiere comprar mas mesas y sillas , una parte del dinero tambien sera para la misma "agradezco a la institucion por la confianza brinda a mi persona. "argumento".
texts.en:
Celia came to our office with the intention of requesting a loan in her group, but in the end she got discouraged and took up with another person, and they are going to guarantee each other's loans. This is her second loan from our institution. Celia lives in the Cafetal neighborhood in the Dorado area, where she has her own home where she lives with her husband and their 4 children. She sells breakfasts and lunches, and as a second activity she also has a jukebox, so that while her customers enjoy their delicious lunch they can also listen to good music. The money she requests will be used to increase her capital for her business selling food, for which she has a lot of demand. She has a goal of eventually renting out rooms in her house, but she currently lacks the infrastructure for this. In addition, she wants to buy more tables and chairs; part of the money will be used to do this. "I am grateful to the institution for the confidence it is placing in me," she says.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: José Rodolfo

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 33 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y su hijo en casa de su madre, ubicada en el sector La Hollería, una de las tantas zonas rurales que conforman el distrito de Mórrope, distrito perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque que se encuentra situado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Su profesión original es la de alfarero, confecciona ollas y vasijas de barro en su casa a pedido de un intermediario que viene a recoger sus productos eventualmente. Con un dinero que tenía ahorrado instaló una bodega en su vivienda, allí el y su esposa atienden a sus clientes y les brindan productos de primera necesidad por los cuales tendrían que dirigirse hasta el pueblo central (a 20 minutos de distancia) para poder adquirirlos.

Eventualmente también trabaja como obrero de construcción civil, pero este trabajo no es permanente así como su labor de alfarero. Por este motivo José se esfuerza del mejor modo posible para poder sacar su negocio adelante, actualmente el desea ampliarlo con la compra de mas productos, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

José ya ha trabajado anteriormente con el Fondo Kiva y con Nuestra Institución, gracias a su anterior préstamo el consiguió implementar su bodega con mas productos y de ese modo pudo percibir mayores ganancias, actualmente el se encuentra agradecido con las personas que lo apoyaron en la primera oportunidad y desea seguir trabajando para lograr sus metas y salir adelante.
texts.en:
José is a 33 year-old family man who lives with his wife and son in his mother's house. The house is located in the La Holleria sector, one of many rural areas of the Morrope district of the Lambayeque Province, one hour from the town of Chiclayo. He is a potter by trade, crafting clay pots and pans by request of a middle man who comes to take his products every now and then. With money he had saved he opened a general store in his home. That is where he and his wife attend their customers and offer them basic good for which they would otherwise have to travel to the central village (20 minutes away) to get. He also has a construction job but just as with his pottery job, it is not a permanent position. Because of that, Jose strives as best he can to move ahead with his business. Currently he wishes to expand it by buying more inventory and has requested Edpyme Alternative a loan for 1,500 nuevos soles. Jose has worked before with Kiva and with our bank. Thanks to his previous loan he was able to supply his general store with inventory and increase his income. He is thankful to the people who supported him the first time and wishes to keep working to accomplish his goals and move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic goods to expand general store

location.town: Caserío La Holleria - C. P. M. El Romero - Morrope

loans.name: Faleata

texts.en:
Faleata P. is 27 and married with two children. She owns a business selling pork products in the local community. Faleata has two years of experience in this business.  She needs a loan of WST$750 to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods and plans to use her earnings (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Faleata joined SPBD in 2008. This is her third loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Faleata's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD:  In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods

loans.name: Lourdes Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Lourdes L. es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y reside en el Barrio Oriental en Danli, El Paraiso.

Doña Lourdes se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de comidas y golosinas como ser: enchiladas, chilaquiles, baleadas, tortillas con quesillo, catrachitas, yuca con chicharron, tacos, refresco de botellas y agua natural. Doña Lourdes tiene un año de haber iniciado con este tipo de negocio y es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar eficientemente. 

El lugar donde se encuentra ubicado su negocio es muy apto para este tipo de actividad ya que es la única caseta que funciona dentro del establecimiento donde estan las oficinas de Recursos Naturales, de la ciudad de Danlí, lugar donde también se encuentran las Oficinas de la SAG, SENASA, PRALEBAH, PROHECO y la Dirección Distrital de Educación. La mayoría de sus clientes son empleados de las instituciones antes descritas, y muchos empleados consumen los alimentos al crédito y le pagan cuando reciben sus respectivos salarios. 
Cabe  mencionar que también tiene clientes de las zonas rurales o personas que visitan estas oficinas ya que son oficinas de bastante trámite para las personas que viven cerca del casco urbano. 

Doña Lourdes utilizara el credito para comprar los insumos necesarios para la fabricacion de los diferentes platos que ofrece en su negocio.

Con mayores ventas, ella espera invertir las ganancias obtenidas para pagar los gastos estudiantiles y crianza de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lourdes L. is a single mother of two children and lives in the Oriental neighborhood in Danli, El Paraiso. Doña Lourdes has a business of selling food and sweets such as enchiladas, chilaquiles, baleadas, tortillas with cheese, catrachitas, yucca with pork cracklings, tacos, bottled beverages and natural water. Doña Lourdes has a year in this business and it should be noted that during this time she has efficiently managed it. The place where her business is located is good for this type of activity since it is the only stand at the establishment where the offices of the Department of Natural Resources of the city of Danli are located, also a place where the offices of SAG, Senasa, Pralebah, Proheco and the District Office of Education are housed. The majority of her customers are the employees of these institutions, and many of the employees buy food on credit and pay her when they get their paychecks. She also has customers from rural areas or people visiting these offices. which have a fair amount of traffic by people that live near the city center. Doña Lourdes will use the loan to buy necessary supplies for the making of the various dishes that she sells at her business. With increased sales. she hopes to invest her income in the payment of educational expenses and support of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages, water, tortillas, beans, cheese, oil, beef, lard, salt, condiments, butter, corn flour, yucca, pork cracklings and salsa.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 40 años de edad, ella vive con Santos su esposo de 47 años de edad y sus dos hijos. Todos juntos viven en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de joyas como: aretes, collares en variedad de colores y diseños, que son del gusto de la mayoría del cliente. Carmen durante toda su vida ha realizado variedad de oficios y ahora con esta actividad le es más conveniente por que le permite dedicarse a su hogar. Su gran poder de convencimiento es una de las armas que tiene para poder vender la mercadería que posee. En el futuro quiere tener un negocio mucho más grande donde pueda ofrecer tranquilamente la joyería que tiene. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará joyas en cantidad y diversidad para así lograr mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 40 years old. She lives with her 47 year old husband Santos and their two children. They all live together in their own home. She sells jewellry such as earrings and necklaces in a variety of colours and designs, which appeal to most of the customers. All her life, Carmen has worked at a variety of jobs and finds this one the most convenient because it lets her focus on her home. Her great power of persuasion is one of the tools she uses to sell her merchandise. In the future, she'd like to have a much larger store where she could offer her jewellery more quietly. This is her first loan with MFP and she has committed to be very punctual with all of her payments. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy a greater quantity and diversity of jewellery to be able to make better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Roxana Estefa

texts.es: La señora Roxana se dedica a la venta de helados en la puerta del parque Zoológico, este lugar es muy conocido y frecuentado por Turistas ya que es una atracción ya que es el Zoológico mas alto del mundo,  también por tener una variedad de animales andinos, La Sra. Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace bastante tiempo, con la que  mantiene a su hogar conformado por sus Padres  y ella,  el crédito que solicito es para la refacción de su vivienda ya que necesita comprar material de construcción como ser arena, cemento, ladrillo, pintura, tejas, etc.  ya que la cliente por el momento vive en casa alquilada hasta que termine de refaccionar su vivienda, también podemos indicar que la cliente es bastante trabajadora y muy responsable por lo que se beneficio con la tasa kiva, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza que se le brindo en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Roxana sells ice cream at the entrance of the Zoo. The Zoo is very well known and a popular tourist attraction. It is the highest located Zoo in the world and presents a variety of Andean animals. She has been in this activity for a long time. It is how she supports her home, which consists of her parents and her. She requests the loan for home improvement. She needs to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, tiles, paint, roofing and others. She is living in a rental home until the improvements can be finished. She is a hardworking and responsible lady and will benefit from the Kiva interest rate. She is very thankful for the trust Emprender and Kiva has shown her by granting her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home Improvement

loans.name: Eulalia Maria

texts.es:
Eulalia de 57 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil, (zona urbana, la mayoría de los habitantes son comerciantes informales), ella tiene una tienda de víveres. 

Empezó a trabaja desde que uno de sus hijos tuvo una crisis económica y ella tuvo que encargase de los gastos familiares, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ella ha podido poner una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, trabaja hasta el anochecer.

Para poder continuar con su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo leche, carnes y huevos y así surtirla mas, en el futuro quiere que su tienda este mas surtida y tener salud para continuar trabando.
texts.en:
Eulalia, age 57, lives in the Guasmo of Guayaquil (an urban area where the majority of its inhabitants sell merchandise informally, not in stores). She has a grocery store. She started working when one of her children had a financial crisis. She had to take charge of the family expenses. Since that time she has been able to have a small store in the back part of her house. She works until nightfall. In order to be able to continue with her store, she wants to use the loan to buy milk, meat, and eggs to stock her store more. In the future she wants her store to be better stocked and to have good health to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Milk, meat, and bones

loans.name: Flaminio

texts.es:
El Sr. Flaminio es casado con la Sra. Estelvina hace varios años tienen 1 hijo menor que aún es bebe.
Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que esta ubicado  en un barrio muy poblado de la zona, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizaron anteriormente.
Además de la despensa tienen una fábrica de helados ya que en la zona existe mucho mercado.
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando pueden construir su casa propia y aumentar el volumen de las ventas en su negocio.
El ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
El ya tuvo otros créditos con nosotros y cumplió en forma excelente con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Flaminio has been married to Estelvina for several years. They have one child who is still a baby. Together they set up a general store in their home, which is located in a very crowded neighborhood in the area. They started out with a small capital investment, which they had earned working on other jobs in the past. In addition to the general store they have an ice cream factory; there is a great market for it in the area. Thanks to the work they are doing they are able to build their own house and increase the volume of sales in their business. He has demonstrated himself to be a very responsible person who is honest about his commitments. He has had other loans with us, and he met his obligations in an outstanding manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, noodles, soap, cleaning products, and other products

loans.name: Ciudad Real Group

texts.es:
El señor Rufino socio emprendedor y entusiasta, tiene 45 años D. edad, separado con  1 hijo D. 18 años D. edad, (vive con su mama), su domicilio está ubicado en la zona D. Huáscar - distrito D. Santa Anita, departamento D.  Lima, trabajaba como chofer D. combi desD. hace 14 años, se inicio en esta labor porque tuvo la oportunidad D. comprarse un carro con los ahorros que pudo lograr reunir, ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta D. carne en el mercado. 
Viene trabajando con Edaprospo - Prosperidad desD. hace 3 años, asume el cargo D. presidente D. la alcancía comunal “Ciudad Real” la cual está  conformada por 8 socios quienes realizan diversas actividades como: reciclaje, venta D. ropa, venta D. comida, bodega y otros.
