El gran sueño D. Rufino es tener un puesto propio en el mercado ya que el trabajo que actualmente desempeña no le rinD. para cubrir sus gastos y que su hijo estudie en la universidad.
Con su reciente préstamo  planifica comprar repuestos para su carro. Hasta el momento ha logrado levantar las paredes D.  su vivienda  con material noble (ladrillos) pero su anhelo es  terminar D. construirla (techar, ponerle piso, etc.).
texts.en:
Rufino, an entrepreneurial and enthusiastic member, is 45. He is separated and has 1 son who is 18 (and lives with his mother). Rufino's home is located in the Huáscar zone, Santa Anita district, Lima department. He has worked as a chauffeur with a combi van for 14 years, beginning this business because he had the opportunity to buy a car with the savings that he was able to collect. Before this Rufino used to sell meat in the market. He has worked with Edaprospo - Prosperidad for 3 years, assuming the role of president in the communal bank 'Ciudad Real', a group which is maD. up of 8 members who do different activities such as recycling, clothing sales, food sales, a grocery store and others. Rufino's big dream is have his own stall in the market as the work that he carries out doesn't yield enough to cover his costs, and his son also studies at university. With this loan he plans to buy spare parts for his car. He has been able to build the walls for his house with honest material (bricks) but his dream is finish building his house (roof, flooring etc).

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for a car

loans.name: Hugo Darío

texts.es:
El  Sr Hugo  está casado con la señora Ramona, quien se dedica a la venta comida, él se dedica a la reparación de autos,  cuyo trabajo  le genera  un buen ingreso.

Con la ayuda de su esposa  e hijos  están  saliendo adelante con esmero y dedicación. 
Hoy día él es un microempresario exitoso con  mucha  clientela, debido a su buen trato. 
Es una persona muy responsable con sus compromisos y con ansias de progreso.
El solicita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas que el necesita en su taller.
texts.en:
Hugo is married to Ramona; she sells food. He repairs cars, and his work generates a good income. With the help of his wife and children, and with great care and dedication, they are getting ahead. Now his is a successful small businessman. He has a lot of customers because of his good service. He is a very responsible person with his commitments, and he is eager to make progress. He is requesting the loan to buy tools that he needs for his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar tiene 35 años de edad, él vive con su pareja Carla de 25 años y su pequeño hijo en su casa propia. Hace más de 6 años se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte, trasladando por diversas rutas en el distrito donde vive. Le resulta muy rentable pues él, además que es una persona muy comunicativa y siempre esta conversando con sus clientes, ahora se encuentra muy contento pues gracias a su trabajo  puede otorgarle a su familia un buen porvenir, aunque no se fácil realizarlo pues el manejar de un vehiculo requiere de gran precisión y responsabilidad y por tal sus clientes confían en él. Es su segundo crédito con MFP por lo que asegura que será muy puntual con todos los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, le dará la refacción necesaria a su vehiculo, y así brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Oscar is 35 years old and lives with his partner Carla, 25, and their small son, in their own home. For more than 6 years he has provided a transport service, travelling over diverse routes in the district where he lives. This is a very profitable business for him, as he is a very communicative person and is always talking to his clients. Oscar is very content because thanks to his job he can provide well for his family, although it hasn't been easy to do as driving a vehicle requires a great deal of precision and responsibility, and his clients trust him. This is Oscar's second loan with MFP and he promises that he will be very punctual with his repayments. With the loan he is seeking Oscar will get the necessary spare parts for his car and in this way deliver better service.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Technical car maintenance

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Maria Magdalena C. tiene 54 años de edad, vive en el Benque Danli, Maria se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería, tiene una pequeña pulperia la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “GINA”.
Doña Maria tiene tres 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio y se puede observar que durante este tiempo lo a sabido administrar ya que el crecimiento de su negocio es notable.
La señora C. esta casada con el señor Darío Funez quien se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos (Agricultor). Actualmente depende solo una persona que es su hijo.
Las ganancias obtenidas de su negocio le sirven para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y con los estudios de su hijo.

el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia al por mayor y asi tener mas ganancias.
doña Maria es una mujer muy alegre y amable.
texts.en:
María Magdalena C., 54, lives in El Benque, Danli. She is a grocer. She has a small grocery store called Pulpería “GINA”. María has been in this line of work for three years and one can observe that during this time she has known how to administer it well because her business has grown quite a bit. Mrs. C. is married to Darío Fúnez who is a farmer of basic grains. Currently they only have one dependent, their son. Profits from her business help her husband cover household expenses and pay for their son’s education. She will use the funds to buy merchandise at wholesale thus generating higher profits. María is a cheerful and kind woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lard, cooking oil, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, cookies, churros, candies, salt, tortillas, pastas, sauces, toilet paper.

loans.name: Emerita Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Emerita del Carmen A. es madre soltera y reside con sus hijos en el Barrio Oriental de Danli, El Paraiso. 

El negocio de Doña Emerita es la confección de cameras, cortinas, edredones, cubre colchones, y otras manualidades. Doña Emerita tiene varios años  de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, ganándose a su clientela por su experiencia y calidad en la confección de cameras y demás accesorios para el hogar.

Doña Emerita utilizara el prestamo para la compra de materia prima y seguir confeccionando sus cameras. Con las ganancias que le ha generado su negocio ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y apoyar la educación de sus hijos con carreras universitarias.
texts.en:
Emerita del Carmen A. is a single mother who lives in Barrio Oriental, Danli, El Paraíso with her children. She makes bed linens like: comforters, mattress covers, bedspreads, box spring skirts and other crafts. She has been in this line of work for several years having won over many regular customers thanks to her experience and the quality of her bed linens and other household items she makes. Emerita will use the loan to buy raw materials to continue making her items. Profits from her business have made it possible for her to support her family and help her children study university careers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric to make bed linens.

loans.name: José Ramos

texts.es:
José Ramos tiene 38 años D. edad, es casado y tiene un hijo dependiente, resiD. en el caserío Positos del distrito D. Mórrope, una zona rural dedicada principalmente a L. agricultura y que se encuentra bastante alejada del pueblo central, está situada a una hora y media D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a L. comercialización D. arroz: el adquiereeste producto y algunos D. sus derivados (como el polvillo) a los diversos molinos D. L. zona para luego venderlos por sacos a las bodegas y establecimientos D. L. zona donD. vive y D. zonas aledañas. El negocio le brinda algunos ingresos estables con los que trata D. mantener a su familia. Adicionalmente se dedica a L. crianza y venta D. animales

José desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más arroz para aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, esto, aprovechando que es temporada se cosechas en L. región y que este producto baja D. precio en estas semanas, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

José es unhombre bastante trabajador y responsable, en L. zona donD. vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquiL. y responsable.
texts.en:
José Ramos, 38, is married and has a dependent son. He lives in Positos, Mórrope district, a rural area mostly dedicated to farming since it is quite far from the main town. It is located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. He is a rice merchant. He acquires this product and some of its derivatives, like “polvillo” (rice powder) from the various mills in the area and then sells it in sacks to the stores and establishments in the area where he lives and in adjacent areas. The business produces stable income with which he tries to support his family. In addition, he raises small farm animals for sale. José wants to expand his business buying more rice to increase his sales and thus his profits. He does this now taking advantage of the fact that it’s rice harvest time in the area and rice prices decrease during these weeks. In order to reach this goal, he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 1500 new soles. José is quite a hard working, responsible man. Where he lives his neighbors and acquaintances consider him to be a level-headed, responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.es:
Apolinaria tiene 60 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera del Departamento de Morazán,  vive con tres nietos, Willber de 13 años, Ivania de 19 años y Benito de 1 año de edad,  ella posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, venta de productos lácteos y tamales.
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos como son: café, aceite, azúcar, maíz, frijoles, y lácteos, queso, crema y dos veces por semana elabora tamales (producto de maíz con carne de pollo) este negocio es el apoyo económico para la familia. Apolinaria es una persona emprendedora que le gusta trabajar y tener su propio negocio. Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar una plancha para elaborar pupusas (tortilla de maíz con queso, carne de cerdo), y también invertir una parte para abastecer la tienda con productos nuevos. 
Objetivo es manejar la tienda con productos suficiente para mantener el negocio a largo plazo, contribuir   para mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia.
texts.en:
Apolinaria, 60, lives in San Francisco Gotera, Morazán department with three granchildren: Wilber, 13, Ivania, 19, and Benito, 1. She has a grocery store and also sells dairy products and tamales. She sells products like: coffee, cooking oil, sugar, corn, beans, dairy products, cheese and cream. Twice a week she makes tamales (corn meal stuffed with chicken meat). The business is the family’s source of support. Apolinaria is an enterprising woman who enjoys working and having her own business. She is asking for funds to buy a pupusa (corn tortilla stuffed with cheese and pork) press and also to invest part of the funds to stock the store with new items. Her goal is to stock the store with sufficient items for the long term to provide this family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a pupusa press and stock the store with new items: coffee, cooking oil, sugar, corn, beans, dairy products, cheese.

loans.name: Juntos Unidos Iremos Al Camino Del Exito Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “JUICE”, está ubicado en el Agustino, es una alcancía que trabaja con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desD. hace 3 años, está conformado por 12 socios, asume el cargo D. presidenta la señora Carmen Victoria 32 años D. edad, casada, con 2 hijos D. 10 y 12 años, se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo en la tienda D. su mama, se inicio por la invitación D. una amiga, además es profesora D. nivel primaria, un grupo D. socios se dedican a las actividades D. servicio como ayudante cocinero, otro presta servicio D. albañil y chofer D. transporte público y otro grupo se dedica a la venta D.  comidas y refrescos en los mercados.
Nuestros socios decidieron el nombre D. JUICE (JUNTOS IREMOS AL CAMINO DEL ÉXITO), ya que sienten más identificados con él, con su reciente préstamo todos los socios lo invertirán en la compra D. mercadería para ampliar su pequeño negocio y con ello tener una mejor calidad D. vida.
Los socios están muy contentos y valoran el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a la devolución  del préstamo en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'JUICE' is located in el Agustino. It has worked with Edaprospo - Prosperidad for 3 years and is maD. up of 12 members. Carmen Victoria, 32, assumes the role of president. She is married with 2 children - 10 and 12, and works selling catalogue beauty products in her mother's shop. She began this business via a friend's invitation. Carmen Victoria is also a primary school teacher. The other members of the group do jobs such as chef's assistant, builder, public transport driver and others work selling food and refreshments in the markets. These members decided on the name JUICE (Together United We Will Go on the Path to Success) as they most identified with this name. With this loan the members will invest in purchasing merchandise to expand their small businesses and have a better quality of life. The members are very happy and value the support given to them, and promise to return the loan within the specified time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Tierra Fertil 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Laura is the coordinator of her group Tierra Fertil 1, 2 & 3 (Fertile Ground). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long term partner and 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to improve her business.

Laura is excited to take her first loan. She plans to invest it in her business by buying hot dog sausages to sell nearby her house. She started this business 6 months ago, when her church planned an outdoor activity and she decided to sell baked sausages. Now, for a second business activity, she wants to sell shoes and accessories from a catalog. She will invest the profits in her business. Her dreams after having a successful business are to attend college and have her own home.

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in L. Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial area north of the capital where free traD. zones are common. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy sausages, shoes, and accessories to resell.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es: Luis Miguel C. S., tiene la edad de 19 años, está soltero, no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el almácigo para la siembra y el  abono y el fertilizante necesarios para su apropiado desarrollo. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Cuenta con un área de cultivo, la zona es propicia para este cultivo. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Luis Miguel  trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Luis Miguel C. S. is 19 years old, single with no children, and lives with his parents. The loan he wants is to help his farm, specifically, with the growing of coffee. The idea is to buy the supplies required for planting, and the fertilizer necessary for the coffee to develop properly. He wants to maintain his crops well so he can produce high quality coffee, and therefore obtain better prices for his product. He has an area to cultivate, and the region favors this type of crop. This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy for the opportunities they provide for him. Luis Miguel has been working in the agricultural arena for several years. He hopes to provide a higher standard of living for his family in the future, and more financial stability. He wants to continue to grow both as a person and a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for planting coffee.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma R. R. se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería, cuenta con una pequeña pulperia que opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “IRMA”.
Doña Irma tiene varios años de dedicarse al comercio y se puede observar que su negocio lo a sabido administrar.
La señora Irma R. es soltera y dependen tres personas de ella.
La señora Irma R. no cuenta con el capital suficiente para surtir su negocio y en estos momentos tiene mucha demanda de parte de sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor y asi tener mas ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Irma R. is a merchant. She has a small grocery store called Pulpería “IRMA”. Irma has been a merchant for several years and one can see that she has known how to administer her business well. Mrs. R. is single and has three people who are dependent on her. Irma does not have sufficient funds to stock her store yet currently faces much demand from her customers. She will use the loan to buy more stock items at wholesale so that she can generate higher profits which she needs to cover household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks, juices, bread, cookies, churros, lard, cooking oil, beans, rice, sugar, corn flour, tortillas, soups, powdered drinks, toothpaste, toilet paper.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Inmaculada Group

texts.es:
Este comité se conformo mediante el deseo de las señoras de seguir adelante para sacar de la mejor forma a sus familias, y para ello realizan diversas.
Dependiendo de la situación en que se encuentra cada una invierte su crédito en una actividad que le pueda retribuir en un ingreso con ganancias que ellas puedan usar para sus familias.
Así la señora Bibiana invirtió en su crédito en la compra de bebidas para ofrecer en una cantina que ella posee en su casa.
Ella cuenta con muchos clientes de la zona quienes visitan su local frecuentemente en especial en horas de la noche ya también ella ofrece comestibles diversos como empanadas, hamburguesas y pizzas.
texts.en:
This committee came together thanks to the women’s wish to help their families get ahead in the best way possible. To do so, they are involved in a variety of commercial activities. Depending on each one’s situation, each invests her loan in an activity that will result in income with profits that they can use for their families. Thus, Bibiana used her loan to buy beverages for a bar she has in her home. She has many customers in the area that visit her establishment frequently, especially at night, because she also offers food items like: turnovers, hamburgers and pizzas.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages like wine and beer.

loans.name: Las Aretillas Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SOLIDARIO SE LLAMA LAS ARETILLAS. ESTA UBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD DE HUEYAPAN, TETELA DEL VOLCAN, EN EL ESTADO DE MORELOS. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 4 INTEGRANTES QUE SE CONOCEN Y SON VECINOS. ESTE ES SU PRIMER PRESTAMO CON FUNDACION REALIDAD.
LA REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO SE LLAMA CELIA M. F., TIENE 43 AÑOS ESTUDIO HASTA EL 6º. AÑO DE PRIMARIA, TIENE 3 HIJOS 1 HOMBRE Y 2 MUJERES (EUDOCIO TENE 28 AÑOS Y TRABAJA EN LOS ESTADOS UNIDOS, MIRIAM TIENE 20 AÑOS Y HERMINIA TIENE 16 AÑOS ACABA DE TERMINAR DE ESTUDIAR LA SECUNDARIA.
CELIA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE REFRESCOS Y CHICHARRONES EN SU CASA EN RANCHO LOS TEJOCOTES, SU CASA ESTÁ EN LAS ULTIMAS CASAS DEL CERRO Y SOLICITO SU PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR REFRESCOS POR CAJA DE LAS MARCAS: "JARRITO Y RED COLA" DE 2 LITRO, ACEITE, AZUCAR, CHICHARRONES. COMENTA QUE INICIO SU NEGOCIO HACE 2 AÑOS, SU HIJO QUE ESTA EN LOS ESTADOS UNIDOS LE ENVIO DINERO Y DECIDIO COMPRAR REFRESCOS Y CHICHARRONES PARA COMENZAR CON LA VENTA.
SUS CLIENTES SON SUS VECINOS QUE SE VAN A TRABAJAR AL CAMPO PASAN A COMPRAR REFRESCOS O CHICHARRONES, LE AYUDAN SUS HIJAS CON EL NEGOCIO YA QUE LO CONSIDERAN IMPORTANTE PORQUE DE AHÍ TIENE INGRESOS PARA LA COMIDA Y LOS GASTOS DE LA CASA, ESTA MUY CONTENTA CON EL PRESTAMO QUE LE DIERON Y ESPERA VER SU NEGOCIO MAS SURTIDO, MAS GRANDE. EN SU PUEBLO DE HUEYAPAN HAY MUCHA VEGETACION, PINOS, ARBOLES FRUTALES COMO PERA, MANZANA, DURAZNO, CAPULIN, TEJOCOTE, EL CLIMA ES TEMPLADO Y TAMBIEN HAY ANIMALES
LOS DEMÁS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON:
*HERLINDA P. A. VA A COMPRA PLANTAS FRUTALES, CIRUELA, DURAZNO, MANZANA PARA PLANTAR
* YOLANDA A. C. VA A COMPRAR ABONO, INSECTICIDA POR KILO Y POR BULTO PARA DARLE MANTENIMIENTO A SUS ÁRBOLES FRUTALES
*JUDITH M. P. VA A COMRAR BORREGOS Y CERDOS CHICOS PARA CRIANZA Y VENTA
LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO QUIEREN DECIR A KIVA Y A FUNDACION REALIDAD “AGRADECEMOS EL APOYO Y CONFIANZA QUE NOS ESTAN PROPORCIONADO CON SU PRESTAMO, GRACIAS”
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Las Aretillas. It is located in the Hueyapan community, Tetela del Volcan, in the state of Morelos. The group is comprised of four members who are neighbors and know each other. This is their first loan with the Fundación Realidad. Celia M. F. is the group’s representative. She is 43 years old, and she has a sixth grade education. She has three children, one boy and two girls. Eudocio is 28 years old and works in the United States. Miriam is 20 years old. Herminia is 16 years old, and she just finished high school. Celia sells soft drinks and “chicharrones” (fried pork rinds) in her house in Rancho Los Tejocotes. Her house is one of the last houses on the hill. She requested her loan to buy cases of soft drinks; the brands Jarrito and Red Cola in the two liter size; oil, sugar, and chicarrones. She says that she started her business two years ago. Her son that is in the United States sent her money, and she decided to buy soft drinks and chicarrones in order to start selling. Her customers are her neighbors. When they go to work in the fields they pass by and purchase soft drinks or chicharrones. Her daughters help her with the business because they realize it is important. That is where they get income for food and the household expenses. She is very happy with the loan she was given. She expects to see her business bigger and better stocked. In her community of Hueyapan there is a lot of vegetation and pine trees. There are also fruit trees like pear, apple, peach, cherry, and “tejocote” (Mexican hawthorn). The climate is mild, and there are also animals. The other members of the group are: *Herlinda P. A.: Will buy cherry, peach, and apple plants to plant *Yolanda A. C.: Will buy fertilizer and insecticide by the kilo and in bulk to provide maintenance to her fruit trees *Judith M. P.: Will buy young sheep and pigs to raise and sell The members of the group want to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad, “We appreciate your faith in us and the support you are providing us with the loan. Thank you.”

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, oil, sugar, and "chicharrones" (fried pork rinds)

loans.name: Ever Orlando

texts.es:
El Sr. Ever Orlando A. se ha enfocado en salir adelante siendo comerciante en el Boulevard La Democracia de Danli, El Paraiso. 

La actividad principal del Sr. Ever es la venta y reparacion de relojes en su Relojeria "CRISTAL" donde tiene una gran variedad de relojes de diferentes marcas y estilos para damas, caballeros y niños.

El Sr. Ever utilizara el prestamo para contar con el capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir más su negocio e incrementar sus ventas. Este joven empresario invertira sus ganancias para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ever Orlando A. has focused on getting ahead by being a merchant on La Democracia Boulevard in Danli, El Paraíso. Ever’s main activity is watch repair and sales. He has a watch shop called, Relojería "CRISTAL,” where he stocks a large variety of watches in various styles and brands for women, men and children. Ever will use the loan to buy stock items for his store in order to increase sales. This young entrepreneur will use the profits to improve his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For various styles and brands of watches.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. BELINDA OFELIA, TIENE 42 AÑOS D. EDAD, TIENE 4 HIJOS D. LOS CUALES 3 SON MAYORES D. EDAD Y UNO QUE ES EL MENOR QUE ES EL MOTIVO D. SU LUCHA Y TRABAJO POR SALIR ADELANTE. ELLA FORMA PARTE D. GRUPO "AMIGAS UNIDAS" FORMADO POR 11 INTEGRANTES, LOS CUALES SON RESIDENTES D. DISTRITO D. CARABAYLLO. SUS COMPAÑEROS LA ELIGIERON SECRETARIA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA D. GRUPO.
LA SRA. BELINDA OFELIA SE DEDICA HACE DOS MESES A LA PREPARACIÓN Y VENTA D. DESAYUNOS POR LAS MAÑANAS EN EL MERCADO D. TRAPICHE; Y POR LAS TARDES INSTALA FUERA D. SU CASA UNA MESITA CON SU CARRITO SANGUCHERO QUE LE COMPRÓ SU HIJO PARA LA VENTA D. SANGUCHES, SALCHIPAPAS Y POLLOS BROASTER.
CON ÉSTE TRABAJO LA SRA BELINDA OFELIA CONSIDERA QUE SU MAYOR LOGRO ES HABER OBTENIDO INDEPENDENCIA ECONÓMICA, ADEMÁS D. QUE SU CLIENTELA CRECE CADA DÍA.
SU PRÓXIMA META SERÁ COMPRAR OTRO CARRITO SANGUCHERO PARA QUE SU HIJA D. 18 AÑOS PUEDA ATENDERLO, ES ELLA QUIEN ACTUALMENTE LA APOYA EN LA ATENCIÓN D. LA VENTA D. SALCHIPAPAS.
EL PRESTAMO OBTENIDO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA D. INSUMOS PARA LA PREPARACIÓN D. SANGUCHES, SALCHIPAPAS, ETC; EL PRÉSTAMO LA AYUDA A PODER OBTENER PRECIOS MÁS CÓMODOS YA QUE PODRÁ COMPRAR ALGUNOS INSUMOS A PRECIOS POR MAYOR.
texts.en:
Belinda Ofelia is 42 years old and has 4 children; 3 are grown, and one is still a minor and the reason she struggles to get ahead. She belongs to the group “Unified Friends”, which is comprised of 11 members that live in the Carabayllo district. The members elected her as secretary of the group’s board of directors. For two months, Belinda Ofelia has dedicated herself to preparing and selling breakfasts at the market of Trapiche. In the afternoons, she sets up a little table outsiD. her home along with a food cart that her son bought her so she could sell sandwiches, salchipapas (sausage and French fries) and roasted chicken. Belinda Ofelia considers her greatest triumph to be achieving financial independence through this work. In addition, her customer base is growing each and every day. Her next goal is to buy another food cart for her 18-year old daughter to use. It is her daughter who currently helps her with selling of the salchipapas. The loan would be used to buy supplies for making sandwiches, salchipapas, etc. These funds will also help her to obtain better prices for her ingredients, and also to buy some of the supplies at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of supplies for making salchipapas and breakfasts.

loans.name: Reiman

texts.es: Reiman A. C., tiene la edad de 25 años, está casado, tiene un hijo de 3 años, que es su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para la siembra de frijoles. La idea es  preparar  el terreno para la siembra  de frijoles, comprar los insumos necesarios y darle el adecuado mantenimiento a la siembra de frijol, para cuando estén listos para cosechar los puedan vender y obtener mayores ganancias.  Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Reiman  tiene varios años de experiencia en la agricultura, sobre todo en la siembra de granos básicos, el está seguro de que le va a ir muy bien en el nuevo proyecto. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Reiman A. C. is 25 years old, married, and has a 3-year old son who is his first priority. He wants this loan so he can plant beans. The idea is to prepare the soil for planting, and buying the necessary supplies to properly maintain his crop. Then, when they are ready for harvest, he would be able to sell the product and generate a greater profit. This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR and he is very glad for the opportunities they provide for him. Reiman has several years of experience in farming, particularly in the planting of pulses. He is sure that his new endeavor will go well. He hopes for a bright future, to be able to provide his family with a higher standard of living and financial stability, and to be able to continue growing both as a person and a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for planting beans.

loans.name: Rony Neftali

texts.es:
El Sr. Rony A., se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es el destazo de Ganado, negocio que opera bajo el nombre de Carnicería “A.” que esta ubicado en la aldea de Santa Ana, Jamastran.
Don Rony, tiene un año de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio y es notable que durante este tiempo lo a sabido administrar, ya que nos comento que el empezó a destazar una vaca cada 15 días y actualmente esta destazando una vaca por semana y la demanda de carne va en aumento, él anteriormente destazaba y vendía la carne solo con los vecinos de la aldea de Santa Ana y El Coyolar;  ahora sale a vender a otras aldeas y comunidades donde ya tiene los clientes y lo esperan cada fin de semana con la carne.

Don Rony es compañero de hogar de la Señora Jessica Gonzáles la cual es ama de casa y se dedica al cuidado de sus 2 hijos y a los trabajos del hogar.
Rony con las ganancias generadas de su negocio ha logrado pagar los gastos escolares y crianza de sus hijos.  

El Sr. A. en la actualidad no cuenta con el capital necesario para trabajar mas libremente, ya que cuando sale a comprar las reses que necesita para el destazo, muchas veces le salen vendiendo mas de una vaca y el no pude comprárselas por falta de capital. 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas vacas para destazo.
texts.en:
Rony A. is a butcher. He has a butcher shop called, Carnicería “A.” located in the village of Santa Ana, Jamastran. Rony has been in this line of work for a year and it is noteworthy that in this time he has known how to administer it well in that he commented to us that he started out butchering a cow every 15 days and now he’s butchering a cow a week and demand for meat is increasing. He used to butcher and sell meat only to his neighbors in the villages of Santa Ana and El Coyolar. Now, however, he goes out to other villages and communities where he already has customers that expect him to bring meat every weekend. Rony is housemate to Jessica Gonzáles who is a housewife; she cares for their two children and does the household chores. Rony will use profits from his business to raise his children and pay for their schooling. Currently, Mr. A. lacks enough capital to work more efficiently because when he goes out to buy cows to butcher often he is offered more than one to buy but he can’t afford to do so because of lack of capital. He will use the loan to buy more cows to butcher.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cows.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mujeres Divinas Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SOLIDARIO SE LLAMA MUJERES DIVINAS. ESTA UBICADO EN LA COMINIDAD DE AXOCHIAPAN, EN EL ESTADO DE MORELOS, MEXICO EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 7 INTEGRANTES QUE SE CONOCEN POR SER VECINOS, ESTE ES SU 2º. PRESTAMO CON FUNDACION REALIDAD. 
EL REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO ES LA SEÑORA FLORENCIA V. S. TIENE 51 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTUDIO HATA EL 1er. AÑO DE SECUNDARIA Y TIENE EN TOTAL 5 HIJOS 3 HOMBRES Y 2 MUJERES, DEYSER TIENE 29 AÑOS, HERICK TIENE 24 AÑOS, EFRAIN TIENE 12 AÑOS Y ESTA ESTUDIANDO, VIANEY TIENE 30 AÑOS Y YUSSELL 26 AÑOS. LA SEÑORA FLORENCIA TIENE SU NEGOCIO DE BALCONERIA VENDE PUERTAS, VENTANAS, VITRINAS, VIDRIOS, PECERAS Y SOLICITO SU PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR PERFILES DE ALUMINIO. 
FLORENCIA INICIO SU NEGOCIO HACE 25 AÑOS, VIVIAN EN LA CIUDAD DE MEXICO Y UN MUCHACHO DE MEXICO SE ASOCIO CON SU ESPOSO Y LE ENSEÑO A TRABAJAR LA BALCONERIA EN ALUMINIO, ANTES DE TENER ÉSTE NEGOCIO EN LA CIUDAD DE MEXICO VENDIA PURO VIDRIO, FUE AHORRANDO Y FUE COMPRANDO MERCANCIA Y CON LO QUE LES ENSEÑO ESTE MUCHACHO ES COMO AMPLIARON SU NEGOCIO A VIDRIOS Y BALCONERIA. AHORA SU NEGOCIO LO ATIENDEN DESDE SU CASA EN AXOCHIAPAN Y ES IMPORTANTE POR QUE ES UN PORVENIR, TIENE INGRESOS PARA EL FUTURO DE AHÍ HAN ESTUDIADO SUS HIJOS Y ESPERA QUE EL MAS PEQUEÑO DE SUS HIJOS SIGA ESTUDIANDO. LO QUE MAS LE GUSTA ES CUANDO LOS TRABAJOS ESTAN TERMINADOS LAS VENTANAS, PUERTAS, VITRINAS. ELLA RECUERDA CUANDO SUS HIJOS APRENDIERON A TRABAJAR EL NEGOCIO DE LA BALCONERIA, TAMBIEN LES GUSTO TRABAJAR EN EL MISMO OFICIO Y UNO DE SUS HIJOS TIENE SU NEGOCIO APARTE EN EL MISMO RAMO BALCONERIA, ACUDEN A SU TIENDA CLIENTES DE AXOCHIPAN Y DE SUS ALREDEDORES. AXOCHIAPAN ES UN LUGAR MUY TRANQUILO, CUENTA CON TODOS LOS SERVICIOS.
LOS OTROS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON: ANA LIDIA C. R. VA A COMPRAR CON SU PRESTAMO ZAPATOS DE DAMA Y CABALLERO PARA SURTIR SU NEGOCIO Y SUS PEDIDOS. LA SEÑORA SUSANA DIAS B. VA A COMPRAR MERCANCIA, JITOMATES, TOMATES, CHILES. FRIJOL, JAMAICA, MAIZ ETC. PARA SURTIR SU NEGOCIO. ANGELICA L. H. VA A COMPRAR REFRESCOS POR MAYOREO Y POR CAJA PARA SURTIR SU NEGOCIO. LA SEÑORA AQUILINA A. A. VA A COMPRAR VERDURAS, MAIZ, PARA MASA, PLATOS Y VASOS DESECHABLE, REFRESCOS, QUESO CREMA, CHILES, TOMATES ETC. PARA PREPARA SUS ALIMENTOS DE ANTOJITOS MEXICANOS. LA SEÑORA BLANCA C. M. VA A COMPRAR HIERBAS MEDICINALES POR MAYOREA Y POR BULTO Y PARTE LO INVIERTE EN MATERIA PRIMA PARA PREPARAR SUS PASTELES. LA SEÑORA ANAHY O. Q. VA A COMPRAR HARINA POR BULTO, AZUCAR POR BULTO, Y CANASTOS PARA EL PAN.

LA SEÑORA FLORENCIA V. S. LE QUIERE DECIR A KIVA Y A FUNDACION REALIDAD “QUE TENGAN MAS CONFIANZA EN LA GENTE, QUE NOS PRESTEN MAS”
texts.en:
This group is called “Mujeres Divinas” (Divine Women). It is in the community of Axochiapan in the Mexican state of Morelos. It has 7 members who know each other well because they are all neighbors. This is their second loan with Fundación Realidad. The group representative is Florencia V. S., 51. She finished 7th grade and has a total of 5 children, 3 boys and 2 girls. Deyser is 29, Herick is 24, Efrain is 12 and in school, Vianey is 30 and Yussell is 26. Florencia has a business where she sells decorative metal work. She sells doors, windows, display cases, glass and aquariums. She requested funds to buy aluminum frames. Florencia started her business 25 years ago. They lived in Mexico City and a young man from there became associated with her husband and taught him how to do this kind of work in aluminum. Prior to having this business she only sold glass in Mexico City. She saved up and gradually purchased merchandise and, with what this young man taught them, they were able to expand their glass business to include aluminum iron work. Now, they tend to their business from their home in Axochiapan and it’s important for them because it is their future. They earn income for the future and income from the business has provided for the education of their children and she hopes will continue to provide for the education of her youngest who still is in school. What she enjoys most is seeing the finished work, the windows, doors and display cases. She remembers that when her children started to learn the business they liked it too. One of them even has his own similar business. Customers from Axochipan and surrounding areas come to her store. Axochiapan is a very tranquil place that has all necessary services. The other group members are: Ana Lidia C. R., who will buy women and men’s shoes. Susana Dias B. who will buy merchandise like tomatoes, chilies, beans, hibiscus flowers, corn, etc. Agnelica L. H. who will buy soft-drinks at wholesale and by the case. Aquilina A. A. who will buy vegetables like corn to make masa, disposable dishes and drinking glasses, soft drinks, cream cheese, chilies, tomatoes, etc. for her snack business. Blanca C. M. will buy medicinal herbs at wholesale and bulk and will use part of the loan for her cake baking business. Anahy O. Quinones will buy flour and sugar in bulk as well as bread baskets. Florencia V. S. wants to say to Kiva and Fundacion Realidad: “Have more confidence in the people, lend us more.”

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy aluminum frames.

loans.name: Mesepa

texts.en:
Mesepa T. is 34 and married with 3 children between one and five. She owns a business providing clothing alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Mesepa has 3 years of experience in this business. She needs a loan of WST$1250 to purchase fabrics and materials  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Mesepa joined SPBD in 2008. This is her third loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Mesepa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD:  In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: to purchase fabrics & materials

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María de 58 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, llamada la Isla Trinitaria porque esta rodeada de un estero). Ella tiene un puesto de venta de ropa, desde hace años. 

Trabajo como vendedora de artesanías en un puesto de en el centro, pero como tenia pocos ingresos ya que se quedo viuda con dos hijos comenzó a vender ropa, después que paso un tiempo de haber muerto su esposo pudo conseguir un puesto en el mercado para vender ropa. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 14h00. 

Para poder continuar con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y artesanías, en el futuro quiere tener un local propio y terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
María, 58, lives along Guayaquil’s beltway (a periurban area called Isla Trinitaria because it’s surrounded by an estuary). She has had a clothing sales booth for several years. At one time she worked selling crafts in a stand downtown but because income was low and she was widowed with two children to support she started to sell clothing. Some time after her husband’s death she was able to get a stand in the market to sell her clothing. She is open for business from 7am until 2pm. To continue with her business she needs funds to buy clothing and crafts. In the future, she’d like to own her own locale and finish building her house

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For clothing and crafts.

loans.name: Seepa

texts.en:
Seepa T. is 63 and married with 8 children between 17 and 35. She owns a taro and banana plantation and has 4 years of experience in this business. Seepa needs a loan of WST$2500 to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Seepa joined SPBD in 2007. This is her 7th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Seepa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra. Reina M. se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotaría, tiene una pequeña pulperia el cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “REINA” misma que esta ubicada en su casa de habitación
Doña Reina cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en este tipo de negocio y es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar, en su negocio tiene una gran variedad de producto para la venta especialmente lo más necesario para el consumo diario como ser: Azúcar, Arroz, Café, pollo, maseca, manteca, huevos etc.
Doña Reina esta casada con el señor Wilmer Girón el cual es policía, de ellos dependen 3 personas.
las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio las necesita para pagar la crianza y gastos escolares de sus hijos. 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor para obtener mayores ganancias las cuales las necesita para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Reina M. is a merchant, and her main activity is selling groceries. She has a small grocery store, which operates under the name of Reina Grocery Store. It is located in her house. Reina has five years of experience in this type of business. It is notable that during this time she has known how to manage the business. There is a great variety of products for sale in her business. She especially carries products that are most needed for daily consumption like sugar, rice, coffee, chicken, cornmeal, shortening, and eggs, etc. Reina is married to Wilmer Girón, a policeman. They have three dependents. They need the earnings they get from the business to pay for raising their children and the children’s educational expenses. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise wholesale in order to get greater earnings. They need the earnings to give their children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cereal, powdered milk, soup, noodles, toilet paper, medicines,toothe paste, shortening, oil, and sanitary napkins

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Santa Maria Jaloxtoc Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SOLIDARIO SE LLAMA SANTA MARIA JALOXTOC PORQUE ES EL NOMBRE DE LA IGLESIA DEL PUEBLO. ESTA UBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD DE JALOXTOC, EN EL ESTADO DE MORELOS, MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 5 INTEGRANTES QUE SE CONOCEN POR SER VECINOS. ESTE ES SU 1er. PRESTAMO CON FUNDACION RALIDAD. 
LA INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO MONICA B. J. TIENE 30 AÑOS DE EDAD Y ESTUDIO HASTA EL 6º: GRADO DE PRIMARIA Y TIENE 2 HIJOS, JUAN ANTONIO TIENE 12 AÑOS Y CRISTHIAN JESUS TIENE 8 AÑOS DE EDAD. LA SEÑORA MONICA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PERFUMES Y COSMETICOS POR CATALAGO DE LA MARCA "JAFRA" Y NECESITA SU PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR PERFUMES, LAPIZ LABIAL, SOMBRAS Y COSMETICOS DE JAFRA. INICIO SU NEGOCIO HACE 4 AÑOS LE DIERON UN VOLANTE PARA UNA PLATICA Y LE PARECIO BUENO PORQUE LE DA TIEMPO DE CUIDAR  A SUS HIJOS EN ESPECIAL AL MAS PEQUEÑO  QUE ESTA DISCAPACITADO NO PUEDE HABLAR TIENE ATRAZO PSICOMOTOR  ASISTEN A TERAPIAS A LA CD. DE CUAUTLA. SU NEGOCIO ES IMPORTANTE POR QUE ES EL SOSTEN DE SU FAMILIA Y LE PONE ENTUSIASMO A SUS VENTAS PARA QUE EL NEGOCIO NO CAIGA. LAS GANACIA LAS UTILIZA PARA IR PAGANDO EL PRESTAMO Y PARA LAS TERAPIAS DE SU HIJO Y DE ELLA YA QUE LE COBRAN POR CADA TERAPIA Y EL PASAJE PARA TRASLADARSE A CUAUTLA Y A SU DOMICILIO. "TENER UN NIÑO DISCAPACITADO ES VIVIR LA VIDA DIFERENTE A LOS DEMAS" COMENTA MONICA. 
SU NEGOCIO ENFRENTA COMPETENCIA DE MAS PERSONAS QUE VENDEN LOS MISMOS PRODUCTOS. SUS SUEÑOS SON TENER UN LOCAL YA ESTABLECIDO PARA NO CAMINAR DE CASA EN CASA. EN EL PUEBLO DE JALOXTOC SE VE MUY BONITO EL CAMPO, HAY 2 JAGUEY, LA FIESTA DEL PUEBLO ES EL 8 DE DICIEMBRE FESTEJANDO A SANTA MARIA Y ESE DÍA HAY MISA, MARIACHIS Y COMIDA PARA TODA LA GENTE QUE ASISTE. 
LOS OTROS INTERANTES DEL GRUPO SON:
*MARIA DE LOURDES M. B. VA A COMPRAR PERFUMES DE DAMA CABALLERO, LAPIZ LABIAL Y SOMBRAS PARA SURTIR SU NEGOCIO.
*SABINA H. M. VA A COMPRAR AZUCAR, POPOTES, BOLSAS, SABORES, FRUTAS ETC. PARA ELABORAR SUS PALETAS DE HIELO. 
*RUFINA R. CANUTOVA A COMPRAR CALZADO PARA EMPEZAR CON EL NEGOCIO, 
*CRISTINA C. B. VA A COMPRAR VERDURAS Y FRUTAS PARA INCREMENTAR SU NEGOCIO 

LA SEÑORA MONICA DICE: “GRACIAS POR CONFIAR EN MI, POR TENDERME LA MANO Y PROMETO NO DEFRAUDARLO Y SEGUIR ADELANTE”.
texts.en:
This united group is called Santa Maria Jaloxtoc because it is the name of the church of the village. It is located in the village of Jaloxtoc, in the state of Morelos, Mexico. The group is made up of 5 members who know each other because they are neighbors. This is their first loan with Fundacion Realidad. The member Monica B. J. is 30, and went to school through the sixth grade. She has 2 sons, Juan Antonio, 12, and Cristhian Jesus, 8. Monica sells perfumes and cosmetics through a catalog of the “Jafra” brand. She needs the loan to buy perfumes, lipsticks, eye shadows and cosmetics from Jafra. She started her business 4 years ago when she was given a flyer to come to a talk and she thought this business was a good idea because she would have time to take care of her children, especially the youngest. He is handicapped. He can’t speak and he is slow physically so they go for therapy in the city of Cuatla. Her business is important because it is what supports the family and she puts a lot of energy into it so that sales don’t fall off. She will use the earnings to pay off the loan and for her son’s therapy and for her since she has to pay for each session and for the transportation to Cuatla from her home. “ To have a handicapped child is to live life differently from other people,” says Monica. Her business has competition from others who sell the same products. Her dream is to set up her own stand so that she doesn’t have to sell from house to house. In the village of Jaloxtoc the countryside is beautiful. There are 2 jagueys (trees). The village feast is the 8th of December honoring Santa Maria and there is a Mass on that day, mariachis, and food for all the people who attend. The other people of the group are: Maria de Lourdes M. B. who is going to buy perfumes for woman and cologne for men, lipsticks and eye shadows to supply her business. Sabina H. M. who will buy sugar, straws, bags, flavorings and fruit, etc to make ice cream popsicles. Rufina R. Canutova who will buy shoes to start a business. Christina C. B. who will buy vegetables and fruit to increase her business. Monica says “thanks for trusting in me, for offering me help and I promise not to be dishonest, and to continue getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfumes and cometics from Jafra.

loans.name: Florina

texts.en:
Florina S. A. L. is 23 and married with two small children. She owns a business providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members and has 5 years of experience in this business. Florina needs a loan of WST$2000 to purchase fabrics and materials. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Florina joined SPBD in 2007. This is her 5th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Florina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. loans.name: Edith Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Edith del Carmen Rodríguez A. es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos y reside en la colonia Santa Ana de Jamastran en Danli, El Paraiso. 

La Sra. Edith es una madre empresaria que tiene su propio negocio que opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia "Edith". En su tienda general, la Sra. Edith vende gran variedad de productos con enfoque en los de consumo diario, por ejemplo: Azúcar, Arroz, Café, pollo, maseca, manteca, huevos, etc.

Con el prestamo, la Sra. Edith comprara azúcar, Arroz, Café, pollo, Maseca, Manteca, Huevos, Pan, Jabon, Papel Higienico, Churros, Harina de Trigo, Confites, Pasta Dental, Toallas Sanitarias, Galletas, Pastillas, Desinfectantes, Candelas, Fosforos, Baterias y Fresco en Polvo.

La Sra. Edith utilizara las ganancias incrementales que obtendra de su negocio para continuar pagando los gastos escolares de sus hijos y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Edith del Carmen Rodríguez A. is the single mother of two children. She lives in the Santa Ana de Jamastran neighborhood of Danli, El Paraiso. Ms. Edith is an enterprising mother who has her own business, which she runs under the name, “Pulperia Edith” (Edith’s General Store). [She] sells a large variety of products in her store, and focuses on daily consumables, such as sugar, rice, coffee, chicken, dough, lard, eggs, etc. Edith will use the money from this loan to buy bread, soap, bathroom tissue, churros, wheat flour, confectionary items, toothpaste, sanitary napkins, cookies, pills, disinfectant, candles, matches, batteries, and powdered air freshener.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Albertina pertenece al Banco Comunal Despertar hace 2 años y lo que mas le gusta son el incentivo del ahorro y las reuniones amenas que la distraen mucho.
Albertina es conviviente y tiene 31 años, Albertina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, negocio que inicio hace 2 años, Además Albertina vende emoliente de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de las Americas, para lo cual cuenta con una carreta.
Albertina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, fideo.
texts.en:
Albertina has belonged to the Despertar (Awake) communal bank for the past 2 years, and what she likes most about it is the incentive to save, as well as the meetings she enjoys so much. Albertina is 31 years old and cohabits. She has a shop in her house, where she sells general groceries. She started the business 2 years ago and is also a street vendor in the Americas market, selling ‘emoliente’ (a traditional hot drink) from her cart. Albertina needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of sugar, rice and noodles.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and noodles.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila es viuda, tiene 53 años y 5 hijos de los cuales 1 estudia, Domitila tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa y también viaja a las ferias 5 veces por semana en donde vende ropa, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Domitila es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar y lo que mas le gusta es el incentivo al ahorro, solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles para comprar pantalones, casacas y polos.
Domitila desea tener capital propio y surtir con mas mercadería.
texts.en:
Domitila is a 53-year old widow and has 5 children, one of whom is a student. She has a stall in the 12th April market, where she sells clothes. She also travels to street markets five times a week, selling the clothes she buys in Lima. Domitila is a member of the Despertar (Awaken) communal bank and what she likes most about it is the incentive to save. She is requesting a loan of 2000 soles with which to buy trousers, jackets and polo shirts. Domitila would like to have her own capital and to stock up on merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy trousers, jackets and polo shirts.

loans.name: Nua Seneuefa

texts.en: Nua Seneuefa S. is 30 and married with three children, aged from 3 to 8. She is starting a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale and needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Nua Seneuefa plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or USD 125 per week) to improve and expand her business. Nua Seneuefa joined SPBD In 2010 and this is her first loan with them. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia es viuda y tiene 3 hijos D. los cuales 2 estudian en la universidad, Aurelia es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar y lo que le agrada son los prestamos fáciles que le ayudan en su negocio.
Aurelia tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 D. abril en donD. vendía mochilas, actividad que dejo D. realizar porque su mama se encuentra mal D. salud y tiene que atenderla, por lo cual alquilo el puesto, ahora venD. sus productos solo los días domingos en la feria. Además Aurelia hace papa seca en su casa, la papa lo compra D. los productores y luego lo venD. en el mercado D. abastos.
Aurelia socia un crédito D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. papa.
Aurelia sueña con que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y vivir tranquila con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a widow and has 3 children of which 2 are university students. Aurelia is a member of the community bank Despertar, and what pleases her are the available loans that help her in her business. Aurelia has a stall at the April 12 Market where she sold backpacks. She had to stop this activity because her mother is ill and she needs to take care of her. She has rented out her stall and now sells her products only on Sundays at the street market. Aurelia also makes Peruvian potatoes (papa seca) in her home, she buys the potatoes from distributors and sell them at the market. Aurelia is requesting a loan of 2000 soles, money which she will use in the purchase of potatoes. Aurelia dreams of her children finishing their studies and of a quiet life with them.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potatoes.
